Name: Alamos Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Alamos Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas of red fruit flavors, sweet spice and a touch of fresh mint. Garnet jewel toned, this Cabernet Sauvignon is full and soft with layers of red currant and cassis, notes of cigar box, leather and ripe black fruits. The wine finishes with finely grained tannins that add structure and length.
Review: "Aromas of tobacco, tea and dark fruit. Mediumbody, firm and silky tannins. Juicy fruit. Delicious cab. Dry and fresh"

Name: Alamos Malbec
TastingNotes: The Alamos Malbec has dark, blackish purple color. The nose shows ripe black fruits, black pepper spice and floral notes. The mouthfeel is full yet soft and supple, with black raspberry and currant flavors mingled with notes of sweet spice and a touch of leather. The finish is long and persistent with soft, sweet tannins.

Name: Martini & Rossi Asti Spumante
TastingNotes: Low in alcohol, low in acidity, fresh, fruity and highly aromatic.
Review: åÊDecanter 90 pointsåÊ(MayåÊ2018)

Name: Joseph Drouhin Pouilly Fuisse
TastingNotes: The color is golden, with some green reflections. Among the floral and fruity aromas, almond and ripe grapes dominate. On the palate, the wine is refreshingly pleasant, ethereal in its lightness. Long and refreshing aftertaste.

Name: Joseph Drouhin Beaujolais Villages
TastingNotes: Bright purple color, a very intense nose, reminiscent of violets, peonies and red berries. On the palate, it has a silky smoothness, and its delicious fruit lingers for a long time.

Name: Joseph Drouhin Laforet Bourgogne Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: The hue has usually a brillant ruby-garnet colour. The nose offers effusive aromas of crushed berries (raspberry, redcurrant and blackcurrant come to mind). On the palate, the wine is full of charm and very pleasant to drink : fresh and fruity berry flavours with light and elegant tannins.

Name: Nederburg Pinotage Winemaster's Reserve
TastingNotes: Well-balanced, rich fruitflavours with soft tanninsand a lingering finish.

Name: Ravenswood Zinfandel Vintners Blend
TastingNotes: Robust red, brimming with mouthwatering flavors of spicy ripe raspberry, cherry and boysenberry.

Name: Ravenswood Merlot Vintners Blend
TastingNotes: Full of smooth tannins, this Merlot shines with bright fruit flavors of black plum and cherry along with olive and spice.

Name: Pepperwood Grove Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Garnet in color, the nose has notes of rose water and cherry preserves. This delicate pinot starts soft with fresh strawberry and bing cherry fruit and finishes with rich plum, light clove and earthy tones.

Name: Pepperwood Grove Merlot
TastingNotes: Dark ruby in color with aromas of raspberries, crÌ¬me brulee, and a hint of chocolate and oregano. This Merlot has flavors of strawberry rhubarb pie, plums, green olives with pimentos, and cinnamon finishing with dried apricots, mild green tea, and toasty American oak.

Name: Smoking Loon Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Cedar, sandalwood, plum and cherry flavors carry over nicely to the palate, where the flavors are intense and well proportioned. Long, complex aftertaste. Drink now.

Name: Smoking Loon Merlot
TastingNotes: This Merlot is dark garnet in color and has aromas of fresh basil, blueberries, and Bing cherries. With good richness without being too heavy on the palate, the flavors of fresh cherry pie, sweet plum, and soft cinnamon spiked cranberry dressing finishing with notes of rich, vanilla French oak and delicate cherry and strawberry flavors.

Name: Smoking Loon Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Behind the light straw color are aromas of sweet spring flowers, green tea, and a touch of fresh pineapple. The palate is framed by flavors of lemon meringue, fresh papaya, limestone, and subtle nuances of clove finishing with nectarine and light vanilla oak tones.

Name: Hess Chardonnay Monterey
TastingNotes: Tropical aromas of freshly cut pineapple and ripe pear. A soft entry of well-balanced fruit and oak persists all the way to a pleasing finish of honeydew melon and creme brulee.

Name: Luna di Luna Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: This wine offers a light and refreshingly crisp finish with the taste of fresh melons and berries. Soft yellow in color with well-balanced tones of apples

Name: Luna di Luna Merlot & Cabernet
TastingNotes: Luscious layers of blackberry, raspberry, and ripe plum with abundant forward fruit flavors.

Name: Black Opal Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Bright straw in color. Aromas of peach, melon and citrus develop into a crisp and delicious finish.

Name: Black Opal Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: The rich varietal blackcurrant, mint and spice noseis well supported by a palate that is full of fruit flavor, balanced by the subtle use of oak. The wine is warm in the mouth and the tannins are soft and well integrated.

Name: J Sparkling Wine
TastingNotes: This J non-vintage Brut gracefully opens up with crisp lemon peel, honeysuckle and delicate yeast aromas. Upon entry, these notes follow through to a mix of Fuji apple and grapefruit interlaced with toast, caramel and almond flavors on the mid-palate. The acidity adds just enough liveliness and the citrus zest leads to a lingering, warm pear and lush finish. Demonstrating an illustrious combination of yesterday and today, its fresh exuberance showcases layers of depth and complexity.

Name: Cambria Chardonnay Katherine's Vineyard
Review: "Caramelized apple, seared pear, honeysuckle, a touch of buttercream and vanilla ice cream on the even, well-measured nose. The flavors lean more green but not under-ripe, with lime juice, green apple and green mango."

Name: Blackstone Winery Merlot
TastingNotes: Rich fruit aromas, elegance, supple oak characters and soft tannins. With lifted dark cherry and berry aromas and a touch of spicy clove, this wine is sure to be a crowd-pleaser. The texture is ripe and soft in the mouth, with bright cherry fruit flavors and a soft, lingering finish.

Name: Yellow Tail Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Citrus and honeydew flavors are further complexed by gentle French oak aging. The palate is soft yet fresh with balanced acidity and a soft creamy finish.

Name: Yellow Tail Shiraz
TastingNotes: Impressive spice, licorice and red berry aromas. This wine is perfectly balanced with silky tannins, accompanied by big, ripe fruit flavors.

Name: Freixenet Cava Brut Cordon Negro
TastingNotes: Cordon Negro Brut is crisp, clean and well balanced. The dosage is very dry, but the acidity is lower than most champagnes for a softer, smoother flavor. It is medium-bodied with a moderately long and clean finish.
Review: Clean and toasty, with mineral and the slightest hint of mushroom. Full and ripe in the mouth, with toasty apple flavors. Limited in depth and complexity, but full of lemon-lime. åÑ Michael Schachner

Name: La Rocca Pinot Grigio
Review: "Floral and fruity aromas with citrus, peach and almond flavors. Solid acidity and balance with a pleasant mineral quality that is unmistakably Collio. A wonderful compliment to nearly any seafood dish."

Name: Giesen Estate Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: A great range of aromas and flavors that seem to change and evolve in the glass. We get citrus, crushed herbs and a distinctive gooseberry lift with green notes reminiscent of fresh pea pods but also a sweet leafy boxwood aroma. On the palate there are flavors of grapefruit and red capsicum where mid palate fruit sweetness is balanced by a fresh, lively citrus acidity.

Name: Francis Coppola Rosso
TastingNotes: The clour is of deep garnet with rich aromas of sweet fruit and vanilla. On the palate jammy strawberry, with hints of plum, boysenberry, spice, and vanilla tones.

Name: Francis Ford Coppola Diamond Collection Claret Black Label
TastingNotes: A perfectly balanced and elegantly textured wine with supple tannins, rich fruit concentration and alluring notes of spice and wood.

Name: Francis Ford Coppola Diamond Collection Merlot Blue Label
TastingNotes: Our Blue Label Merlot has brilliant, deep garnet color with aromas of bright red cherries and clove spice. Supple red plum and black cherry flavors highlight the palate, with subtle notes of light milk chocolate and vanilla bean evident on the long finish.

Name: Francis Coppola Chardonnay Diamond Series
TastingNotes: The colour is golden sunshine with aromas of tropical fruit mingling with pears. On the palate cantaloupe, crisp apple, and oak with a subtlehint of vanilla and crÌ¬me brulee on the finish.

Name: Cielo Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Clean and fresh with balanced fruit and acidity anda hint of spice on the finish. Best drunk young.

Name: Ramsay Pinot Noir
TastingNotes:
Nose: This wine has a nose full of the wonderful richness that good Pinot Noir is famous foråÑlots of berry aromas, subtle mushroom complexity and toasty oak.

Mouth: The mouth explodes with blueberry, Bing cherry, anise and toast. Even more striking is the depth and richness of the mouth-feel, like rich, thick, red velvet for the mouth. The wine is very fruity, with blackberry characters and a big, rich, tarry and solid balance. The oak is refined and quite opulent with its åÒwarmåÓ characters.

Name: Chateau Puech Haut Cuvee Prestige Red
Review: "The 2015 Saint Drezery Prestige is a ripe, sexy beauty that gives up full-bodied notes of black cherries, melted licorice and roasted herbs. Like all the wines from this estate, it has lots of richness and texture, yet stays balanced, lively and pure. It's a year in and year out value that's a no-brainer purchase. It will drink beautifully over the coming 4-5 years (possibly even longer)."

Name: Excelsior Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Blackish plum in color. A medium-to-full bodied wine. Displays sweet, plummy notes on nose, with vanilla, chocolate and blackcurrants on palate. Has soft, ripe tannins and a long velvety finish.

Name: Hunter Chaps Pinot Noir
Review: "This is plush and generous, offering round plum, currant, raspberry and cherry flavors that linger enticingly on the rich finish. It's everything a Pinot Noir should be--elegant, seductive and tasty."

Name: King Estate Pinot Gris Oregon
TastingNotes: Light straw color with an emerald green hue. Aromasof green apples, citrus, honeysuckle, white peach, and floral notes. Pear, melon, lemon and lime, wet stone, kiwi, and honey on the palate. The mouthfeel has soft rich entry, nice texture, good weight, and a long lively crisp finish.

Name: Villa Rosa Gavi del Comune di Gavi
TastingNotes: This Gavi is fragrant and fruity, with nuances of apples and melons in the aroma. It has a dry, elegant taste with a refreshingly clean finish. Enjoy it chilled and young.

Name: Beaulieu Vineyard Bv Coastal Merlot
TastingNotes: Dark ruby color. Fully ripe plummy aromas with hints of dark chocolate, subtle herbs and black cherry herald similarly intense fruit flavors. Medium-full bodied, with a velvety texture and ripe, lush fruit balanced by subtle acidity and mild tannins. This Coastal Merlot is juicy and deep.

Name: Beaulieu Vineyard Bv Coastal Cabernet Sauvinon
TastingNotes: Dark ruby-violet color. This Coastal Cabernet Sauvignon promises much, and delivers more! The aromas suggest black and green peppercorn, with currant-mint and black tea overtones. Medium bodied, the aromas are echoed on the palate, and completed by hints of dark chocolate. Finishing with a light, velvety texture, this wine is very easy to drink.

Name: Glen Ellen Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Rich, creamy flavors of pear and butterscotch with a clean finish.

Name: Bogle Vineyards Petite Sirah
TastingNotes: Ripe summer blackberries and plums overwhelm both the nose and palate of this wine. Its trademark inky, jammy qualities are a barrage of black fruit and spice, adding layer upon layer of complexity. Notes of supple leather and toasty oak envelop the flavors through the finish, giving way to wisps of caramel and vanilla. The firm tannins make this a wine that can develop for years to come, but you wonåÕt want to wait that long to enjoy it!

Name: Bogle Vineyards Merlot
TastingNotes: From the winery, "Developed and intense fruit from this harvest has produced one of our most full-bodied merlots yet! Deep cherry fruit hits both the nose and palate upon the first sip, followed by soft hints of summer anise. Touches of pipe tobacco and spicy oak lend weight to the finish, trailed by firm, assertive tannins."

Name: Bogle Vineyards Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Aromas of fruit and spice mingle and tantalize the senses as you first encounter this Chardonnay. Green apples and juicy pears give way to elegant hints of Meyer lemons, but circle back to finish ripe and refreshing on the palate. Created by aging on the lees, the rich and velvety mouthfeel takes the fruit to another level, allowing the flavors to sink softly into spicy vanilla notes of American oak. The finish, graceful as a lemon meringue, perfectly balances the wineåÕs creaminess and acidity.

Name: Bogle Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Irresistible vanilla and intriguing black cherry lay way to the rich, supple wine that is the Cabernet Sauvignon. Wisps of tobacco smoke linger on the palate, reminiscent of grandfatheråÕs old pipe. Cinnamon, clove and nutmeg are left by the 14 months of aging in American oak. Ample tannins and an enduring finish will allow this wine to cellar for another 6-8 years, but donåÕt let anyone say you canåÕt enjoy it now!

Name: Kendall Jackson Chardonnay Vintners Reserve
Review: "This wine interlaces a light buttery-oak nuance with vibrant, appealing fruit flavors. It's medium weight yet fresh, with a smooth, well-balanced palate that displays a harmonized mix of savory oak and citrus nuances."

Name: Kendall-Jackson Cabernet Sauvignon Vintner's Reserve
TastingNotes: "Opens with deep black cherry, blackberry and cassis flavors. Intense, round and well-structured tannins provide a strong backbone throughout the middle. Cedar and vanilla notes linger on the finish, beckoning another sip." åÐ Randy Ullom, Winemaster
Review: "This is a well-made wine at a more-than-fairprice. Labeled varietally, it also holds smaller additions of other Bordeaux red grapes, most notably 6% Cabernet Franc. Black pepper, leather and cassis surround smoky oak and firm, integrated tannin, making for a complex, full-bodied and balanced experience."

Name: Kendall-Jackson Sauvignon Blanc Vintner's Reserve
TastingNotes: "Lime, melon and Anjou pears intermingle with sweetand tropical fruits such as fig and kiwi to create this delightfully refreshing wine. Hints of grapefruit highlight the mineral qualities of this wineåÕs surprisingly long finish." åÐ Randy Ullom, Winemaster

Name: Kendall-Jackson Merlot Vintner's Reserve
TastingNotes: "Intense wild berry and mocha flavors are accented by black cherry, currant and anise notes. Well structured, yet subtle tannins create a luxuriously smooth mouthfeel followed by a complex, rich and elegant finish." åÐ Randy Ullom, Winemaster

Name: Cloudy Bay Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Cloudy Bay Sauvignon Blanc succeeded in drawing NewZealand on the wine map and establishing the Marlborough wine region globally. This iconic wine is fresh, vibrant and aromatic. A vibrant mix of kaffir lime, lemon zest and nectarine aromatics intermingle with the bright perfume of orange blossom. The palate is brimming with ripe citrus and stone fruit flavours that are framed by sleek and succulent acid architecture.
Review: "This iconic Marlborough sauvignon is in full tropical-fruit mode in 2018, bursting with passion fruit and limes, as well as sweet melon and peaches. The palate is packed with flavor. Passion fruit and mango rule the finish. Drink now."

Name: Dr. Loosen Dr. L Riesling
TastingNotes: Notes of apple and peach notes are backed by livelyacidity.

Name: Fetzer Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: On the nose youåÕll find deep, rich aromas of blackberry, cassis,cherry and vanilla, with evident spice from the oak and a hint of herbs. Tasting delivers a rich layered texture of ripe blackberry mocha, toffee and vanilla. Medium to firm tannins provide structure and balance to this medium-bodied Cabernet. Excellent now, the wine will continue to evolve and mature nicely in the bottle for several years to come.

Name: Fetzer Riesling
TastingNotes: Bright apricots, apples, peaches åÑ thereåÕs a bushelbasket of flavorsand aromas in every glass. The wine is delicate, yet full and pairswonderfully well with spicy Thai or Asian foods, as well as traditionalholiday foods like baked ham or turkey. ThereåÕs dried fruit and zesty lemon on the nose, with notes of lavender, jasmine and rose petal. As you taste, the crisp acid balances nicely in a well structured wine that offers peaches, pineapple and pear in a smooth, rich, mellow finish.Slightly sweet, but barely noticeable with the fruit-forward flavors.

Name: Fetzer Sundial Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Valley Oaks Chardonnay is characteristically goldenstraw in color, with aromas of tropical fruit layered with lemon grass, lime, a touch of peach and some herbal notes of clove. The wine is crafted to be medium weight, with vanilla, baked apple and pear alongside flavors of citrus and grapefruit. You wonåÕt be disappointed in this vintage:itåÕs like saying hello to an old friend.

Name: Estancia Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Estancia Cabernet Sauvignon displays dense black currant, lush chocolate, and dark cherry fruit flavors followed by a long, supple finish.

Name: Fontana Candida Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Pronounced bouquet of exotic fruit and wildflowers with a touch of honey. This wine is dry and balanced with crisp fruit flavors.

Name: Geyser Peak Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Gooseberry and grapefruit flavors, beautifully balanced by clean, crisp acidity.

Name: Quinta Do Noval Port Tawny
TastingNotes: åÒSilky-tasting, with very fresh and vibrant flavorsof dark plum, chocolate and spice. The lush finish is supple and refined.åÓ Wine Spectator

Name: Quinta Do Noval Ruby
TastingNotes: A bright ruby color, with an intense, youthful nosereminiscent of wild cherries. Well-balanced on the palate, it displays intense fruit and good length.

Name: Mouton Cadet Bordeaux Rouge
TastingNotes: The wine has a deep red color. The nose is intense with blackberry and cassis aromas. On the palate, notes of red berry fruit unfold with a touch of mineral. Finishes with well-rounded tannins.

Name: Mouton Cadet Bordeaux Blanc
TastingNotes: Light straw in color. A fresh nose with floral notes and a hint of toast. Expressive with ripe fruit and a slight mineral tinge.

Name: Fonseca Bin No. 27 Finest Reserve Porto
Louis Jadot Beaujolais Villages
TastingNotes: This brilliant garnet wine is bright and fresh, with ripe, supple crushed strawberry flavors underscored by zesty nuances of peppercorns, gentle tannins and a clean acidity, finishing on a succulent, refreshing note.

Name: Louis Jadot Macon Villages
TastingNotes: This fresh, brilliant pale-gold Chardonnay shows delicate varietal aromas with flavors of apple and melon offset by citrus notes and a crisp acidic balance ending in a clean, lively finish.

Name: Louis Jadot Pouilly Fuisse
TastingNotes: Ripe, supple and of medium body, this classic expression of Pouilly-FuissÌ© shows vibrant Chardonnay fruit flavors with notes of melon and minerals, gently touched with oak, ending in a fresh, silky finish.

Name: Louis Jadot Bourgogne Blanc
TastingNotes: The lovely, elegant Chardonnay has nice buttery notes with honeyed pear and fresh apples, offset by a gentle touch of vanilla. Excellent balance of fruit and acidity on the palate with a lingering finish.

Name: Korbel Brut
TastingNotes: Korbel Brut is light and crisp, with spicy fruit flavors. It is finished with a 1% dosage for a balanced medium-dry finish
Review: åÊWine Advocate 92 pointsåÊ(FebåÊ2018)

Name: Korbel Extra Dry
TastingNotes: Korbel Extra Dry is a crisp, off dry champagne, which is light, refreshing and very easy to like. Extra Dry has flavors of citrus, melon and spice

Name: Dancing Bull Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Notes of blackberry, black cherry and raspberry mixwith spicy notes of pepper and vanilla on the finish.

Name: Frei Brothers Merlot
TastingNotes: Ruby hues with aromas and flavors of blackberry andcherry, with hints of vanilla and spices. Well balanced with a soft, lingering finish.

Name: Sutter Home White Zinfandel
TastingNotes: This wine is a classic example of the style established by Bob Trinchero when he invented the varietal 30 years ago. Delicate blush pink in color, with sweet aromas of strawberries and watermelon. On the palate, the wine is fresh and lively and bursting with fruit. A light creaminess is evident, with a refreshing crisp finish.

Name: Markham Merlot
TastingNotes: This Merlot is typical of the vintage in that respect. Aromas of violets and blackberry briars remind one of Cabernet Sauvignon while the fleshy texture alludes to Merlot. The attractive sweet espresso and black raspberry flavors add to the mystery. A bit of bottle age should allow the spicy, cherry fruit and vanilla oak to shine.

Name: Robert Mondavi Merlot Private Selection California
TastingNotes: Our Merlot displays all the attributes that make this variety so popular: bright aromas and flavors of smooth cherry, plum and strawberry with hints of cedar, black olive and spiceåÑsupported by a supple texture with fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. These qualities come from choice Central Coast Merlot grapes, with 9% Syrah for enhanced color and richness. The Central Coast American Viticultural Area (AVA), especially Monterey County, provides the temperate climate, cool breezes and moist alluvial soils in which Merlot thrives, developing ripe, fruity flavors while retaining good balancing acidity. We enhance the wineåÕs pure fruit flavors with just a hint of oak for roundness and complexity.

Name: Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: A classic expression of Napa Valley Cabernet at itsbest: Remarkably rich and concentrated. Tantalizing entry - almost sweet with blackberry essence, it evolves into a plush, mouth filling compote of black fruit, beautifully integrated with woodsy and mineral notes, mocha, tobacco and clove. For all its volume the delivery is surprisingly fresh and supple, with a long, mocha-infused finish.

Name: Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon Private Selection
TastingNotes: This Cabernet Sauvignon brims with blackberries, plums and spices, with soft oak nuances from barrel aging.
Review: åÊUltimate Beverage Challenge 93 pointsåÊ(JunåÊ2014)

Name: Robert Mondavi Chardonnay Private Selection
TastingNotes: The nose reveals ripe apple, melon, citrus and tropical fruit aromas enriched by creamy malolactic tones, spicy French oak nuances and enticing baked bread scents. On the mouthfilling, creamy palate, rich tropical fruit flavors buttressed by toasty oak tones create a lush impression, which is balanced by a long, crisp finish imbued with the refreshing minerality typical of Central Coast Chardonnay.

Name: Cavit Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Dry, light and crisp, and highly versatile, Cavit Pinot Grigio is a wonderful apÌ©ritif and equally splendid with pasta in cream sauces, risottos, veal, chicken and fresh seafood dishes. Enjoy well chilled.

Name: Santa Margherita Prosecco Superiore
TastingNotes: This sparkling wine displays a fine, persistent perlage, while on the nose it offers attractive floral notes of peach and acacia blossom alongside delicate scents of reinette apples, all expressed with great cleanness and elegance. On the palate there is perfect harmony between the fresh and appealingly lively sensations and the roundness and delicacy of the fruit.
Review: åÊDecanter 92 pointsåÊ(JanåÊ2019)

Name: Corvo Nero d'Avola Sicilia Red
TastingNotes: The wine is lively ruby-red in color with garnet nuances; the aroma is intense, complex, fruity with scents of morello cherry; it is dry and full to the palate, full-bodied and persistent.

Name: Corvo Bianco
TastingNotes: Bright pale yellow in color with green nuances. Thearoma is intense, delicate and fruity, and is well balanced on the palate.

Name: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
TastingNotes: The wine boasts a fresh, clean fragrance that is followed by a crisp, refreshing flavor with hints of citrus fruits. This wine is well-structured and sophisticated, a perfect choice for entertaining!

Name: Markham Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Briary aromas mingle with fresh blackberries and caramel oak highlight in this Cabernet Sauvignon. Dense, plum jam flavors support the solid core of tannins on the finish. Vanilla toast and nutmeg spice things up as the wine continues to open in the glass.

Name: Markham Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This wine feels like a vacation! Let the tropical floral and fruit aromas take you away. The honeysuckle, white peach and citrus zest in the nose are mimicked in the mouth with crisp flavors that refresh. The rich, viscous mouth feel should make this Sauvignon Blanc great to pair with your favorite meal or lounging poolside.

Name: Rutherford Hill Merlot
TastingNotes: Flavors of dark cherries and chocolate abound in this soft and fleshy, balanced Merlot. The finish is silky and lingering with a hint of vanilla, cinnamon and tobacco.
Review: "Blended with Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this Merlot is a tannic and powerful wine. It offers earthy flavors of leather and oak around a rich and decadent core of dark plum."

Name: Barton & Guestier Vouvray
TastingNotes: Pale bright color with green highlights. Fresh, intense and elegant nose, dominated by floral notes and white fruit aromas of pear and peach. Lively and harmonious wine, with a perfect balance between sweetness and acidity, and powerful, persistent fruity flavors.

Name: Sandeman Port Tawny
TastingNotes: Clear red amber colors with a light intense body, open up to aromas of vanilla and evolved dried fruits. The elegant harmony and fresh flavor of red fruits unfold in the mouth and combine with the complexity of wood ageing and a good finish.

Name: Sandeman Port Founders Reserve
TastingNotes: Intense ruby red color, brilliant and clean. Rich red fruit aromas with a touch of age create an elegant reflection of powerful flavors, the fruit and fire characteristic of young classic Porto balanced with the finesse of age.
Review: åÊDecanter 90 pointsåÊ(JulåÊ2018)

Name: Hartley & Gibson's Cream Sherry
TastingNotes: Dark gold to velvety brown. A scentful bouquet. Luscious, smooth and richly sweet in flavor with a heavy-body.

Name: Clos du Bois Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This bright and juicy Chardonnay beckons with aromas of apple blossom, ripe pear, peach and sweet lemon drop.

Name: Raymond R Collection Chardonnay
TastingNotes: 100% Chardonnay from Monterey, the R Collection Chardonnay opens with aromas of pineapple, grapefruit, lemon ripe melon, pear and vanilla with a touch of sweet oak. Bright tropical fruit flavors of pineapple and mango followed by kiwi, green apple, pear, vanilla and honey on the finish. Medium-bodied with very light oak influence, this Chardonnay is nicely balanced with a rich, smooth mouthfeel and a long finish.

Name: Rodney Strong Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Aromas of blackberry, cocoa, and currant lead to a rich, layered mouthfeel, replete with black cherry, cedar, and cassis, and structured with lush, mature tannins. Enjoy this seductive cabernet sauvignon now and over the next several years.

Name: Rodney Strong Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Bright lemon and apple aromas mingle with hints of toasty barrel complexity, and on the palate, pear and pineapple with spice and refreshing acidity will have you coming back for another glass.

Name: Rodney Strong Russian River Valley Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Supple in texture, with rose petal and red fruit aromas, this lively, medium bodied wine is aged entirely in French oak, which adds a subtle, toasty vanilla character and a hint of spice. Ideal for current enjoyment, this pinot noir will hold nicely over the next two to three years.

Name: Baron Herzog Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This cool, terroir-oriented wine shows elegant top notes of lime, chamomile and tropical fruit overlaid with a bouquet of toasty oak.

Name: Ruffino Chianti
TastingNotes: Medium-bodied, Chianti Ruffino is characterized by a marvelous freshness that makes Chianti Ruffino a very pleasant and easy to drink wine. Persistent fruity sensations feature a long aftertaste.

Name: Ruffino Orvieto Classico
TastingNotes: The bouquet is very pleasant and fragrant, characterized by neat sensations of citrus fruits and golden apples, on a flowery background that reminds fresh hints of meadow flowers and a persistent vegetal note of sage. On the palate firstly stands out an excellent freshness, well balanced by a pleasant roundness, featured by notes of meadow flowers and golden apples. The aftertaste is long and fragrant, with hits of fresh almond.

Name: Ruffino Chianti Classico Riserva Ducale Tan
TastingNotes: At the palate it is coherent with the olfaction. Sensations of fragrant fresh fruit are accompanied by steady yet gentle tannins, that exalt enjoyable spicy hints. The whole tasting sensation is enriched by a persistent finish, that is incredibly fresh and pleasantly mineral and presents an aftertaste with fascinating notes of rosemary.

Name: Marques de Riscal Rioja Reserva
TastingNotes: Cherry-red color with good robe. Spicy, balsamic aromas of great complexity, with notes of ripe dark berries and light toasted nuances. On the palate it is full and tasty, with good structure and rounded, elegant tannins. The finish is long and fresh, with a slight reminder of the fine oak.

Name: Marques de Riscal Rueda White
TastingNotes: Expansive fruity aroma, pale yellow colour with subtle greenish highlights and on the palate, initial sensation of smooth acidity which turns to caramel under the tongue.

Name: Simi Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Dark red with a ruby cast. Aromas of blackberry, cassis, and plum laced with cedar, spice and rose petals. Lush black cherry and black berry notes are highlighted with vanilla and a dusting of cocoa and herbs.
Review: "Bold, supple blue fruit gives this cabernet an impression of simple, healthy richness, while that exuberance is held in check by a tannic grip that seems to come from fruit skin as much as oak. ItåÕs already accessible, but may gain additional dimension with a few years in bottle. Well-priced and smartly crafted, itåÕs a wine for roast beef."

Name: Simi Chardonnay Sonoma County
TastingNotes: Brilliantly clear, light yellow straw. Vibrant notes of pear, green apple and orange zest, accented by soft hints of cream and toast. Lively on the palate with peach, pear, lemon and pineapple flavors, highlighted with warm spice notes and caramel cream.

Name: St. Francis Winery Zinfandel Old Vine
TastingNotes: This distinct åÒold world styleåÓ Zinfandel displays deep aromas of ripe black cherries and boysenberries laced with licorice, shadowed by spicy toasted oak notes that carry into a long luscious finish.

Name: St. Francis Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Fruit and pear aromas are offset on the palate by hints of oak and vanilla. Medium- to full-bodied, this Chardonnay has ripe fruit flavors, crisp high acid in the mouth, and a rich lingering finish.
Review: "The 2016 Chardonnay Sonoma County is a smoking value. Lemon curd, guava, honeysuckle, and plenty of citrus notes all flow to a pretty, seamless, elegant white that shines from its balance and purity. It's impeccably made and would make a great house white to enjoy over the coming year or two."

Name: St. Francis Merlot
TastingNotes: St Francis Merlot is smooth and elegant with classic flavors and aromas of cherry, chocolate and plum. Its silky structure is balanced by soft tannins and a bold, lengthy finish.

Name: Columbia Crest Grand Estates Merlot
TastingNotes: From the winery, "This complex, artisanally craftedwine offers classic Merlot spice, ripe cherry fruit, and cocoa aromatics which persist on the palate. The balance of wood and black fruits creates a velvety, seductively smooth finish."

Name: Two Vines Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This lighter style Chardonnay opens with aromas of fresh spiced peaches and honeysuckle. Lively fruit flavors are accented by notes of lemon zest and creamy marshmallow ending with a juicy, crisp finish. Intended for immediate enjoyment, this Chardonnay captures the varietal intensity indicative of wines from Washington state.

Name: Domaine Ste. Michelle Brut
TastingNotes: Nicely balanced, Brut is not too dry and not too sweet. This crisp and jazzy wine delivers delicate apple and citrus characteristics with a fresh, light toastiness.

Name: Domaine Ste. Michelle Extra Dry
TastingNotes:
Perfect for those that prefer slightly sweeter sparkling wines. The Extra Dry is a rich, sweet, creamy bubbly that showcases an appealing deep apple flavor, complemented by a toasty finish.

This elegant wine is dry to medium dry. Pear and pineapple aromas leap out of this sparkler while flavors of crisp green apple are lively on the palate. An appealing toasty, coconut finish completes this classic wine.
Review: åÊUltimate Beverage Challenge 87 pointsåÊ(JunåÊ2014)

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Highlights concentrated Washington red fruit in an accessible style. An inviting Cab with plenty of complexity and structure with silky tannins.
Review: "Fresh and expressive, deftly balanced and juicy, with raspberry and cherry flavors supported by hints of cinnamon and pepper. The finish persists against nubby tannins. Drink now through 2020."

Name: Chateau Ste Michelle Merlot
TastingNotes: The wine offers aromas of black cherry, leather andspice with layers of rich dark red fruit flavors.

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Intense aromas and deep flavors of ripe apple intermingle with notes of hazelnut spice, subtle vanilla and butterscotch. The vibrant ripe apple, pear and citrus flavors are seamlessly integrated with a spicy character achieved by barrel fermentation in French oak. The wine`s lush texture is complemented by a smooth, silky finish.

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Columbia Valley Riesling
TastingNotes: A refreshing, off-dry Riesling delivering sweet lime and peach character with subtle mineral notes.

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Aromas of grass, fresh herbs and grapefruit with a clean, fresh finish. The mostly stainless steel fermentation makes this a crisp wine.

Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon Artemis
Review: "The 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Artemis is a blend of 91% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Merlot, 2% Petit Verdot and 1% Malbec. Deep purple-black in color, it opens with notions of crushed black cherries, warm blackberries and mulberries with hints of unsmoked cigars, fragrant soil and wild sage plus a waft of allspice. Medium to full-bodied, it fills the palate with expressive black berry and earthy layers with a frame of grainy tannins and just enough freshness, finishing with an herbal lift."

Name: Sterling Vineyards Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: An excellent value for under $20, this Cabernet expresses spicy black cherry, briary blackberry and mocha aromas.  Hints of clove and anise persist over the lengthy finish and ripe tannins add structure and plush texture on the palate.
Review: "Cassis, redcurrants, fresh herbs, raspberries and red licorice. Medium-bodied with good savoriness to bolster the red berries and acidity crunch. Drink now."

Name: Sterling Vineyards Napa Merlot
TastingNotes: The Sterling Napa Merlot celebrates this varietal with a vibrant, juicy core of red fruit; generous, youthful texture and a balanced spice profile. Following the deep purple hue, aromas of fresh cranberry and black cherry take the stage, complemented by cedar, spicy-floral and dried-herb notes. A great burst of flavor opens the palate, as deep red fruits interweave with cola across a smooth, weighted middle. Oak is the grounding force in the wine, holding it together and adding a toasty richness to the bright fruit profile. The finale is three parts, beginning with toasty clove and vanilla, followed by a burst of cherry compote and finishing with the lingering memory of wood spices.

Name: Sterling Vineyards Napa Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Zesty grapefruit, citrus, fig, and melon highlight the Sterling Napa County Sauvignon Blanc, sourced primarily from vineyards in the northern regions of Napa Valley. We cool-fermented most of the juice in stainless steel to capture the vibrant personality of these grapes, and used older, neutral oak barrels for the balance to enhance the wine's silky texture.

Name: Sterling Vineyards Napa Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Aromas and flavors of fresh pear and ripe apple mingle with vanilla and oak spice from barrel fermentation and aging. Up front, crisp Asian pear, pippin apple and tropical fruit guide the entry, balanced by notes of caramel, ginger and clove. Across the middle, the Carneros grapes show their face, lifting the silky fruit with a distinct lemon essence and sprightly minerality that carries through the finish. Well balanced, with layers of fruit and spice, this wine makes a versatile food companion.

Name: Sterling Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon Vintner's Collection
TastingNotes: The Sterling Vintner's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon combines ripe, rich character with elegance and poise. Black berry fruit and ripe cherries leap from the glass, supported by toasty vanilla and cocoa. Full and fleshy across the midpalate, dark fruit reigns, balanced by good acidity and bright cherry notes. Smooth, fruit-driven tannins cradle the finish, integrating subtle elements of oak and spice.

Name: Sterling Vineyards Chardonnay Vintner's Collection
TastingNotes: Aromas of fresh pineapple, citrus and stone fruit with subtle oak imparts shadows of caramel, vanilla and toast to the fruit. In the mouth, ripe peach, melon and grapefruit dance across the palate, backed by vanilla and baking spice, which lingers for a nice, toasty finish. The mouth-filling creaminess of the wine is perfectly matched in its bright acidity, making it a lovely pairing with rich salmon dishes or roasted chicken.

Name: Sterling Vineyards Merlot Vintner's Collection
TastingNotes: The Sterling Vintner's Collection Merlot combines the classic offerings of this varietal in a smooth, complex, fruit-intensive style. Bright aromas of black cherry and plum hold through the senses as they join ripe, chewy tannins on the palate. The fruit is complemented by ample caramel, mocha and toasty oak from extensive aging in new American oak barrels. With layered depths and silky body, this versatile wine is appropriate for many occasions.

Name: Catena Chardonnay
Review: "Aromas of sliced apple and lemon follow through toa full body, with creamy texture and lovely stone and apple flavors. White peaches too. Subtle and flavorful."

Name: J. Lohr Chardonnay Riverstone
TastingNotes: The aromas are of nectarine, peach pie and apple--combined with the perfumed vanilla and toasted oak bouquet from barrel and malolactic fermentation and sur lie aging--creating an elegant Chardonnay from MontereyåÕs Arroyo Seco AVA. The flavors are very clean, with peach, nectarine and citrus with subtle butter and vanilla toastiness, producing layers of complexity with an excellent balance of fresh fruit acidity and palate weight.

Name: J. Lohr Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: J. Lohr Estates Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon is intensely-colored with youthful and bright hues. An abundance of dark cherry, black currant and berry fruit greets the nose, enhanced by spicy cedar, vanilla and toasty notes. On the palate, the fruit follows through with full weight and a lingering intensity and balance from the tannins. This wine is ready to be enjoyed now, or cellared for 5 years.

Name: Marques de Caceres Crianza
TastingNotes: This, rich full-bodied wine is made only in excellent vintages from hand-picked Tempranillo, Garnacha and Graciano grapes grown in Rioja Alta. Aged in French and American oak casks, Marques de Caceras Red Crianza has spicy aromas, berry fruit flavors and a velvety finish. Open preferably one hour before serving with hearty dishes, roasts, grilled meats or tapas.

Name: Jaboulet Parallele 45 Cotes du Rhone Rouge
TastingNotes: Parallele 45 Cotes du Rhone is a fresh, berry fruitdriven red with loads of soft, pure plum and blackberry flavors mingling with black pepper spice.

Name: Beringer Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon Founders Estate
TastingNotes: Deep color with bright cassis, green tea, black olive and sweet vanilla spice aromas that lead into a fleshy mouth. Black fruit, cassis, and spice flavors are supported into a long finish by fine-grained, assertive tannins.

Name: Beringer Sauvignon Blanc Founders' Estate
TastingNotes: Beringer Founders Estate Sauvignon Blanc shows bright fruit characteristics with a wonderfully refreshing grape fruit flavor that is enhanced with intense citrus, ripe stone fruit and white fig. The wine finishes with a clean grassy note and crisp acidity making it a perfect match with grilled fish.

Name: Beringer Vineyards White Zinfandel
TastingNotes: In Beringer White Zinfandel, the focus is to highlight the fresh red berry, citrus and melon aromas and flavors, and round them out with subtle hints of nutmeg and clove. The wine has a youthful exuberance that is enjoyable as a sipper on its own, or with a variety of dishes.

Name: Beringer Merlot Founders' Estate
TastingNotes: Black and bing cherry fruit is complemented by spicy qualities, notes of white pepper and even a whiff of cinnamon, backed up by a cedar and light caramel component that comes from the wine`s time in oak.

Name: Beringer Chardonnay Founders' Estate
TastingNotes: Beringer Founders Estate Chardonnay is the perfect combination of pear, apple and ripe tropical fruit flavors, with a hint of citrus and a classically round mouthfeel.

Name: Beringer Vineyards Napa Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Flavors of ripe citrus and apple are accented by aromas of toffee, tangerines and orange blossom. The mouth-coating, round texture highlights the rich flavors, all balanced by bright, refreshing notes that linger into the finish.
Review: "Orange blossom, nectarines, daffodils and clementine. Medium to full body, a really attractive, oily texture and a textured, succulent finish."

column1: Rich blackberry and raspberry aromas and flavo<!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->rs complemented by hints of orange peel and nutmeg.

Name: Travaglini Gattinara
TastingNotes: a deep pomegranate red wine; medium-bodied wine shows good depth in its red fruit. Soft silky tannins, with a good structure and intense mineral fragrance

Name: Vino Dell'Arte Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Light and crisp with subdued flavors of melon and citrus.

Name: Graham's Six Grapes Port
TastingNotes: Six Grapes has a seductive, rich aroma of ripe plums, cherries and dark chocolate notes. On the palate it's complex, with an excellent structure and a long, lingering finish. Six Grapes is one of Graham's original Port blends--it is a very full-bodied, luscious wine drawn from the same vineyards as Graham's Vintage Ports.
Review: åÊWine Advocate 88 pointsåÊ(JanåÊ2019)

Name: Graham's 10 Year Old Tawny Port
Review: åÒPowered with acidity and its firm structure, this is an intensely dry, concentrated, powerful wine. It certainly has wines in the blend that are older than 10 years, yet it is definitely a 10-year-old in style, as the fresh fruit to finish confirms.åÓ

Name: Falesco Vitiano Umbria IGT
TastingNotes: Deep ruby-red in color with concentrated notes of black cherry jam, licorice and tobacco leaf. This versatile wine pairs well with a wide array of food.

Name: Regaleali Nero d'Avola
TastingNotes: Bright ruby red color, this wine offers a rich bouquet of cherry, mulberry, and raspberry. On the palate, it is complex and supple, with ripe berries framed by juicy tannins.

Name: Chalk Hill Estate Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The aromas and flavors feature white peach, golden delicious apples, vanilla and crÌ¬me brÌÈlÌ©e. The palate is rich and concentrated with spice and toasted oak while fine natural acidity keeps the wine in balance.
Review: "Lots of spice, apricot, fig and honeydew melon flavors combine for a full-bodied, mouth-coating experience, with a finish that sails on and on, gaining depth."

Name: Chalk Hill Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: The nose offers peach, mango, Butterscotch Melon and lemon. The flavors add mango, passion fruit, and Musque to the mix. While this Sauvignon Blanc is ripe and powerful, it also possesses the ample structure and acidity to age.

Name: Conundrum White
TastingNotes: Gorgeous aromas of apricot, honeysuckle, and vanilla and lime zest enhance a deeply-flavored palate of tropical fruit, peach, pear and honeydew melon flavors. The complexity of this wine is brought into balance with a rich, round, soft texture; fresh, supportive acidity; and a stunning, satisfying finish.

Name: Pepperwood Grove Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Medium golden straw color with tropical pineappleguava and passionfruit aromas. The lively acidity provides an appropriate platform for the juicy fruit flavors of tangerine, peach and sweet honeysuckle finish.

Name: Hess Select Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Winemaker David Guffy crafted the Hess Select Cabernet Sauvignon withnotable richness, intensity and varietal character, showing jammy dark fruitaromas with cedary barrel notes and a touch of spice. A soft entry, with ripe plumand raspberry in the forefront, is supported by background flavors of tobacco andcaramel, which add complexity to this imminently drinkable wine.

Name: Black Opal Cabernet Merlot
TastingNotes: Deep crimson to purple. The aromas display excellent regional and varietal characters of berry and spice. These scents follow through with rich cherry and plum flavors, a hint of chocolate and a subtle touch of oak. The flavors develop well and finish with a long finely textured mouth feel.

Name: Black Opal Shiraz
TastingNotes: Black Opal Shiraz is rich red in the glass. Aromas of blackberry, pepper and spice followed with rich plum flavors round out the palate. Soft tannins give structure to the fruit-driven palate.

Name: Dry Creek Vineyard Fume Blanc
TastingNotes: Intense aromas of lemon-lime, ruby grapefruit and fresh cut grass. After a couple of minutes in the glass, more subtle hints of kiwi and guava begin to reveal a complex wine. On the palate, this wine is truly delicious with excellent viscosity and length showing more fresh fruit flavors and very balanced acidity.

Name: Graff Riesling Kabinett
TastingNotes: Fragrant bouquet and flavors reminiscent of apples and peaches, and finishes with a distinctive mineral tone and a crisp, mouthwatering finish.

Name: Honig Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This juicy, refreshing, medium bodied wine abounds with aromas of honeysuckle, grapefruit, and lemongrass mingled with mango, kiwi, peach, and grapefruit rind. The finish is long, crisp and minerally.

Name: Robert Mondavi Winery Napa Valley Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Fresh and youthful with lively acidity and abundantfruit. Aromas of zesty citrus and green apple mingle with a hint of coconut and subtle oak. Richly layered flavors unfold in the mouth: lemon, green apple, pear, pineapple and crÌ¬me brulee.

Name: Sandeman Port Ruby
TastingNotes: Brilliant red ruby in color, with clean aromas of red fruits, plums and strawberries, Sandeman Ruby Porto has full rich flavors and is very well balanced. Rich, round, balanced in the mouth, with overt flavors of fresh plums and red fruits.

Name: R.H. Phillips Toasted Head Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The nose of RH Phillips Toasted Head Chardonnay offers ripe pineapple and peach aromas with toasted graham cracker. The bright straw color prepares the palate for the rich tropical fruit and luscious stone fruit with a viscous mouth feel accented by toasted coconut, vanilla and butterscotch. The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest.

Name: Rodney Strong Merlot
TastingNotes: Plum and blueberry flavors predominate in this soft, rich, mouth filling merlot, and are enhanced by aging in small oak barrels for a toasty, spicy vanilla character, and a lingering berry-cream finish. Drink this satisfying merlot over the next 2 to 4 years.

Name: Santa Barbara Chardonnay
Review: "One of the original bottlings from the region, this is always a reliable and classic coastal Chardonnay. Tangy aromas of grapefruit, orange and chalk lead into a tense palate where racy acidity frames apple rind and lime flavors."

Name: Columbia Crest Two Vines Cabernet-Merlot
TastingNotes: A well-balanced blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc andCabernet Sauvignon, this fruit-forward wine displays generous blackberry and raspberry notes that wrap around a core of warm vanilla flavors and lead to a rich, silky finish.

Name: E. Guigal Cotes du Rhone Rouge
TastingNotes: Deep and dark red, shiny. Fresh fruits with red berries and spices on the nose. The palate is full, round and racy with rounded and smooth tannins. A full-bodied, rich and intensly aromatic wine. Full with a long finish and plenty of elegance and finesse due to the well balanced tannins and fruit.
Review: "As usual, the 2015 Cotes du Rhone features a majority of Syrah, largely sourced from the western side of the RhÌ«ne. Spicy, peppery, hickory aromas lead off, adding berries up front and then moving into darker fruit and more savory notes of black olive by the finish. This medium to full-bodied wine finishes long and silky, avoiding any of the vintage's hard tannins, while still boasting the concentration to drink well through at least 2023."

Name: Yarden Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Intense ripe blackberry, cherry, cassis and plum notes with toasty oak, vanilla and a nuance of spice and tar; full-bodied and concentrated with a long complex finish.
Review: "Violet-red in the glass, this wine has a nose of blackberries and gingerbread spice. It is well balanced, with equal amounts of velvety tannins and refreshing brightness cavorting on the palate. Pronounced flavors of blackberry, aniseed, smoke, flint and thyme are accentuated by notes of mint tea."

Name: Louis Bernard Cotes du Rhone Village
TastingNotes: Full of flavor, like the fruits in the marketsof Provence, with lovely aromas of spices and aromatic plants, our CÌ«tes-du-RhÌ«ne Villages have a Southern accent and plenty of character.
Review: "An outstanding Southern RhÌ«ne that has loads of ripe strawberry and raspberry fruits, medium-bodied richness and a peppery, spicy style on the palate that makes it a joy to drink. ItåÕs a terrific value to buy by the case and enjoy over the coming 2-3 years."

Name: Pepperwood Grove Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Sourced from Chile, this Cabernet Sauvignon shows aromas of dark plum, cherry and cedar. On the palate, ripe red currant and blackberry flavors predominate with hints of sage and dried strawberry rounding out the finish.

Name: Blackstone Winery Chardonnay Monterey County
TastingNotes: Aromas of light tropical fruit, lemon citrus with atouch of mineral notes and pleasing oak. This bright, well-balanced wine has a long, lingering finish.

Name: Yellow Tail Merlot
TastingNotes: Silky smooth and easy on the palate. This wine is agreat åÒslurperåÓ with juicy, ripe fruit flavors, complemented by aromas of dark plums and a touch of mint and soft vanillin oak.

Name: Pere Anselme Chateauneuf-Du-Pape La Fiole du Pape
TastingNotes: The complex bouquet is warm and inviting, harmoniously combining aromas of dried fruit, wood, truffles, venison, and spice. On the palate, it is surprisingly soft on the first sip, but strong tannins lead to a powerful finish.

Name: Bolla Amarone della Valpolicella
TastingNotes: After aging in the finest oak barrels the Bolla Amarone della Valpolicella that emerges is a wine of ruby-red color with a dry, rich, complex flavor.

Name: Frei Brothers Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Frei Brothers Cabernet Sauvignon has intense aromasof cassis, dark berries and toasty oak. Firm, velvety tannins complement the flavors of blackberry, raspberry, cedar and tobacco. Subtle hints of vanilla and dark chocolate linger in a long, elegant finish.

Name: Hartley & Gibson's Sherry Fino
TastingNotes: Flaxen pale to gossamer golden in color.  Very dry with an almond-reminiscent bouquet. Delicate and light, but fully satisfying.

Name: Silverado Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Dark cranberry in color with a hint of baking spices in the nose. At first sip thereåÕs a sweetness of ripe plum with a touch of vanilla and oak. Finishes on the palate with focused acidity and ends with an explosion of fruit pie flavors.
Review: "Attractive cassis here with a wealth of plush and nicely ripe blackberry and red-plum aromas and flavors. The palate has fine, firm tannins that carry long and fresh. Drink or hold."

Name: Eroica Riesling
Review: "The 2015 Riesling Eroica is another beautiful, pure and racy white that has vibrant acidity, medium-bodied richness and classy notes of lychee nut, petrol and honeyed minerality. Drink this pure, juicy and impeccably balanced beauty over the coming 4-5 years. It will keep for over a decade if you're so inclined as well."

Name: Catena Malbec
Review: "The fresh, floral and expressive 2016 Catena Malbec blends grapes from different parts of Mendoza: Lunlunta, Agrelo, Altamira El Cepillo and Gualtallary. It fermented in stainless steel and matured in French and American oak barrels for an average of 12 months. It's straight and a little austere but has deep flavors. Superb quality for the price and volume."

Name: Whitehall Lane Winery Napa Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: A tangy, refreshing wine with aromas of grapefruit,apple and just a hint of toasty oak. It is light to medium bodied and delivers rich and refreshing citrus flavors, excellent balance and a clean finish.

Name: Beaulieu Vineyard Bv Coastal Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: This ruby-red wine has a complex bouquet of spiced plum, strawberry and toasted oak.

Name: Clos du Bois Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Vibrant aromas of ripe blackberry, spice and cassismingle with notes of vanilla and toasted oak on the nose. Full-bodied and velvety on the palate, the flavors are bright and juicy, with hints of ripe blackberry, plums and clove.The wineåÕs finish combines fruit, oak and tannin in perfect balance.

Name: Matanzas Creek Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
TastingNotes: The nose has an intensely perfumed fresh bouquet ofpink grapefruit and lemon cream combined with energetic spice notes underlined by invigorating minerality. Emulating the nose, the palate of crisp citrus and melon flavor carries a hint of dry white herb accompanied by a soft, round mouth feel resulting in a medium bodied, fresh, food-friendly wine.
Review: "The 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Bennett Valley sings of white peaches, grapefruit and lemon zest with touches of chalk dust and lime leaves. Medium-bodied with fantastic intensity and packed with citrus and herbal flavors, it has a racy line of freshness and an invigorating finish."

Name: Robert Mondavi Private Selection Zinfandel
TastingNotes: The wine brims with lush Zinfandel fruit flavors, reminiscent of sweet black cherry, brambleberry and plum, with an intriguing nuance of violet.

Name: Blackstone Winery Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: A vibrant violet color, an invitingly complex wine full of deep blackberry, plum, and spice on the nose and a rich mouthfeel, rounded by vanilla and roasted oak scents, and a finish thatåÕs long and smooth. The Malbec and Cabernet Franc within the blend add particularly soft, round texture and mature length, as well as fuller, riper flavors.

Name: Kris Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Pale yellow in color with brilliant greenish reflections, enticing aromas of acacia flowers, citrus, tangerine, and hints of apricots and almonds. Kris is lean and refreshing on the palate with hints of blossom and honey.

Name: Emilio Moro Ribera del Duero
Review: "Plenty of blueberry and plum-cake character. Ripe and generous with full, but quite supple tannins for a young Ribera del Duero red. Keeps pumping out the ripe flavors on the fresh and intense finish."

Name: Hess Mount Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: The wine aromas open up to blackberry and cassis with a hint of cedar in the background. The wine has a rich entry, which leads to a full mid-palate and a long, soft finish. The flavors mimic that of the aroma with dark fruit and a hint of chocolate on the finish.

Name: Bogle Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: From the winery, "Created in a classic style, BogleåÕs Sauvignon Blanc was cold fermented in 100% stainless steel tanks, using reductive winemaking practices, to maintain its varietal character: crisp, vibrant and refreshing. Notes of tropical gooseberry are paired with hints of green peppers, springs herbs and freshly cut grass. A touch of citrus fruit zest teases your mouth as well. Absolutely refreshing, the thick and round mouthfeel is well balanced with crisp acidity for a lasting and memorable finish."

Name: Robert Mondavi Pinot Noir Carneros
TastingNotes: Robed in deep color, this Pinot Noir opens with theintense aromas of dark fruits åÐ black cherries and plums åÐ that echo on the palate. Well integrated acids bring a measure of vibrancy to the lush, fleshy texture, and fine-grained tannins lend structure into the smooth, lingering finish.

Name: Robert Mondavi Sauvignon Blanc Private Selection
TastingNotes: Tis wine is bright and fresh with rich mid-palate flavors of lime, grapefruit and melon that pick up a spicy peach tone in the long, crisp, mineral- tinged finish.

Name: Baron Herzog Merlot
TastingNotes: This soft and approachable Merlot is fruit-forward,with distinct strawberry jam and berry aromas. Well-integrated tannins and a medium body are smoothly offset by balancing acidity. These central coast Merlot grapes are carefully selected to produce a wine with aromas of red cherries, strawberry jam, and spice, with a rich mouth feel and finish.

Name: Catena Alta Malbec
Review: "Pretty and subtle dark-berry and floral aromas follow through to a very precise, medium-bodied palate with sweet and supple fruit and tannins. Tangy, fresh finish. 50 per cent fermented in open-top barrels and 50 per cent in barrel. Very old vines used. Drink now."

Name: Franciscan Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "A fruity and juicy wine with blackcurrant and plumcharacter. Medium body, firm tannins and a medium finish. A little tannic now but will show better in 2019."

Name: Robert Mondavi Pinot Noir Private Selection
TastingNotes: On the nose, lovely rose petal, violet, and red cherry aromas mingle with complementary scents of smoky vanilla and nutmeg. Very soft and round with good length and richness on the palate, the wine displays supple, silky berry and cherry jam flavors.

Name: Santa Cristina Orvieto
TastingNotes: Straw-yellow in color. The bouquet opens with luscious fruity-floral aromas reminiscent of lemon zest and white flowers. Soft and well-balanced on the palate, with lingering flavors of fresh citrus on the finish.

Name: Teal Lake Cellars Shiraz
TastingNotes: Light and distinctive for its spicy cherry and anise flavors, which echo nicely on a soft finish.

Name: San Giuseppe Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Pale yellow in color. Features slight citrus, greenapple and almond aromas. The palate is similarly flavored with a hint of mineral on the finish.

Name: Mer Soleil Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The wine opens with tropical fruit and honeysuckle aromas. Luxurious flavors of crÌ¬me brulee and even a hint of butter are framed by notes of fine oak and the lively acidity of citrus zest. The mouth-feel is full and lush and brings all the wine's elements through to a long, persistent finish.

Name: Umberto Cesari Sangiovese Riserva
TastingNotes: This wine is a bright, ruby color, tending toward garnet, with a bouquet highlighted by mountain flowers and explosive fruitiness. The taste is rich, smooth, dry, and slightly tannic with a harmonious long finish.

Name: Ferrari-Carano Sonoma Fume Blanc
TastingNotes: Aromas of lime, kiwi, citrus, melon and a touch of grass complemented by flavors of grapefruit, lemon and lime with a mango and guava finish. Cool, stainless steel tank fermentation gives this wine a crisp freshness while the subtle oak character from barrel aging adds complexity and depth. Made with 100% Sauvignon Blanc.

Name: Elisabeth Chambellan Chateauneuf du Pape
Review: "The 2017 boasts more expressive florals and red fruit than the regular cuvÌ©e, while remaining full-bodied, creamy and lush in texture. It then finishes on a silky note, with peppery spice adding even more interest."

Name: Ravenswood Lodi Zinfandel
TastingNotes: YouåÕll get taken over by aromas and flavors of black cherries, currant, clove and cocoa, with soft, full tannins and balanced acidity for an achingly long and oh-so-pleasant finish.

Name: Carpineto Chianti Classico
TastingNotes: Aromas of violets, berries and cherries make up thebouquet. A full-bodied wine that is well-balanced with a velvety texture and rounded tannins.

Name: Alba Vineyards Old Mill Red
TastingNotes: Ruby black color. Vibrant crushed raspberry, spice bag, and clay aromas follow through on a round entry to a fruity-yet-dry medium body with accents of sundried tomato and slate. Finishes with a crisp, tangy, low tannin fade. A tasty, fruity sipper.

Name: Turning Leaf Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Enticingly smooth and full of flavor.Expect the fragrance of juicy apples and pears layered with creaminess of vanilla and buttery caramel.

Name: Bartenura Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: This is a well balanced dry wine with a fruity flavor and pleasant, fresh aftertaste.

Name: Teal Lake Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Soft and fruity, with pleasant guava and apple flavors on a light frame.

Name: Bonterra Chardonnay
TastingNotes: A hint of oak complements the freshness of fruit and the evident notes of green apple, pear and citrus. Bonterra Chardonnay is aged for several months to develop a rich, creamy texture that gracefully balances its fruit-forward character.

Name: Seghesio Old Vines Zinfandel
Review: "Medium to deep garnet-purple, the 2015 Zinfandel Old Vine offers a beguiling nose of crushed blueberries, Black Forest cake and crÌ¬me de cassis with hints of dried roses, licorice, incense and tilled soil. Full-bodied, rich and with wonderful purity, it has an amazing frame of ripe, grainy tannins and plenty of freshness, finishing long and perfumed."

Name: Simi Sonoma Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "A classic Sonoma Sauvignon Blanc, loaded with bright citrus aromas. Small amounts of Viognier and Semillon were blended in to contribute additional richness to the palate. Refreshing, full, and vibrant; the palate has a long finish with a lingering impression of citrus & stone fruit."

Name: Craggy Range Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "It boasts effusive aromas of guava, gooseberry andpink grapefruit, while remaining resolutely dry on the medium-bodied palate and ending with silky-textured length."

Name: Pine Ridge Chenin Blanc Viognier
Review: "Crisp, lively and refreshing, this medium-bodied wine offers a tangy citrus flavor and a light mineral accent that adds complexity. ItåÕs a natural pairing for seafood."

Name: Castle Rock Chardonnay Central Coast
TastingNotes: This elegant Chardonnay offers a rich, ripe and fruity character with a delicious blending of vanilla, pear citrus and melon flavors, subtle oak undertones and a long, balanced finish.

Name: Frog's Leap Zinfandel
TastingNotes: A wine that expresses its intensity through complexlayers instead of simple, brute power. It is almost impossible to describe the zesty "fruit bowl" of aromatics: Raspberry? Blackberry? Mulberry? Perhaps razzmatazz berry describes it best. The addition of Petite Sirah underscores the ripe fruit flavors and adds a spicy touch of cardamom and cinnamon. Plush without ever being heavy or harsh.

Name: Clos du Val Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Opulent, brooding purple hue is accentuated with aromas of ripe black and purple fruit, black pepper and subtle hints of toast. The palate displays a seamless integration of intense flavors that include chocolate, toffee and blackberry. The wine has a rich yet powerful mouthfeel marked by focused, silky tannins and a long, lingering finish.

Name: Cristom Mount Jefferson Pinot Noir
Review: "Expressive strawberry blossom and raspberry aromasopen to elegantly structured cherry and spicy cinnamon flavors that build richness toward refined tannins. Drink now through 2025."

Name: Etude Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Ruby and garnet in color, this Pinot Noir offers aromas of black cherry, Asian spice and sous bois that are lifted by a concentrated fresh fruit core. Consistent with the nose, the palate also demonstrates the qualities of a well balanced Pinot Noir: refined tannins, bright acidity, a generous mouthfeel and a lingering finish.

Name: Excelsior Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Elegant and approachable, this Chardonnay has appealing lemon and lime flavors, with hints of vanilla. Delicate peach nuances linger on the crisp, dry finish.

Name: Joel Gott Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Aromas of sweet cherries, red plums, blackberries and vanilla spice. The wine is juicy and full of red fruit, with a soft mid-palate and a bright, lingering raspberry finish.

Name: Kendall Jackson Vintner's Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: åÒThis garnet gem delivers bright cherry, strawberryand raspberry fruit with elegant earthy notes infused with cola and mild spice accents. Oak aging adds a hint of vanilla and a soft, smoky finish.åÓ - Randy Ullom, Winemaster

Name: E. Guigal Cotes du Rhone Blanc
Review: "The 2017 CÌ«tes du RhÌ«ne Blanc has lots of GrenacheBlanc as well as other permitted varieties. Notes of white flowers, citrus, and honeysuckle all emerge from this medium-bodied, vibrant white that has good acidity and a clean finish. As usual, it over-delivers."

Name: Grahams 20 Year Old Tawny Port
TastingNotes: The pale amber Twenty Year Old is lighter and gloriously smooth. It has a full, nutty bouquet, the classic GrahamåÕs richness and a soft lingering aftertaste.
Review: "A complex and full-bore tawny, with deep, intense flavors of orange cream, glazed apricot, baked peach and roasted pineapple that are balanced by concentrated chocolate and toffee notes. The bright finish is filled with spice and supported by fresh acidity. Drink now. 25,000 cases made."

Name: La Crema Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir
Review: "Dried cherry, allspice and poached plum flavors show plenty of hot stone and brick notes, with cardamom and sandalwood details on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2021."

Name: Lamole di Lamole Chianti Classico
Review: "Aromas of rosemary, truffle, wild berries and oak.The palate is polished, tangy and crisp with flavours of red fruits and oak with quite a long, slightly saline, finish."

Name: Melville Estate Syrah
TastingNotes: Deep garnet in color, notes of violets, duck plum sauce and cocoa powder come forward initially. On the palate, intriguing components of boysenberry liqueur, salted caramel and vanilla bean mingle with savory hints of morel mushrooms, beef carpaccio and all spice. The mouthfeel is tender, with an elegant streak of fresh acidity that frames the wineåÕs lengthy and vibrant finish.

Name: Murphy Goode Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Dark and bold, with explosive cherry and blackberryflavors that bring out the best in anything hearty.

Name: Danzante Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: A crisp lemon-blossom bouquet leads into vibrant flavors of citrus, melon and peach and a clean, well-balanced finish.

Name: Raymond R Collection Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Aromas of plum, rhubarb, cassis, pepper and smokewith a hint of vanilla. A red fruit-based Cabernet with flavors of cherry, raspberry, rhubarb and red plum with touches of spicy white pepper, vanilla and cocoa on the finish. Beautifully balanced rich fruit flavors, integrated tannins and a smooth texture.

Name: Rex Hill Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Beguiling aromatics of Bing cherries, ripe raspberries, huckleberries, pomegranate, violets sandalwood, earth and wood smoke develop into deeper notes of coffee, tobacco, cloves, black fruit and soft leather. The palate intrigues with red, blue and black fruit flavors, appealing spice and minerals framed by delicate, ripe tannins. The wine's structure builds gradually through the mid-palate reflecting its intensity balance and potential for longevity.
Review: "Lithe and expressive, light-footed and ripe, with blackberry, plum and mint flavors on a sleek frame, lingering gently against fine tannins. Drink now through 2020."

Name: R.H. Phillips Toasted Head Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Elegant and aromatic, this wine features raspberry,cherry & rhubarb notes, ripe tannins, and a hint of vanilla, mocha and toasty notes from the barrel aging process. The Lake County fruit provides the backbone and structure of the wine, while Mendocino's Redwood Valley contributes perfumed notes of raspberry and blackberry.

Name: Carpineto Rosso Dogajolo
TastingNotes: The nose is fruity with hints of cherry, coffee, vanilla and spice. It is full and soft on the palate with complex and well-developed flavors and tannins.

Name: Kendall-Jackson Riesling Vintner's Reserve
TastingNotes: Honeysuckle, apricot and peach flavors delicately mingle with hits of Anjou pear. Deliciously crisp and nearly-dry with overflowing orange blossom and spice flavors accented by aromatic jasmine and a delightful finish.

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Chardonnay Cold Creek Vineyard
Chateau Ste. Michelle Harvest Select Riesling
TastingNotes: Offers beautiful crisp Washington Riesling character with rich flavors of ripe peaches and apricot. The fresh fruit and decadent character is balanced with crisp acidity to keep the wine in harmony.

Name: St. Supery Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This wine exhibits brilliant hues of light yellow speared by vibrant streaks of green. Aromas of exotic grapefruit and green lime dominate with hints of caper, fennel and lemon zest. Flavors follow with tremendous ruby grapefruit, citrus, kiwi and guava through a crisp finish.

Name: Stags Leap Winery Petite Sirah
TastingNotes: Intensity, complexity, structure, and elegance are the signature descriptors of this wine. Aromas open with clove, spice and concentrated black fruit. As the wine opens, distinct blackberry notes are revealed along with balanced acidity, rounded tannins and fresh fruit flavors. Vanilla, brown sugar and subtle pepper persist at the finish with lingering juicy red fruit as well.
Review: "A fabulous wine, the 2012 Petite Sirah was co-fermented with 1% Viognier, and includes 12% Syrah, 8% Grenache and 2% Carignan in the blend. Beautiful aromas of lavender, acacia flowers, blueberries, black raspberries, licorice and graphite emerge from this full-bodied, rich Petite Sirah. While approachable because of the vintageåÕs sweet tannins, it will age easily for 15-20 years."

Name: Clos du Bois Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Charmingly nuanced with enticing tropical notes, Clos du Bois Sauvignon Blanc evokes lime blossoms, lemongrass, peach, grapefruit and honeysuckle. Pretty and assertive, it bows out with a clean finish.

Name: Domaine Ste. Michelle Brut Rose
TastingNotes: This distinctive medium-dry wine shows off an attractive plum skin hue. The Blanc de Noirs exhibits delightful spicy characteristics of ripe raspberry and strawberry aromas and flavors.

Name: Twin Islands Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Displays intense lemon zest, green apple and grapefruit on the nose. The light and refreshing body has very flavorful citrus notes with a refreshing backbone of acidity."

Name: Wente Morning Fog Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Enjoy aromas and flavors of green apple and tropical fruits, balanced by subtle oak, cinnamon and vanilla from barrel aging.  With a mouth-filling body and balanced acidity, this wine delivers a medium-long, refreshing finish.

Name: Whitehall Lane Winery Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Whitehall Lane Cabernet Sauvignon has intense colorand aromas of raspberry, and toasty oak that leap forth. The berry and plum flavors are concentrated with a rich, mouth-coating texture. With loads of fruit and velvety tannins, this beautiful blend is enjoyable now but will age gracefully.
Review: "A juicy and fruity red with plum and dried berry character. Some terracotta too. Full and velvety tannins. Very drinkable now but will improve with age."

Name: Yalumba Muscat Museum Reserve
Review: "The non-vintage Museum Reserve Muscat is exotic, full-bodied, rich, and sweet. It spent 7 years in wood, and was bottled from a solera system. This amber-hued, rich, unctuously-textured effort boasts luscious aromas and flavors of marmalade, figs, chocolate, melted caramel, toffee, and prunes. Once again, Australia proves this country is hard to beat when it comes to their fortified after-dinner wines, which still sell for a song."

Name: Zenato Amarone
TastingNotes: Ruby red in color with intoxicating aromas of driedblack cherry, cassis, truffles, chocolate fudge and tar. This wine is silky, luscious and complex, with a lingering finish, and pairs perfectly with hearty game stews, roasted meats and mature cheeses.
Review: åÒThe 2010 Amarone delle Valpolicella Classico impresses for its harmony, staying power and elegance. Wines made from air-dried grapes like Amarone can sometimes feel overdone and overtly jammy. But this wine, made from a balanced vintage, allows the quality of fruit to rise above all the rest. The bouquet opens to dark fruit, prune, resin, cola and tar. A pretty note of oregano or rosemary gives the an Italian or Mediterranean personality.åÓ

Name: Frog's Leap Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Bright flavors of citrus and stone fruit are layered over a taut and structured frame that is underscored by touches of mineral and flint. Like most wines of this type, FrogåÕs Leap Chardonnay draws its complexity and mouthfeel from delicate contact with its primary fermentation lees rather than from extended time in oak barrels.

Name: Argyle Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
TastingNotes: On the palate the flavor is one of the silkiest in memory, enhanced by a creamy texture. The fruit sweetness is black cherry and ripe plum. Fathoms of chocolate spice and morel earthiness frame the fruit. All this is supported by firm, ripe tannins which linger along with the sweetness for a very long finish. The structure and surprising sweetness should help one to predict significant return on cellaring this wine!

Name: Columbia Crest Two Vines Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: From the winery, "This minimally oaked Cabernet Sauvignon offers fruit-forward aromas and flavors of slight cherry and blueberry throughout. The balance of fruit and soft oak provides a lingering finish with hints of cocoa."

Name: Taylor Fladgate 10 Year Tawny
TastingNotes: Elegant and smooth, combining delicate wood notes and rich mellow fruit, it is bottled for immediate drinking.

Name: Warre's Warrior Finest Reserve Port
TastingNotes: Dark red colour, with a seductive rich perfume of ripe plums and cherries. On the palate complex, with an excellent structure and a long lingering finish.
Review: åÊWine Enthusiast 87 pointsåÊ(DecåÊ2015)

Name: Murphy Goode Winery The Fume Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Murphy Goode FumÌ© is made of mainly Sauvignon Blancwith a touch of Semillon. It was predominately fermented in stainless steel to retain the expression of bright citrus and tropical fruit aromatics while the balance was barrel fermented in French and American oak to increase the mouthfeel and develop lush flavors of white peach and honeydew melon.

Name: Joseph Drouhin Macon Villages Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The color of the wine is bright and limpid. The nose is floral and fruity. Very straightforward and direct on the palate, as if biting into a grape. Fresh and light, with a very pleasant aftertaste.

Name: Zenato Valpolicella Superiore Ripassa
TastingNotes: The deep ruby red color of the Ripassa, and the intense yet fine aromas come from the mixture of grapes. It is full bodied, harmonic, and velvety on the palate.

Name: Stag's Leap Aveta Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This vibrant wine offers a pleasing tropical nose of orange blossom, grapefruit, lychee and peach. On the palate the wine has a juicy, fruit driven entry with lively acidity and flavors of guava, honeyed tangerine, juicy Comice pear, Kaffir lime and a mineral edge. The citrus notes mingle with sandalwood spice and linger on the energetic finish.

Name: Stag's Leap Winery Merlot
TastingNotes: Generous aromas of dark plum and bright red fruit, with enticing hints of clove and cinnamon throughout. Juicy red fruit flavors are effortlessly integrated with notes of caramel and savory spice that contribute depth to the polished palate. Smooth, velvety tannins and a refined texture give this Merlot a distinct level of sophistication while still being very approachable in its early years.

Name: Melville Estate Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Raspberry, cranberry and floral aromas tantalize the senses. On the palate ripe rapberry and cherry notes are balanced by mineral notes. Balanced perfectly with good acidity and firm tannins.
Review: åÒCrushed red berries, mint, flowers and cinnamon lift from the glass in the 2012 Pinot Noir Estate Sta. Rita Hills. This is one of the most polished, refined and aromatically expressive wines I have tasted from Melville. What a gorgeous, radiant and totally sexy wine this is."

Name: Bartenura Moscato
TastingNotes: Crisp and refreshing, semi sweet, with lingering pear, tangerine, nectar and melon flavors on the finish.

Name: Smith & Hook Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Fragrant aromas of plum and black cherry find perfect balance with hints of vanilla, cola, cloves and cocoa dust. Right on the heels of all that aromatic intensity are interwoven layers of blackberry, boysenberry, black currant, dark plums and mocha. This wine is full bodied with supple tannins and a long, generous finish.

Name: Simi Merlot
TastingNotes: Paacked with plum and black cherry flavors, with exotic spice and vanilla oak elements.

Name: Rodney Strong Chalk Hill Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Barrel fermentation in new and seasoned French oak added toasty vanilla and spice complexities. Creamy and rich on the palate. Encouraging secondary fermentation adds additional complexity, and in the glass the wine is both creamy and crisp, with ripe apple, Meyer lemon, wet stone, and spiced vanilla flavors.
Review: "Juicy and lusciously fruity, with roasted tropicalfruit, apple pastry and pear tart flavors. Buttery and spicy accents show on the vibrant finish. Drink now through 2022."

Name: Monte Antico Rosso
TastingNotes: Dark ruby in color, its bouquet of leather, earth, herbs, black cherries, licorice and plums is confirmed on the medium to full-bodied palate åÐ round, spicy, elegant, attractively fruity.

Name: Cave L'Aurance Bourgogne Chardonnay
TastingNotes: If you like youåÕre chardonnay oak-free this is a great choice.Impressive roundness on the palatewith tasty pear, fig and mineral notes. Another winner from this åÒgo-toåÓ winery.

Name: Cave L'Aurance Macon Village
Review: "A fruit forward French classic. Delicious and refreshing with notes of crisp apple and pear. Enjoy now!"

Name: Cave L'Aurance Pouilly Fuisse
