TastingNotes: Caramel, honey, clove, apples, lemon, and peaches dominate the nose and the palate of this French bargain. A real winner!

Name: Cave L'Aurance Saint-Veran
TastingNotes: Pale golden color. Complex, ample and elegant bouquet. Fruity notes of white peach, apple and floral notes of lime-blossom that give way to notes of almond and a touch of honey.

Name: Sequoia Grove Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Red/black in color, this wine has notes of blackberry and mocha with hints of plum and sage. On the palate, the impeccably balanced wine is dark, fleshy and supple, with notes of espresso and bittersweet chocolate and a touch of black cherry on the finish.
Review: "A barrel sample made up of 82% Cabernet Sauvignon,7% Merlot, 7% Cabernet Franc, 3% Malbec and 1% Petit Verdot, the medium to deep garnet-purple colored 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas of cedar, earth and sage with blackberries, mulberries and spice box suggestions. The full-bodied, approachable/open-knit palate shows notable toasty oak, good concentration and chewy tannins, finishing long and spicy."

Name: Grgich Hills Cellars Napa Valley Fume Blanc
TastingNotes: Complex and rich, this wine is packed with layers of tropical aromas including white peaches, grapefruit and lemon oil. With its crisp, refreshing texture, hint of mineral and long finish, this versatile, flavorful white wine is a great companion to many light dishes or on its own.

Name: Groth Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Features lush melon and citrus character in the aroma and in the flavor with a solid, crisp backbone that gives the wine an exciting liveliness that balances the rich creaminess from "sur lie" aging.

Name: Pacific Rim Dry Riesling
TastingNotes: The wine is crisp, dry and lush with flavors of citrus, jasmine and minerals. This Dry Riesling is infinitely versatile and complements the world's most vibrant and flavorful cuisines.

Name: Maso Canali Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Maso Canali Pinot Grigio has a brilliant golden color with aromas of tropical fruit and apricot. This wine is well-balanced with ripe flavors of apple and pear, leading into a clean finish.

Name: Grgich Hills Cellars Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Elegant and full bodied, the wine's complex aromas of black berries, black licorice and a hint of cocoa powder.
Review: "A solid red with black currant and berry character. Full body, round and velvety tannins and a pure and delicious fruit. So right now. Made from organically grown grapes."

Name: MacMurray Ranch Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast
TastingNotes: Full of bright peach and rich honeydew melon flavor, MacMurray Pinot Gris tantalizes with delicate notes of citrus and spice as well, making it the ideal companion for a wide variety of foods.

Name: Sterling Vintner's Meritage
TastingNotes: Nice flavors of blackberry, chocolate and vanilla are evident the second this wine hits your palate. The mid-palate is full and rich leading to a long, lingering finish.

Name: Hartford Court Russian River Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: The wine's nose is elegant and complex with effusive black cherry up-front and underlying notes of violet, pain grillÌ©, cumin and faint notions of freshly plowed earth. Flavors in the mouth are berry, cherry, sweet dried cranberries, clove and allspice. Texturally, the wine is silky with nice acidity and a minerality that drive the wine's finish.
Review: åÒIntense red fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry andstrawberry impact the palate immediately. The middle has substantial weight for a Pinot Noir offering a touch of spice and cloves which is followed by a long silky finish.åÓ

Name: Clos du Bois Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: This Pinot Noir shows deep shades of black cherry in the glass, with classic aromas of strawberry, cherry, vanilla and hints of smokiness on the nose. The wine has a lush, silky texture that opens to flavors of cherry and strawberry. With a pleasing balance of oak, the wine integrates its bright fruit flavors beautifully on the palate.

Name: Livio Felluga Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: This Pinot Grigio is straw yellow with light goldenhues in color. The nose is extremely elegant, penetrating, crispy and complex, with evident notes of jasmine, and magnolia; hints of white peach, apricot, orange peel, pear, golden apple, cantaloupe, wild rose and mint; mineral and spice components well integrated.

Name: Masi Campofiorin Red
Review: "This was a great vintage in Valpolicella, prizing dark and exuberant fruit flavors. The 2015 Campofiorin is made with the double-fermentation method, or ripasso, that is indigenous to this area, and the wine offers both fresh fruit aromas of blackberry and cherry as well as dried aromas of raisin and prune at the back. The blend is 70% Corvina, 25% Rondinella and 5% Molinara. This is a more accessible wine that would make a great pairing partner to a juicy burger topped with avocado, cheddar cheese and bacon."

Name: Broadbent Rainwater Madiera
TastingNotes: Clear dark reddish-copper in color, it breathes classic and very appealing Madeira scents of dried dates and figs and mixed nuts. Smooth and gently sweet, it's not a "sticky" dessert wine but shows good fresh-fruit sweetness built on Madeira's sturdy core of tart, lemony acidity.

Name: Walter Hansel Cahill Lane Vineyard Chardonnay
Review: "The 2016 Chardonnay Cahill Lane gives up loads of honeyed peaches and ripe apple notes with touches of nutmeg, baking bread and marzipan. Medium to full-bodied, it fills the palate with layer upon layer of bread, nut and stone fruit flavors, supported by bright, refreshing acid and a creamy texture, finishing with fantastic length. 1,064 cases produced."

Name: Calera Central Coast Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: A wonderful, full gentle bouquet of red plum, berries, rose petal and mineral accents lively flavors of blackberry, raspberry and sassy sour cherry. This wine offers great depth, spice, a hint of sweet oak and beautiful texture with very fine-grained tannins and a soft, round, easy drinking mouthfeel that lingers on leaving you wanting another taste.
Review: "The keenly priced 2015 Pinot Noir 40th AnniversaryVintage from Calera is lovely, wafting from the glass with youthfully complex aromas of potpourri, cherries, strawberry and spice. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, expansive and velvety, with a succulent core of fruit, melting tannins and a long, tangy finish. Enjoy this delicious offering now or over the coming decade."

Name: Rodney Strong Charlotte's Home Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Light, crisp, and highly aromatic, ripe pear and melon character, citrus, with a slight minerality.

Name: Chateau Ste Michelle Canoe Ridge Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This Chardonnay delivers crisp apple and white grapefruit aromas and flavors with a clean, refreshing finish. Aged in restrained, lighter French oak barrels to maintain the fresh style.

Name: Fratello Revello Barbera
Review: "This is concentrated and vivid, yet with a fluid feel that allows the blackberry and black cherry flavors to work the dense structure. The acidity drives the long finish. Fine potential. Drink now through 2024."

Name: Meiomi Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Bright, deep garnet color. Aromas of cola, blackberries and a sweet cedar note. A greatly layered palette abundant in flavor and texture. The first entry encases the mouth with a velvety richness. Then the wine unloads with flavors of bright cherry, cola, dried leaves undertoned with vanilla, leather and high style oak. The many layers emerge independently, then refocus while the supple tannins carry the wine through to a lingering, succulent finish.

Name: Luigi Pira Dolcetto d'Alba
TastingNotes: Intense ruby red color with violet reflections. Young, fresh, with fruity and floral tones on the nose. Well-balanced and persistent, long and complex finish.

Name: Coopers Creek Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Immensely fruity, the 2017 Sauvignon Blanc from Coopers Creek is loaded with fig, guava and passion fruit aromas and flavors. It's medium-bodied and plump, with an attractively creamy texture and crisp finish. It's a solid effort from a challenging vintage."

Name: Colosi Sicilia IGT
TastingNotes: The color is an intense dark ruby red. A dry, full bodied wine with aromas of black fruit, blackberry and strawberries.

Name: Louis M. Martini Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
TastingNotes: This notable example first presents inviting aromasof cassis, sweet herbs and hints of pipe tobacco. On the palate, it exhibits a firm structure and intriguing flavors of ripe black cherries, deep, briary red fruits and old-world complexities that linger through a memorable finish.

Name: Mark West Pinot Noir California
TastingNotes: Crushed red berries, smoky oak, licorice and floralnotes dominate the heady bouquet. The wine is full-bodied and quite rich on the palate with black cherry fruit, and subtle vanilla-flavored oak well balanced by soft supple tannins that finish soft and sweet.

Name: Borsao Tres Picos Garnacha
TastingNotes: Dark ruby color with shades of purple.  At  the nose there is a rich aroma of ripe berries with hints of  floral tones typical of the Garnacha, a unique variety.  In the mouth, it is a full bodied rich wine with a taste of blackberries, strawberries and hints of leather, vanilla and plums.  It is perfectly combined with a sweet and pleasant tannin that leads to a long, balanced and smooth finish.

Name: Kendall Jackson Grand Reserve Chardonnay
TastingNotes: "Rich tropical fruit intertwines with grapefruit, lemon and candied lime peel. Elegantly layered, this wine exhibits a lush texture and firm backbone with a hint of vanilla and cinnamon spice to round out the long finish." åÐ Randy Ullom, Winemaster

Name: Taylor Fladgate 20 Year Tawny
Review: "Although this famous name has produced quite a light 20-year-old, that lightness is more than made up for by the beautiful, smooth flavors, the taste of lemon jelly, dried apricots and peaches, and fine, fresh acidity."

Name: Charles de Fere Brut Reserve
TastingNotes: This pale gold wine has white fruit aromas with a touch of hazelnut. The palate is elegant and long lasting.

Name: Columbia Crest Walter Clore
Review: "Firm in texture, with a burr of tannins surrounding a bright core of blackberry, currant and floral flavors that persist into the generous finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Best from 2017 through 2022. 6,000 cases made."

Name: Hartford Court Russian River Chardonnay
Review: åÒDelicious! Baked apples, ripe peach, nectarines and a hint of caramel are all flavors that are present in this Russian River Chardonnay. The long finish has a lovely balance of fruit, light oak and acid. Enjoy now through 2014.åÓ

Name: Matua Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Plum red in color, this wine has a lifted nose of dark cherries and wild thyme. The palate is soft and luscious, overflowing with sweet fruit. Ripe tannins offer suppleness to the palate that finishes with a lingering savoriness.

Name: Honig Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Blackberry, plum and cherry notes are framed with hints of exotic spices, and perfectly balanced by sweet oak. The palate is full and rich, with structured tannins and a long finish.
Review: "A blend of 83% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Petit Verdot, 4% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Franc, the medium garnet-purple colored 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon is spicy on the nose with cassis, plums and cedar scents. Medium-bodied and well balanced, it shows nice purity in the mouth with grainy tannins and good length."

Name: Zenato Lugana DOC
TastingNotes: Appealing distinctiveness, releasing crisp, fruity aromas that gradually expand to a rich complexity characteristic only of Lugana.The palate is rounded and generous, and has a wonderfully long, savoury finish.

Name: Codice Tierra de Castilla
Review: "Brambly, rich summer-berry and chocolate aromas with an earthy and tarry nose. The palate has a smooth feel with dark and dense, fleshy fruit. Rich and even. Drink now."

Name: Don Miguel Gascon Malbec
TastingNotes: A pure expression of the fruit, Don Miguel GascÌ_n Malbec is a full bodied wine with a deep violet color, showcasing flavors and aromas of blackberry, blueberry, plum, dark cherry, and a hint of mocha. The wine is elegant and rich in texture, with plush, round tannins and finely integrated oak characteristics. Final flavors of black spice and maple combine to create a long, velvety finish.

Name: Yellow Bird Chardonnay
TastingNotes: A generously flavored wine with some natural sweetness. Fresh tropical, peach and melon characters are supported by crisp acidity. Drink on release to enjoy the youthful fruit flavors.

Name: Chateau Greysac
Review: "While this is a firm wine, full of dry tannins andsmoky wood-aging flavors, it also has plenty of ripe and juicy fruit. Red berry and black currant show strongly, filling the wine out and promising roundness as it ages."

Name: Fonseca 20 Year Tawny Port
TastingNotes: Fonseca Twenty Year Old Tawny Porto is deep amber in color with russet highlights. Its superb bouquet is a complex marriage of ripe, plummy, mature fruit, warm spicy overtones of cinnamon and butterscotch and subtle oak nuances. Full-bodied and voluminous on the palate, its smooth, velvety texture is carried into a long clean, elegant finish.

Name: Da Vinci Chianti
TastingNotes: Deep crimson in color with aromas of cherries and red fruit balanced by soft, round tannins.

Name: Red Truck Red
TastingNotes: åÒMedium-bodied and complex, flavors of chocolate, berries, cherries and licorice abound. The black pepper finish settles with smooth tannins.åÓCharlie Tsegeletos, Winemaker

Name: Herdade Do Esporao Alentejo Reguengos Reserva
Review: "Smooth and rich, this ready-to-drink wine is powerful yet generous and rounded. Its tannins and black fruits are well balanced, offering richness and concentration. It is a warm, ripe wine that is ready to drink."

Name: Goats Do Roam Red
TastingNotes: Fresh and uncomplicated with ripe blackcherry and plum fruit.  Soft and light with an easy finish.

Name: Joel Gott Cabernet Sauvignon 815
TastingNotes: Offers engaging and layered aromas of blackberry and dark plum with hints of spice, cedar and vanilla. The polished tannins and velvety texture lead to an elegant and long finish.
Review: åÊJames Suckling 92 pointsåÊ(MayåÊ2019)

Name: Beringer Pinot Grigio Main & Vine
TastingNotes: Has a refreshing bite of juicy white peach and citrus, finishing with a flinty minerality.

Name: Villa Maria Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Pronounced aromas of ripe apples and lemons with nuances of fresh grass, straw and lime leaf. Medium bodied with refreshing acidity, it has attractive citrus flavors with apple nuances, and finishes with good persistence.

Name: Joel Gott Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Bright citrus aromas complemented by tropical notes. Refreshing flavors of melon lead to juicy Meyer lemon zest flavors on the mid palate, and a long, clean, and balanced finish.

Name: Fess Parker Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Aromas of citrus, lemon cream and honey combine with toasty oak, nutmeg, yellow apple and orange blossom to create this refreshing Chardonnay. On the palate, flavors of citrus, green apple, honey, light cream and cantaloupe, with great texture, bright acidity and balance, making this Chardonnay a great food-friendly wine.

Name: Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Pinot Noir
Review: "Bright aromas of raspberry and cherry cola are fresh in the glass followed by a medium bodied palate that is soft & elegant with flavors of cherry, plum, hints of vanilla and a touch of clove spice."

Name: Pascual Toso Estate Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "A fruity and fine-textured cabernet with violet, currant and berry character. Medium body, light tannins and a fruity finish. Drink now."

Name: Masi Bonacosta Valpolicella
TastingNotes: Intense bouquet with ripe cherry aromas. Fresh bingcherryflavors with hints of vanilla, good acidity and soft, silky tannins.

Name: Santa Silvana Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Our #1 selling Pinot Grigio from the Alto-Adige region of Italy! After tasting dozens of samples from this esteemed region, we found a winner! Fresh, crisp and clean, this is truly a great example of Pinot Grigio. This medium bodied wine has lemon peel and apple flavors and a hint of mineral and slate on the finish. A must try!

Name: Barefoot Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Barefoot Chardonnay is a delightful wine with tempting flavors of green apples and peaches. Hints of honey and vanilla enhance the rich, buttery finish.

Name: J. Lohr Merlot Los Osos
TastingNotes: The aroma is dominated by blueberry, raspberry and cherry fruit and layered with lifted spicy, cedary oak. The palate is greated by an array of red fruits similar to those on the nose, with tar, cedar and forest floor adding complexity. The wine has a full midåÐpalate and finish that carries the wine through, with a lingering hint of fruit and licorice spice.

Name: Lapostolle Cabernet Sauvignon Cuvee Alexandre Apalta Vineyard
Review: "This is wonderfully polished and refined with a sexy tannin texture that caresses your palate. Medium-to full-bodied and very refined and polished, showing such elegance, focus and roundness. Drinkable now, but better in 2021."

Name: Groth Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: åÒDense and rich with a concentrated core of black cherry, blackberry, dark plum and blueberry flavors that are supported by hints of herbs and cedary oak. The long finish is supported by a touch of vanilla and polished tannins.åÓ

Name: Avalon Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
TastingNotes: A dense plum/ruby color is followed by a wine with serious ripeness, supple, velvety tannins, abundant black currant, cedar and spice box notes, medium-bodied flavors and surprising texture and length.

Name: Mionetto Brut Prosecco
TastingNotes: The Mionetto Prosecco Brut D.o.c has an intense fruity bouquet with a hint of golden apples. It is very dry, fresh, light in body and well-balanced.
Review: "Some Champagne like finesses. Minerals, toast and real fruit tastes, especially apples and pears. A little bit of weight makes it especially good with food. Repeat Favorite!"

Name: Yellow Tail Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: The Yellow Tail Cabernet Sauvignon has a touch of mint on the nose, layered over aromas of blackberries and vanilla. The palate has great length with toasted oak, ripe fruit and soft, velvety tannins.

Name: Patz & Hall Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
TastingNotes: In the bouquet, this cool-climate charm takes the form of bright, fresh and flirtatious cherry and strawberry flavors. These fetching aromas are echoed on the palate, where complex layers of mulled cherries, strawberries and raspberries intermingle with spicy cinnamon and clove elements.
Review: "Intense and vibrant flavors of dark cherry, cedaryspice and cola are backed by powerful acidity, with medium-grained tannins on the sinewy finish. Best from 2020 through 2023."

Name: Avignonesi Vino Nobile di Montepulicano
TastingNotes: Intense aromas of fresh, red fruits and forestfloor with a touch of sweet spices. The taste is medium-bodied, round and elegant with silky tannins and a long lasting finish.
Review: "A light, elegant style, delivering cherry, iron, leather and earth flavors in a balanced profile. Clean and lively, with a lingering aftertaste of leather, earth and almond. Drink now through 2023."

Name: Four Vines Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This is crisp, concentrated Chardonnay with all its natural acid. Naked exhibits apple, white peach, and pear, finishing long with hints of citrus and mineral.

Name: Four Vines Zinfandel
TastingNotes: On the nose the wine has layers of berry fruit and anise aromas with hints of spice. On the palate, blackberry and spicy plum fruit with a rich mouth feel trailing to a velvety toasted oak finish. Enjoy with a friend!

Name: Walter Hansel North Slope Chardonnay
Review: "The 2016 Chardonnay The North Slope Vineyard fleshes out beautifully in the glass. Textured, resonant and inviting, the 2016 offers a compelling interplay of dense fruit, lifted aromatics and gorgeous mis-weight structure. Lemon confit, white flowers and lightly honeyed notes grace this exquisite Chardonnay. The 2016 Cahill Lane is another impeccable wine from Steven Hansel."

Name: Raymond R Collection Merlot
TastingNotes: Raymond R Collection Merlot fills the mouth with smooth cherry, raspberry and plum flavors along with hints of earth and spice in the toasty vanilla finish. Full-bodied, yet approachable, with a good balance of acid and tannins.

Name: Twenty Bench Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Twenty Bench is a wine of great personality, with aromas of fresh red-fruits and blackcurrant scents dominating the nose. It is quick to express itself on the palate with harmonious flavors of cassis, blackberry, cigar box, dark chocolate and vanilla spice.

Name: Allegrini Valpolicella Classico
TastingNotes: This young and vibrant wine is rich with cherry aromas and flavors of cherry and spice on the palate. Medium bodied and light tannins make this wine very approachable.

Name: Buehler Vineyards Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Aromas of peach, pineapple, and citrus blossom are complemented by sur lie notes of crÌ¬me brulee and graham crackers. On the palate, the wine displays a creamy, lush texture with a long, lingering finish that invites another sip.

Name: Feudi di San Gregorio Greco di Tufo
TastingNotes: The taste is rich, oily, fresh, balanced with a good structure based on mineral content.The finish is elegant and full-bodied with the scent of peach.

Name: Herdade Do Esporao Branco Reserva
TastingNotes: Creamy and complex, well balanced, deeply fruity with minerality and a fresh and persistent finish.
Review: "The 2016 Reserva Branco is a terrific one this year, an equal blend of mostly AntÌ£o Vaz, Roupeiro and Arinto. About 40% of the juice was aged for six months in a 60/40 mixture of new American and French oak, with the rest in stainless steel. This comes in at 13.5% alcohol. Over the years, the depth has increased with this bottling, and the structure is better. Plus, the oak impact is less. This looks like one of the best offerings in this brand. It is beautifully focused and has a bite on the finish. It adds reasonably good depth, caressing initial mouthfeel and well-integrated wood, all nicely matched by the acidity. This is a great food wine that should age reasonably well, too. The acidity this year should support it as it ages, but let's take that in stages. There were 240,000 bottles produced, which means this well-priced bargain should be available."

Name: Ravenswood Cabernet Sauvignon Vintners Blend
TastingNotes: Cassis-like fruit mingled with an oak spiciness, and earthy complexity. It is fresh, bright and pleasing to the nose. In the mouth, it is balanced, flavorful and has a long finish that is never heavy or cloying.

Name: Castle Rock Cabernet Sauvignon Napa County
TastingNotes: This elegant full-bodied wine has a deep ruby color, has aromas of dark cherry and molasses, and is loaded with nuance and flavor. On the palate it gives flavors of black cherry, ripe plum and spice with hints of light oak. These flavors unite to form a long, smooth and harmonious finish

Name: Castle Rock Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Our Pinot Noir is elegant and medium bodied, with aromas of herbal spice and cherry. On the palate the wines gives flavors of blackberry, cinnamon, and sweet vanilla oak, and it finishes long and harmoniously.

Name: Justin Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Offers a merge of red and black fruits, delicate spiciness from carefully selected American oak barrels, and deep brooding opaque color. A meaty entry gives way to a generous back palate of supple but not shy tannins, a graceful flow across the palate, and a fine, debonair finish.

Name: Duckhorn Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This is made from grapes grown at Three Palms Vineyard, alongside other valley floor and mountain fruit, including 10% Merlot and smaller percentages of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Smooth, lush and robust in dark cherry and plum, it's fruit forward and full bodied, with considerable ripeness."

Name: La Scolca White Label Gavi
TastingNotes: Light straw color. Typical Gavi nose; fine and pleasantly fresh. Delicate in the mouth, very dry, characterized by a crisp and refreshing acidity.

Name: Louis M. Martini Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
TastingNotes: The Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon was crafted from several of Sonoma CountyåÕs most prestigious appellations and blended seamlessly to bring together the unique characteristics of each, creating a superbly balanced Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine offers many layers, featuring aromas and flavors of red cherry, blackberry and fresh sage with an underlying dry creek dustiness. Subtle herbal notes are complemented by additional layers of chocolate and vanilla, resulting in an easy drinking, but complex wine.

Name: Antinori Chianti Classico Peppoli
TastingNotes: The wine is ruby red in color with aromas of ripe red fruit and well amalgamated notes of vanilla and coffee. The palate enjoys a notable support from the acidity, which maintains a pleasurable freshness and persistence of flavor along with soft and sweet tannins which guarantee excellent drinkability.

Name: Benton Lane Willamette Valley Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Very deep and complex aromas of Bing cherries, graham cracker pie crust, mushrooms and blackberries just leap from the glass. In the mouth blueberries, red raspberries and baked strawberries are ripe and viscous. This is a wine of tremendous depth and nuance.

Name: Edmeades Mendocino Zinfandel
Review: "Tight, concentrated aromas of black fig and dark chocolate meet beefy, earthy and ripe berry flavors in this high-powered, concentrated wine. It has a full body and firm tannins that give it a powerful structure, with nice depth and a lingering chocolate and cherry finish."

Name: Erath Winery Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: This lustrous beauty showcases aromas of raspberry pie with pleasing hints of mint, citrus and a provocative suggestion of smoke. Fresh and bright flavors on the palate are balanced with a blend of juicy cherry and racy pomegranate. An easy sipper yet enough acidity to pair beautifully with your favorite dish.

Name: Chappellet Mountain Cuvee Proprietor's Blend
TastingNotes: Vibrant aromas of blackberry, black cherry, dried fruit, and baking spices jump from the glass. In the mouth the wine is rich in dark fruit flavors, with hints of mocha and roasted coffee beans. Full, fairly big tannins are well integrated in the body and fruit character.

Name: Trimbach Pinot Gris Reserve
TastingNotes: TrimbachåÕs Reserve Pinot Gris has abundant ripe fruit on the nose and a creaminess on the palate are brought to life with subtle acidity. Softer and less challenging than other varieties, this wine is still totally dry.

Name: Barefoot Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Bursting with summer fruit flavors like honeydew melon, nectarine and peach. Pear and lime notes meld into a soft finish.
Review: åÊUltimate Beverage Challenge 89 pointsåÊ(JunåÊ2018)

Name: Zaccagnini Dal Tralcetto Bianco
TastingNotes: Light yellow color with green reflection. Delicate, yet fragrant bouquet on the nose. Aromatic and pleasant; fine and elegant taste, with a cool and very harmonic finish.

Name: Lanessan Haut Medoc Bordeaux
Review: "Impressive ripe blackberry and darker plum fruits with notes of earth and warm stones. The palate has a supple, even-paced and fresh fruited heart of red cherry and plum fruits. Smooth tannins flow long. Try from 2021."

Name: Monkey Bay Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Pale lemon in color, with green tints and brilliantclarity. This wine has a vibrant bouquet of citrus and tropical fruits, with hints of cut grass. A fresh, lively, approachable wine overflowing with ripe grapefruit, lemon and passionfruit and infused with delicate herbaceous characters.

Name: Yellow Tail Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: This Pinot Grigio displays lovely aromas of passionfruit and lime, with upfront fruit and a crisp, clean and refreshing palate.

Name: Mcmanis Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The nose of the wine is a beautiful gallimaufry of Pear, Peach, Lychee and tropical fruit. Notes of Vanilla and toast are contributed from French Oak aging. A richly textured offering of melon, Pear and Pinapple flavors are palpable in the mouth.

Name: Barefoot Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Quick! The berries are coming! Big berry flavors like currant, raspberry and blackberry jam with a velvety vanilla finish. Lush and lasting, it is sure to make a big impression.
Review: åÊUltimate Beverage Challenge 89 pointsåÊ(JunåÊ2018)

Name: Barefoot Merlot
TastingNotes: Barefoot Merlot is a luscious wine with alluring flavors of boysenberry and chocolate. Hints of anise and subtle tannins complement the decadent, silky finish.
Review: åÊUltimate Beverage Challenge 87 pointsåÊ(JunåÊ2018)

Name: Mud House Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Intense and focused, offering a lip-smacking, tangy expression of lemon-lime, passion fruit and green apple flavors. Very juicy on the finish. Drink now."

Name: Bogle Vineyards Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: The first impression recalls a sun-dappled forest clearing, scattered with sweet wild strawberries and rustic mint. These hints of pine, bright berry and fresh herbs follow on the well-balanced palate, surrounded by soft suggestions of tea leaves and violets. Toasty vanilla winds itself throughout, wrapping around the finish: long, silky and elegant.

Name: Barefoot White Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Dip your toes into the refreshing fruit flavors of Barefoot White Zinfandel! Southern flavors like Georgia peach, sun-ripened strawberries, succulent pears and (even further south) pineapple create perfection.

Name: Oberon Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Vibrant red cherry, candied blackberry, licorice and spice flavors, adding a hint of cocoa powder and a lingering toffee note on the finish.

Name: Cliff Lede Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Gravenstein apple and Meyer lemon greet the nose with floral, high notes of peach blossom. Pineapple and lychee are supported by fine-tuned minerality. A luscious mid-palette expands into a rich and long finish.

Name: Cortijo Rioja Tinto
Review: "Vivid ruby-red. Pungent, herb-tinged cherry and red currant scents are complemented by smoky mineral and peppery spice nuances. Sappy and focused on the palate, offering juicy red berry, bitter cherry and lavender flavors that show good energy and back-end cut. Finishes spicy and long, the easygoing tannins adding grip."

Name: Rocca delle Macie Chianti Classico Riserva Zingarelli
TastingNotes:
Color: ruby red, becoming garnet with age. Nose: ample, intense and refined, with excellent variety of fruity aromas, and a gentle touch of spices released from the wood.

Palate: intense and persistent, with well balanced tannins which support its structure.

Name: Martin Codax Rias Baixas Albarino
TastingNotes: A refreshing food friendly white wine, AlbariÌ±o is crisp, elegant and dry and has aromas and flavors of pear, passion fruit and apple with bright acidity.

Name: Tosca Pinot Grigio
Review: "One of our best value Pinot Grigios. Nice intensity,yet remains delicate and lightly crisp and fruity!"

Name: Adelsheim Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: With its broad array of origins and clones, this wine displays red aromas (candied cherry, pomegranate and raspberry), on the nose and the palate. In addition, one finds a light touch of brown spices (nutmeg, cinnamon, all-spice). True to our house style, it is elegantly textured with seamlessly integrated, silky, polished tannins.

Name: Red Diamond Shiraz
TastingNotes: Aromas of raspberry jam, leather and pepper, minglewith a bit of floral spice on the nose. Spicy floral notes carry through the fruit-packed, medium-bodied palate, finishing with a touch of honey.

Name: Cherry Hill Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: This elegant wine tastes of red berry fruits and cassis, integrated with hints of anise and wood spice. Like all things of beauty, this wine will improve with age, but it is a beauty now!
Review: åÒFocused, light, lively and savory, with distinctive mineral notes coursing through the cherry and raspberry flavors, persisting on the finish with finesse and flair. Drink now through 2023.åÓ

Name: Bonterra Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Bonterra Cabernet offers aromas of bright cherry, currant, and raspberry with notes of toasted oak and vanilla. In the glass, you will find flavors of cherry and currant and a lingering and thoughtful finish. Good structure, a moderate weight, polished tannins and a balanced acidity promise an ever more pleasing wine to come. This is a Cabernet Sauvignon which will continue to evolve and remain enjoyable for quite some time to come.

Name: Lecciaia Rosso di Montalcino
Review: "Spicy, with a core of cherry, leather, loam and tobacco flavors. Ripe and sweet from the fruit, offering a saline note on the long finish. Drink now through 2022."

Name: Terra de Lobos Red
TastingNotes: The wine offers lush red fruit with surprising depth, well balanced, and low in acidity.

Name: Stuhlmuller Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: With its layers of crÌ¬me de cassis, black cherry, olive tapenade, violets and moist earth, there is a lovely classic quality to this Cabernet. On the palate, firm tannins and an inviting freshness frame the dark berry flavors beautifully, with more savory and herbal hints adding nuance and intrigue.

Name: Cloudline Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: On the nose, the earth and fruit clearly say Oregon. Nicely structured, with good complexity, the 2015 Cloudline Pinot Noir has deep, dark berry fruits, blue fruits and cola nuts on the nose and palate. A long, complete finish wraps the experience up nicely.

Name: Domaine Drouhin Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Deep color and excellent clarity. Aromas of rose petals, violets and spices. On the palate, the texture is lush and mouth-coating, but well-balanced. Refined, silky tannins are noted on the finish.
Review: "Open and immediately accessible, this is fragrant and gently floral, with clearly defined varietal character. It opens beautifully into an elegant, aromatic and crisply structured wine, with excellent length. Editors' Choice."

Name: Fleur de California Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Fleur de Carneros is a bright, fresh, charming, andflavorful Pinot Noir from Carneros. The brilliant ruby color sets the stage for aromas of ripe cherry and cranberry, with hints of white pepper and nutmeg. While dominated by effusive fruit flavor, the wine is soft, supple and rich in the mouth.

Name: Burgans Albarino
TastingNotes: A bright greenish yellow color with golden highlights.  A uniquely fruity aroma where the variety is clearly appreciated, highlighting hints of ripe apples, apricots, and peach aromas. In the mouth, it is rich, mellow and well-balanced. The aftertaste is fully rounded and off dry on the palate with juicy fruit flavors, clean acidity and a long, mineral-dominated finish.

Name: Barefoot Bubbly Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Enjoy the refreshing taste of our Pinot Grigiowith a unique twist - bubbles! Barefoot Bubbly Pinot Grigio is one of the only Pinot Grigio sparkling wines from California. Light-bodied and refreshing, our Bubbly Pinot Grigio bubbles over with citrus flavors and orange blossom aromas.

Name: Ghost Pines Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Displays aromas and flavors of plums and blackberries, with layered notes of mocha, toasted pound cake and roasted nuts.

Name: Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: The aromas are fresh and enticing with bright citrus layers supported by subtle undertones of papaya and green mango. On the palate, the tropical notes come to the forefront with rich, lush layers of guava, passion fruit and lychee, as well as hints of herbs and lemon zest.

Name: Bonterra Merlot
TastingNotes: This wine has aromas of black plums, dark cherries and a touch of oak with flavors of plums, dark berries, toasty oak and vanilla spice. In the mouth, it has an elegant and restrained style with nice structure and balance, soft tannins and a long finish.

Name: Roth Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Beautiful aromas of nutmeg, sweet oak and red cherries carry through to the palate. This bright cabernet sauvignon has soft, balanced tannins that are layered with notes of black currant, red berries, and sweet vanilla on the finish.

Name: Altanuta Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Creamy with yellow fruit, dried apricot, to which spicy, herbaceous notes mingle. It has a solid ripe acidity structure, which makes it lively and refreshing, with a long finish.

Name: Luigi Righetti Amarone
TastingNotes: Deep ruby color, full-bodied, a very complex nose that emphasizes dried fruit and almonds with a hint of anise, extremely rich flavors, long, smooth finish and lingering aftertaste.

Name: Sterling Vineyards Pinot Noir Vintner's Collection
TastingNotes: The Sterling Vintner's Collection Pinot Noir has silky cherry, plum, and rose character from grapes grown in cool Monterey County. Vibrant acidity balances the focused fruit flavors, and ten months of aging in French oak gave this wine charming vanilla nuances.

Name: Menage A Trois White Wine
TastingNotes: Undeniably fruity and unabashedly easy. It's meant to be quaffed, not analyzed. The White blend brings together citrus and tropical fruit flavors with crisp acidity.

Name: Montgomery "M" Chardonnay
Review: "The nose on this Chardonnay shows tropical fruit with aromas of melons and peaches with hints of toasty French oak. The palate is fresh, crisp and lively with good fruit concentration and a substantial mouth feel."

Name: Mcmanis Merlot
TastingNotes: Youthful bright purple hues highlight the medium ruby color of the McManis Family Vineyards Merlot. Magnanimous Red Currant, and Raspberry are intertwined with whispers of dark berry pie filling. Juicy and concentrated, the lively mix of fruit flavors are accompanied by the pleasant addition of Milk Chocolate, which has been contributed through oak aging. The wine is succulent and has a pleasing toasty finish.

Name: Bucaro Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
Review: "Dark, full bodied and flavorful! Lush notes of rich, ripe cherries and red berries. Filled with an abundance of soft, round tannins that linger on the long finish. This wine will simply knock your socks off!"

Name: Frederic Esmonin Clos Prieur
Review: "Supple in texture, this red boasts cherry, black currant, graphite and earth notes. Starts out very elegant for the appellation, picking up firm tannins and more weight on the long finish. Best from 2022 through 2035."

Name: Luce della Vita Lucente
TastingNotes: The nose opens with aromas of red-skinned fruits, deep red cherry, wild strawberries, black pepper and milk chocolate; followed by pure nuances of licorice and mineral notes of graphite that are also found in Luce. The palate is warm, rounded and flavorful, with elegant and silky tannins supported by an important alcohol component. The finish is long, characterized by predominantly fruity notes. A wine with a contemporary and elegant profile.
Review: "This has delicious undertones of sage and thyme that highlight ripe yet refined notes of strawberries, red cherries and darker blackcurrants. Full body, a dense, generous texture and a polished finish."

Name: Ferrari-Carano Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Ripe blackberries, blueberry pie, cassis, cedar, Bing cherry, boysenberry syrup, graham cracker, milk chocolate, vanilla, caramel. Velvety tannins, supple, long finish.

Name: Mocali Rosso di Montalcino
TastingNotes: Colored an intense, ruby red with garnet reflections, the Rosso di Montalcino has a finely intense nose with fragrant aromas of small, fresh fruits. On the palate it is delicately dry with aromatic, long-lasting flavors.

Name: Amancaya Grand Reserve Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The 2016 Amancaya is a blend of 70% Malbec, a little higher than normal, and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon from Agrelo and Altamira from the coldest vintage on record. It fermented with neutral yeasts, and half of the volume matured in concrete vats while the other half was racked into French oak barrels, 10% to 15% of them new, for 12 months. There are some notes of leather and earth that give it a rustic twist. It has a mixture of red and black fruit and a medium-bodied palate with fine tannins."

Name: Weingut Fritz Windisch Heimersheimer Rotenfels Dornfelder
Wente Southern Hills Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Lush and rich, with lovely flavors of currant, dark cherry, plum and blackberry. This Cabernet is complex and offers well integrated tannins on a smooth, persistent finish."

Name: Murrieta's Well The Spur
Review: "Proof that the Livermore Valley can make serious Bordeaux blend reds. I love the fresh blackberries that pour from the glass of this elegant, dry red that prompts you to order some roast vegetables or meat right now. Long, crisp finish. 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 27% Merlot, 22% Petit Syrah, the rest Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec."

Name: Little Black Dress Merlot
TastingNotes: Aromas of ripe black cherry, notes of cranberry andherbs, and a charming hint of vanilla oak on the finish.

Name: Earthquake Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Peppery and spicy with plenty of berry fruit (cherries and raspberries) intertwinedwith dusty, loamy soil. Incense and a Provencial garrigue-like notejump from the glass of this impressive wine.

Name: Sileni Sauvignon Blanc Cellar Selection
TastingNotes: Ripe tropical and gooseberry fruit flavors with a zingy finish and impeccable balance. A great aperitif or seafood wine made for drinking young.

Name: Mer Soleil Silver Unoaked Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Light gold color with a pale green tint. Clean, lively aromas of honeydew melon and green apple carry over to delicate tropical fruit flavors of pineapple and papaya, balanced with crisp mineral notes. The full texture lasts through a luxuriously long finish.
Review: "This is a stunning wine, showing the laser-like purity and bright acids that this northwestern part of the Highlands coaxes from the grapes. The brilliantly illuminated flavors range from limes and kiwis to green apples, peaches and guavas. The finish is dry, but with a honeyed unctuousness that could be a touch of botrytis." -

Name: Foradori Granato
Review: "Phenomenal aromas of blackberries, blueberries, violets, perfume and incense. Some tar, too. Full-bodied yet so refined and polished with incredible subtlety and finesse. Lasts for minutes on the palate. Mind blowing. From biodynamically grown grapes."

Name: Lucien Albrecht Cremant Rose
TastingNotes: This is a beautiful mÌ©thode champenoise sparklingrosÌ© made from 100% PInot Noir. Elegant pale salmon color hints at the bright strawberry and cherry flavors carried aloft by lots of rolling bubbles. A perfect celebration wine - try it with turkey, ham or simply for a festive toast!

Name: Hall Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (96% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Merlot and 1% Cabernet Franc) represents the least expensive wine in the Hall portfolio at $55. The color is a saturated purple, and the wine rich, chewy and unctuously textured, with ripe tannin and a round, juicy mouthfeel. For a generic Napa, it has plenty of upside to it and will actually benefit from several more years of bottle age and keep for 15-20 years."

Name: Deloach Russian River Chardonnay
Review: "This is a well-made, well-integrated showcase of the appellation, with crisp flavors of apple, ginger and Asian pear. Hearty in texture and style, it has a lasting bite of anise on the full-bodied finish."

Name: Frog's Leap Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This Sauvignon Blanc opens with aromas of lemongrass, citrus blossoms and wet stone. The wine's deep connection to its Rutherford origin is revealed through the subtle flavors of minerality and stone. Crisp and taut on the palate, this Sauvignon Blanc's bright acid and low alcohol make it a wine of engaging and refreshing restraint.

Name: Seghesio Sonoma Zinfandel
Review: "Plump and supple, with soft raspberry, toasted spice and licorice flavors that glide along a silky finish. Drink now through 2023."

Name: Bogle Vineyards Zinfandel Old Vines
TastingNotes: This supple and mouth-filling vintage leads with juicy blueberry and ripe blackberry fruit. Black pepper and hints of chocolate notes integrate well with this soft, plush body. Subtle hints of spicy oak and pipe tobacco create structure, allowing this wine to stand up to a variety of fare.

Name: Edna Valley Vineyard Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Ripe peach, pear, apricot and pineapple fruit with underlying notes of cinnamon and caramel. MInerlaity and freshness in the mouth with medium body weight and appealing acidity.

Name: Arrowood Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Rich, enticing and complex from the first swirl, this wine opens with aromatics of black cherry, black berry, toast, and crÌ¬me de cassis. These notes gracefully introduce the palate with a harmonious blend of plump berry fruits, notes of cedar, and well integrated tannins on the long, lingering finish.

Name: Robert Mondavi Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
TastingNotes: An intriguingly deep color leads to highly fragrantaromas and fleshy dark fruits, sage, bay leaf, and a gentle touch of black pepper spice on the palate with a savory finish that all work seamlessly together. This is exactly what we love about Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon: its dense, rich mouth feel, complexity and long finish.
Review: "Tightly wound, with a muscular mix of lead pencil and graphite accenting the core of dense berry, earth, gravel and cedary oak notes. Slowly reveals black licorice, anise and savory herb flavors, but needs cellaring time. Best from 2019 through 2030."

Name: La Vieille Ferme Rouge
TastingNotes: Deep cherry red in color. Aromas of ripe fruit showcasing both the rich and spicy. On the palate flavors of red fruit (blackcurrant and blackberry) and spice with a fresh finish.

Name: Stags' Leap Winery Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Inviting aromas of white peach, apple, spiced pear,and citrus join with floral notes of honeysuckle and roses to create a beautiful bouquet. The fruity aromas carry over to the palate and marry with a subtle creaminess and a touch of warm brioche. This delicate richness makes the 2006 KARIA Chardonnay a versatile wine at the dinner table.
Review: "The 2017 Chardonnay Karia features grapefruit, lime cordial and orange blossoms with marzipan and beeswax hints on the nose. The palate is medium-bodied with lovely vivacity and a refreshing line, finishing zesty."

Name: Boutinot Cotes du Rhone Village
TastingNotes: An exuberantly fruity nose with high notes of complexity and depth is followed by intense lashings of flavour on the palate. The finish is smooth and satisfying with depth and persistence - simple stunning!

Name: La Scolca Gavi di Gavi Black Label
TastingNotes: Pale straw, with delicate greenish highlights. Highly typical, flinty accents; almonds and hazelnut in the finale.

Name: Zaccagnini Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
TastingNotes: Intense violet robe. Aromas of plums and ripe blackberry. Each sip delivers a mouthful of ripe berries, leather and black pepper with subtle hints of oregano, dried herbs, and a touch of vanilla; all leading to a dry, supple finish.
Review: "This is a soft and fruity red with dried berries and hints of fruit cake. Full body, ripe tannins and a delicious finish. An opulent and pleasing wine. Drink now."

Name: Chateau Maris La Touge
TastingNotes: Rich and powerful, with layers of blackberry, crÌ¬mede cassis, and dark plum on the nose. Moderate tannins and blueberry flavors lead to a long finish with soft, lingering spice notes.
Review: åÒ60/40 Syrah Grenache, showed even better this go around. Ripe blackberry, pepper, ground herbs and licorice and emerge from this medium to full-bodied, textured and seamless beauty. Drink it anytime over the coming 4-5 years.åÓ

Name: Deloach Central Coast Chardonnay
Review: "Beautifully crafted with lovely flavors of lemon, pear and pineapple supported with pleasant minerality and nice, balanced acidity."

Name: Flowers Sonoma Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Light straw color. Attractive and delicate aromas of white flowers, tangerine and coconut are evident before opening up to green apples and crisp Anjou pear. Citrus and stone-fruit flavors develop on the palate with the characteristic lemon backbone of the Sonoma Coast. Medium bodied with a crisp and bright acidity the wine finishes with a distinctive coastal minerality.

Name: Flowers Sonoma Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Bright ruby color with violet hues on the rim. Blackberry and briar patch come forward in the initial aromas and evolve into high-toned cherry and bergamot orange. Flavors of dried black cherries and savory herbs complement the bright acidity and supple tannins which frame a lingering and silky finish.
Review: "Big and rich, with flavors of plum tart, dried strawberry and red currant, supported by crunchy acidity. Cedar and hot stone notes emerge on the pure-tasting, minerally finish. Drink now through 2024."

Name: Tommasi Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
TastingNotes: This elegant ruby red wine is produced with indigenous grapes which are selected by hand and dried for 4 months prior to be gently pressed. The Amarone is then aged for 3 years in Slovenian oak barrels. The 2013 vintage shows a warm, ripe scent on the nose that is intense and of great refinement. It is a full bodied wine with lots of cherry notes and plum flavors.
Review: "Complex and beautiful aromas of blackberry, spice and coffee follow through to a full body and silky and polished tannins. Intense fruit is tied into a firm and polished tannin backbone. Beautiful now but better in 2019."

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Horse Heaven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This Sauvignon Blanc from our Horse Heaven Vineyard is a crisp, racy style of Sauvignon Blanc with citrus characteristics. We use partial stainless steel fermentation to preserve the Sauvignon BlancåÕs pure, fresh, vibrant character.

Name: Kim Crawford Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
TastingNotes: A bouquet of citrus and tropical fruits backed by characteristic herbaceous notes that Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc is famous for. An exuberant wine brimming with flavours of pineapple and stonefruit with a hint of herbaceousness. The finish is fresh and zesty.

Name: Ramey Chardonnay Russian River Valley
Review: "This is a great appellation wine, overdelivering on price with an opening touch of matchstick that evolves into a stony, high-toned expression of tangerine and blood orange. Within the fruit are savory notes of nutmeg, hazelnut and ginger that linger leisurely on the lengthy finish."

Name: Gruet Brut
TastingNotes: Focused and richly styled, with spicy tropical fruit aromas and appealing green apple.
Review: "A sleek, expressive sparkler, with floral apple and toasty cinnamon aromas leading to crisp flavors of lime and mineral."

Name: Matanzas Creek Sonoma Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Bright straw in color. The nose delivers notes of honey lemon. After a swirl, honeysuckle flower, tropical fruit and white currant become more evident. A silky texture with pineapple, bright citrus and soft minerality.

Name: Yalumba Chardonnay Unwooded The Y Series
TastingNotes: Pale straw with light green hues, the Yalumba Y Series Unwooded Chardonnay displays aromas of honeydew melon and nashi pear, with hints of grapefruit and pineapple. The palate is silky with flavours of ripe nectarines, guava and grapefruit with a fresh acid finish. Serve with Thai chicken salad or gnocchi with sautÌ©ed prawns and a burnt butter sauce.
Review: åÒFresh and open-textured, as hints of pach and diesel add to the pear and citrus flavors.  Drink now.  8,000 cases imported.åÓ

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Merlot Indian Wells
TastingNotes: The Indian Wells Merlot offers ripe berry fruit aromas and jammy flavors typical of Wahluke Slope reds. This is a full bodied style of warm climate Merlot with a round, supple finish.

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Chardonnay Indian Wells
TastingNotes: With an appealing tropical fruit character and rich, creamy texture, this wine delivers ripe sweet fruit flavors with caramel and brown sugar notes.

Name: Chateau Ste Michelle Canoe Ridge Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Canoe Ridge Estate Cabernet expresses the uniqueness of terroir, year in and year out. The 2013 vintage, which was quite warm and early, intensified these qualities. Classic Horse Heaven Hills fruit flavors of cherries are expressed as ripe/dark cherries. Canoe Ridge's elegant tannins are still fine and powdery, but with an added level of extract and density. A beautiful expression of Canoe Cabernet in a wonderfully warm and balanced vintage. Enjoy with everything.

Name: Justin Isosceles
TastingNotes: A deep ruby core. Gorgeous ripe raspberry and currant with soft oak notes of vanilla. A touch of roast coffee adds to the dazzling range of aromas. On the palate, layers of clean, direct fruit show themselves varyingly with each sip as flavors of black currant and brown spice intensifies.
Review: "Shows a measure of finesse and restraint given the size, which is big and expressive, offering notes of plum, blackberry, baking spices and cedary oak. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2020 through 2032"

Name: Macmurray Central Coast Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: This Pinot Noir has elegant varietal fruit character, with rich aromas and flavors of raspberry, cherry, red current and boysenberries. Hints of mushroom are supported by a subtle oak influence.

Name: Raymond Napa Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This wine opens with fragrant aromas of honeysuckleand orange blossoms followed by lemon, lime and pear notes amid toasted almond and honey. A rich, full, mouth feel with balancedacidity and bright lemon, pear, lime and passion fruit flavors followed by a smooth vanilla and toasted oak finish.

Name: Menage A Trois Red
TastingNotes: Even if red wine is not your speed, give our MÌ©nageÌÊ Trois Red a try. This wine exposes the fresh, ripe, jam-like fruit that is the calling card of California wine. Three saucy grapes make up the blend. Zinfandel adds a juicy character, Merlot mellows and Cabernet adds backbone. Forward, spicy and soft, this delicious dalliance makes the perfect trio.

Name: Macrostie Chardonnay
TastingNotes: In the glass, this nuanced Carneros Chardonnay is abeautiful pale gold,offering inviting aromatics reminiscent of baked custard and lemon oil. On the palate thewine reveals balanced layers of apple and tropical fruit, accented by a hint of enticing cinnamon spice. The finish is clean, crisp and refreshing, inviting another sip. Though already drinking beautifully, this wine will only gain depth and texture with a few months in bottle.

Name: Beaulieu Vineyard Bv Coastal Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Yellow-gold color. Strong, fresh apple-citrus aromas with a hint of vanilla. Medium full- bodied, with creamy texture and round, succulent, juicy flavors, this vintage reveals ripe apple fruit combined with hints of green almond and pear in the finish. Moderate acidity heightens the wine's approachable softness.

Name: Cellar No. 8 Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: A great example of California Cabernet with a deep ruby core and intense aromas of blackberries, black cherries, spices and toast. The palate is dry with flavors of dark fruits, cloves and oak toast, supported by ripe, supple tannins and followed by a long finish.

Name: Mirassou Winery Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Displays deep rich blackberry and black currant flavors. These primary flavors are complimented with secondary flavors of vanilla, hints of spice, dark chocolate, black pepper, and elegant licorice and cocoa aromas. This Cbaernet is full bodied with a soft finish of moderate length. This wine is at its best if enjoyed within a year of release, but should be able to age in the bottle for up to three years

Name: Mirassou Winery Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Displays intense fruit flavors of citrus, tropical fruit, and green apple. These primary flavors are complimented by secondary flavors of pear, melon, citrus, and floral characters. Subtle oak influences contribute a subtle creamy and vanilla character, resulting in a well-balanced, medium-bodied wine.Crisp and delicately structured, as a result of the cooler but sunny growing conditions that provide naturally firm acid levels, this wine is extremely food friendly. It is at its best if enjoyed within a year of release, but should be able to age in the bottle for up to three years.

Name: Mirassou Winery Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Intense flavors of strawberries, pomegranates, and cherries. These primary flavors are enhanced by secondary flavors of floral and spice characters. This wine is at its best if enjoyed within a year of release, but should be able to age in the bottle for up to three years.

Name: Mirassou Winery Merlot
TastingNotes: Luscious fruit flavors of black cherry and blackberry. These primary flavors are augmented with secondary flavors of vanilla, toasty oak and spices including clove and nutmeg. The addition of complementary varietals contributes to a velvety mouth feel and lingering, smooth finish. This wine is at its best if enjoyed within a year of release, but should be able to age in the bottle for up to three years.

Name: Jim Barry The Lodge Hill Shiraz
TastingNotes: Displays lifted notes of pepper spice, nutmeg and caraway seed with lashings of boysenberry mixed with spearmint. The palate is medium bodied and seamless with an abundance of choc-mint, raspberries and black cherries, all wrapped up in integrated, well seasoned oak.
Review: "Full crimson-purple; the back label proclaimsthat the Lodge Hill Vineyard is the highest in the Clare Valley at 440m (it isn't), and the wine has cool-grown nuances in its bloodstream; jet black fruits have rivulets of licorice, pepper and spice with banks of fine, savoury tannins."

Name: Zenato Valpolicella Superiore
TastingNotes: Ruby-red in color tending toward garnet as the winematures. Dry and robust on the palate with an excellent, velvety texture, this wine offers fleshy aromas of wild berries, currant, black cherry and spice, framed by intriguing hints of chocolate.
Review: "Fantastic Valpo with cherries, plums and hints of walnuts and mushrooms. Medium body, pretty density and a long, flavorful finish. Drink now."

Name: Casa Castillo Monastrell
Review: "The first wine in the range is the 2016 Monastrell, which in reality contains some 8% combination of Garnacha and Syrah, cropped from a more continental, cooler and dry vintage. Like all the wines from the property, it fermented with indigenous yeasts, in this case with grapes from different plots, and matured in used oak barrels for eight to nine months. Juicy, primary, incredibly fresh and with a vertical palate, longer than wider. This is always a great value, even more so in 2016."

Name: Villa Puccini Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Enjoy Villa Puccini Pinot Grigio young and fresh with seafood, pasta dishes, poultry and friends.

Name: Sbragia Home Ranch Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Wonderful tropical and pear aromas with fresh pineapple

column1: and lemon with spice notes and a hint of Dry Creek minerality that lingers through the mouth and into a rich and refreshing finish.

Name: Montgomery "M" Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Round and rich flavors of wild berry, plum, and mocha. It offers a complex mid palate with a big body which is uncommon in a wine at this price point. This wine finishes long and smooth.

Name: Avalon Cabernet Sauvignon California
TastingNotes: The nose shows cherry pie, rhubarb, boysenberry jam, and a hint of rosemary. French oak adds a touch of vanilla and nutmeg. The wine drinks of juicy blue and black fruit flavors with subtle oak to round and balance the wine.

Name: Alba Vineyards Red Raspberry
TastingNotes: It is produced entirely from whole red raspberries,fermented on the skins for twenty days to maximize the fresh berry character. The wine is finished sweet, with a slight tart edge to provide a rich berry experience without a cloying, syrupy finish. As a result, it is one of the few wines that can marry well with chocolate desserts. It is delicious mixed with Champagne, as in a åÒKir Royale,åÓ or simply served in a small glass as one would serve port or sherry.

Name: Dr Frank Semi Dry Riesling
TastingNotes: Presents with a light golden hue and a nose of orange blossom, lavender and pear. A vibrant mouthfeel with flavors of apple, peach and mandarin oranges with a zesty fruit finish.
Review: åÒThis is concentrated and simply stuffed in the mid-palate for this price range. Lingering nicely on the finish, it is clearly off-dry, but doesn't really seem sweet. This leans more on the fruit than the intense, laser bursts of acidity common to many young Rieslings, but its acidity easily balances the sugar--so, it is clearly there. As the wine airs, warms and opens up, it shows more crispness. It's ultimately fresh and lovely, beautifully balanced and delicious.åÓ

Name: Feudi di San Gregorio Falanghina
TastingNotes: Color - Pale gold with green highlightsBouquet - Elegant, intense aromas of apple, banana and pineapple with hints of white flowersTaste - Medium-bodied with a lingering finish of citrus and minerals

Name: Murphy-Goode Merlot
TastingNotes: Inviting aromas of black cherry and thyme deliver awine with rich flavors of blackberry jam, nutmeg and dark fruit. The blend was aged in small oak cooperage to polish the soft tannins and complement the finish with a sweet toastiness.

Name: Magnificent Wine Co. House Wine
TastingNotes: Tantalizing blueberry, cassis, leather and pine bark aromatics swirl in the glass. Deep fruit flavors of cherry and strawberry blend with notes of licorice on the palate. Dusty, firm tannins support lingering fruit on the long finish.

Name: Tiefenbrunner Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Straw yellow in color with lemon highlights, this Pinot Grigio is youthful and lively. On the nose, this wine has aromas of citrus, white flowers, pears, apples, and meadow grass. Up-front citrus flavors give way to stony minerality and a crisp finish. Wonderful as an apperativ as well as a wine that will pair well with butter-poached fish, scampi's, and pasta primavera.

Name: Red Diamond Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Aromas of cassis and licorice with hints of leatherprecede a rich, velvety-textured palate of red fruit jam and a sweet touch of toasty oak on the long finish.

Name: Red Diamond Merlot
TastingNotes: Our Washington Merlot opens with a beautifully knitblackberry, cherry and spice scented nose with a toasty oak background. Sweet fruit on the palate is complemented by medium-bodied but firm tannins.

Name: Spy Valley Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: The bouquet exhibits passion fruit and ripe melon with underlying herbal notes and hints of mineral/flint/ Pure fruit flavors shine through on the palate, the lees aging has provided weight, interest and balance.

Name: Tait The Ball Buster Red
TastingNotes:
#36 Wine Spectator Top 100 of 2017

Deep Black Purple. Intense aromas of blackcurrent, Stewed plums, Cherry, and chocolate. Full bodied berry palate with a sweet long lasting finish.
Review: "Pure, juicy blueberry and cherry flavors are set up against chalky tannins, which add traction to the lush fruit. Black tea and spice notes linger on the finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2028."

Name: Sterling Vintner's Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: The Sterling Vintner's Collection Sauvignon Blanc opens with classic aromas of tropical fruit, citrus and honeydew melon. The perfectly balanced flavors echo the bright fruit aromas, picking up stone fruit (apricot and peach) notes before culminating with a crisp finish. Intriguing hints of minerals and lemongrass, typical of the Sauvignon Blanc grape, add interest to the fruit character.

Name: Remelluri Rioja Reserva
Review: åÒThe 2007 Remelluri is composed of 90% Tempranillo,5% Graciano, and 5% Garnacha fermented with indigenous yeasts and aged for 16 months in seasoned French and American oak. Deep purple in color, it reveals an already complex bouquet of exotic spices, leather, violets, mineral, and assorted black fruits. In the glass it is succulent with plush fruit, terrific grip and volume, and a lengthy, rich, supple finish. It can be approached now but is likely to continue filling out for several more years.åÓ

Name: A To Z Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Elegant and complex aromas of bing cherries, cranberries, red currants, raspberries and strawberries, a combination of wild flowers and fresh forest berries that epitomize Oregon Pinot Noir.

Name: Smoking Loon Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Ripe with heavily extracted cherry and strawberry flavors with a slight astringency akin to pomegranate seeds.

Name: Blackhawk Merlot
TastingNotes: We made a deliciously attractive wine that's ready to drink. This wine is soft, rich and full of ripe plum and raspberry fruit. Our Merlot is well-balanced with nice texture and supple tannins.

Name: Rengo Amarone
Review: "Aromas of blackberry and currant with an array of flavors including blackberries, raisins, dried fruit, fig and spice. Full bodied with a rich finish."

Name: Brewer Clifton Santa Rita Hills Pinot Noir
Review: "A chiseled red, with notes of underbrush to the dried raspberry and red currant flavors that feature accents of persimmon and pomegranate. Cardamom details show on the finish. Drink now through 2022."

Name: Novellum Chardonnay
Review: "A sensational wine that will compete with wines five times the price, the 2016 Novellum Chardonnay is the real deal and actually reminded me of a Chardonnay from Mark Aubert in California's Sonoma County. White peach, crushed rocks, spice and brioche notes all emerge from this medium to full-bodied Chardonnay that has depth, layered texture and length. Buy it."

Name: Mollydooker Boxer Shiraz
TastingNotes: The Boxer Shiraz gives a deep garnet-purple color and aromas of crÌ¬me de cassis, blackberry preserves and mocha plus an undercurrent of vanilla and cedar.  The palate is very generously fruited, offering a whopping mouthful of spiced blackberry flavors with a low to medium level of silky tannins, enlivening acid and a long finish.
Review: "Perfumed, with black tea and dried floral notes that add aromatic intensity to the core of ripe plum, berry and candied cherry. The tannins offer some appealing traction to the density of flavors, finishing with plenty of toasted spice accents. Drink now through 2027. 46,317 cases made."

Name: Mollydooker Maitre'D
TastingNotes: This bright and lively wine is awash with notes of cherry, strawberry and blackcurrant, making this wine very approachable and expressive. The rich fruit flavours, coupled with the soft tannins adds to the wine's complexity. A lingering aftertaste of intense fresh plum and spice finishes this wine off beautifully.

Name: Mollydooker Two Left Feet
TastingNotes: Perfect balance among Shiraz, Cabernet and Merlot in seamless harmony. Smooth, creamy flavors of plum, blackberry, and licorice. The perfect wine, like a meal in a glass, with notes of spice, coffee, chocolate, and an array of red and dark fruits with lovely warm, toasted oak.
Review: "Plump blackberry, blueberry and maraschino cherry flavors are ripe, smooth and juicy, with plenty of dark chocolate, spice and toasted coconut accents that linger effortlessly on the velvety body. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2027. 14,934 cases made."

Name: Bodegas Lan Crianza Rioja
TastingNotes: Brilliant red cherry with violet hues. Elegant ageing aromas with hints of fruit.

Name: Gnarly Head Zinfandel Old Vine
Review: "This wine is very generous in fruit aromas and flavors, showing ripe and vivid red cherry, strawberry and plum, with light oak shadings and a smooth, almost soft texture. It's charming and easy to drink."

Name: Peirano Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This Cabernet is solid from start to finish! Delicious, with ripe cherry, dusty berry, dark plum, black raspberry and blackberry flavors which are framed by nice tannins and a hint of vanilla and spice. Midway through the palate there is a surge of coffee bean and chocolate. An excellent value!"

Name: Cellar Can Blau Can Blau
TastingNotes: Lovely deep, dark purple-red. Smooth and fruity initial burst with classic raspberry and black cherry bouquet and flavors.

Name: Barefoot Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Barefoot Pinot Grigio has tart green apple flavors with a white peach undertone. Floral blossoms and citrus aromas do the tango. Light-bodied with a bright finish.

Name: Chateau Thivin Cote de Brouilly
Review: "The 2017 CÌ«te de Brouilly is superb, unfurling in the glass with aromas of ripe cassis, candied violets and plums. On the palate, itåÕs medium to full-bodied, rich and concentrated, structured around fine-grained but chewy tannins and tangy balancing acids, with considerable depth and substance at the core."

Name: Aquinas Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: From the winery, "A deep Ruby red hue, this Pinot Noir unfolds with the scent of rose petals, plums, maraschino cherries and warm cinnamon rolls. The palate bares flavors of raspberries, cardamom, cloves, orange peel, and huckleberries with a subtle finish of cedar and cassis."

Name: Belle Glos Clark & Telephone Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Bursting with aromas of cinnamon, cherry and hints of spiced tea. On the palate the wine is plush with brown spice and sweet oak flavors, layered with deep blueberry and strawberry. Lively acidity leads into a long finish with supple tannins.

Name: Gary Farrell Russian River Pinot Noir
Review: "From a blend of iconic sites, like Rochioli, Hallberg and Martaella, this opens with thick, dense and concentrated tones of dried cherry and cola before unleashing a wealth of white pepper and black tea. It finds a balance between the fruit and the forest elements on the midpalate, finishing in silky brilliance."

Name: Mark West Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Aromas of fresh kiwi and honeydew melon fruits are balanced by lemon cream, freshly baked croissants and vanilla custard. This fresh, clean, bright Chardonnay is fruit driven with flavors of gooseberries. Oak aging rounds out the mid-palate and frames the fruit.

Name: Madone Beaujolais Villages le Perreon
Review: "The dependably delicious 2018 Beaujolais-Villages Le Perreon doesn't disappoint, bursting from the glass with aromas of cherries, wild berries, peonies and licorice. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, charming and enveloping, with a generous and juicy core of fruit, melting tannins and a flavorful finish. This is a terrific value that's well worth seeking out."

Name: Masi Masianco Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Fresh citrus and floral aromas with peach, apricot and citrus flavors. Nicely balanced with a clean vibrant finish.

Name: Sonoma Cutrer Estate Sonoma Coast Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Distinct aromas of ginger and lemon zest are joinedby toasty coconut, melon and caramel alongside a mineral, flinty cedar chest oakiness overlaid by notes of honeysuckle. Well-balanced with a solid acid backbone, the wine is rich and medium-heavy with a broad, yet firm, mid-palate. The long, lingering finish displays a touch of spice and lively acidity. Flavors of lemon, apple, pear, pineapple and cantaloupe, Sonoma's full cornucopia of fruit, join a nutty, spicy, lightly oaky profile.

Name: Oyster Bay Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The nose is filled with attractive toasty oak aromas mixes with a touch of butter. Medium bodied and fruit forward with a creamy texture; the palate shows tangy fruit and just the right amount of acidity that balances well with the oak.

Name: Mommy's Time Out White
TastingNotes: This delicate and fruity wine is a sure pick-me-up for anyone whoåÕs had a long, busy day. The bouquet has notes of pear, citrus and almonds. The first impression upon tasting it is crisp and refreshing, with the Garganega adding body to the midpalate and length on the finish.

Name: The Four Graces Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
Review: "Graceful and sleekly complex, with pretty cherry blossom aromas opening to poised raspberry, green tea and spice flavors that glide along the finish. Drink now through 2026."

Name: Foxglove Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Fresh and lively with aromatic notes of tropical fruit and pear, in a fleshy, medium bodied style, with obvious minerality and precision.

Name: Root 1 Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Perfectly ripe grapes yielded a beautifully coloredand complex Cabernet that is rich ruby in color with dark cherry, black current, toffee and mocha notes. Silky tannins and good structure lead to a long and complex finish accented with vanilla notes.

Name: Tikal Patriota
TastingNotes: Deep reddish purple with aromas of bright berry/cherry fruit. Like swallowing a whole bowl of mixed ripe berries at once. Big body yet very balanced with luscious layers of raspberry, cherry, and cocoa flavors. Just a hint of baking spice at the end brings it all together.
Review: "The 2016 Patriota is a blend of 60% Malbec and 40%Bonarda from La Consulta in the Valle de Uco. It fermented in stainless steel and concrete vats and matured in used oak barrels (60% French, 40% American) for 11 months. It's juicy, with density and a little less oak than in the past. But the tannins are still noticeable, which adds to the rusticity of the Bonarda. In this peculiar vintage, the Bonarda was put in stainless steel, aiming at the texture it provides."

Name: Yellow Bird Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Ripe fruity nose of raspberry and currant flavors. Hints of chocolate raspberry candy on the palate with soft round tannins and chewy character, great finish!!!

Name: Yellow Bird Shiraz
Review: "An attractive Aussie Shiraz with plums and black berry fruits layered with subtle oak characters and finishing with ripe tannins. Drink within 2 years of release to enjoy the youthful flavors."

Name: Alba Vineyards Riesling
TastingNotes: Alba Riesling exhibits a wonderful floral aroma with hints of grapefruit and pineapple, our Riesling is a classic example of what this versatile grape has to offer. Finished slightly sweet, Alba Riesling goes especially well with "Pacific Rim" dishes.

Name: Bodegas Alto Moncayo Veraton
Review: "A very rich and attractively dense garnacha that has a succulent, dark-berry core with such lively, deeply ripe and long tannins. Such depth and great balance. Majestic wine."

Name: Faust Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon is blended of 82% Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller portions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, aged for 19 months in 30% new French oak. The core of the fruit comes from the Coombsville estate blended with some mountain and valley floor fruit from elsewhere. Medium to deep garnet-purple colored, it offers a beautiful core of ripe blackcurrants, blackberries and lavender with nuances of cedar chest, pencil lead and camphor plus a waft of tilled soil. Medium to full-bodied, the palate has a nice, firm backbone of ripe, grainy tannins and well-played freshness delivering a long, vibrant finish."

Name: Santa Julia Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva
Review: "The 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva was also sourced from the Valle de Uco, and this year the key was how long to age a fast-ripening vintage to keep the freshness. It fermented with indigenous yeasts, and part of the wine matured in oak barrels for ten months. It has a little more volume than the Malbec, round and polished, even if it was harvested a little earlier. It has some of the tannins of the variety, but they also use a little Malbec to provide some more rounder ones. 200,000 bottles produced. It was bottled in March 2018."

Name: Santa Julia Malbec Reserva
Review: "Good bang for your buck! Heaps of plum, berry and red blossom combined with chocolate, vanilla and a balsamic edge."

Name: Zuccardi Q Malbec
Review: "The oak is unnoticeable, and in fact, I find similarities with the Concreto: pure, strict, raw and characterful, with plenty of fine-grained, chalky tannins. I find it to be incredibly good and with an amazing price for what it delivers."

Name: Yves Martin Sancerre Chavignol
TastingNotes: Persistent and focused, this wine really sings withits intense notes of lemonverbena, fresh cut grass, and strong minerality, all elegantly displayed on amouthwatering structure. The long finish is bright and lacy, with lovely detail.Very stylish.

Name: Wild Goose Russian River Chardonnay
Review: "A rich, elegant, creamy style, with a complex arrayof floral, honeysuckle, pear and melon flavors that are nicely balanced, finishing with a crisp, complex aftertaste."

Name: Atteca Calatayud
TastingNotes: Displays aromas of cedar, an earthy minerality, black cherry, and lavender leading to a savory, deep, well-balanced red with succulent fruit and a lengthy, seamless finish.

Name: Bodegas Muga Seleccion Especial
Review: "A linear and super-fine wine with black cherry andberry character and hints of flowers. Full body yet very tight and closed. Beautiful texture."

Name: Stonestreet Estate Chardonnay
Review: "The 2016 Chardonnay Estate is a terrific introduction to the Stonestreet Chardonnays. Citrus, apricot, mint and a dash of new oak add nuance to this finely cut mountain Chardonnay. The Estate Chardonnay is another wine that delivers serious quality for the money. Silky and textured, the 2016 hits all the right notes. What a gorgeous wine it is."

Name: Delhommeau Muscadet St Vincent
Review: "Everything you can ask for from a Muscadet, this is pure, vibrant and fresh and immensely drinkable. Peach blossom, citrus and apple notes are wrapped in a lively, polished and silky texture.  At an amazing price.  Screams out for seafood."

Name: Fog Bank Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Fog Bank Cabernet Sauvignon is a rich, full-bodiedwine with aromas and flavors of blackcurrant, spiced plum and vanilla."

Name: Fog Bank Chardonnay
Review: "Fog Bank Chardonnay is a full-bodied wine with tropical melon flavors and a hint of vanilla and toasty oak on the finish."

Name: Mondavi Private Selection Meritage Red Blend
TastingNotes: Offers lavish dark plum, black cherry, and blackberry aromas along with a velvety texture and succulent mid-palate flavors.

Name: La Spinetta Barbera d'Asti Ca di Pian
TastingNotes: Ruby red with purple reflections. Intense, with scents reminding of red cherry, blueberry and cassis. Nice acidty, and good, balanced tannins.

Name: Zuccardi Malamado Malbec Port
Review: "Zuccardi makes its own version of Vintage Port from the Malbec grape. When the fermenting grapes achieve a residual sugar level of 120 grams per liter, the fermentation is stopped by fortifying it with wine alcohol and it is then aged for 25 months in French oak. The finished product is 19% alcohol. The Malamado Malbec is purple-colored, exhibiting an attractive nose of plum, blueberry compote, dried figs, and nuts. The wine is full-bodied, sweet, rich, and full-flavored with additional notes of cinnamon, almonds, and black fruits emerging on the palate. Structured and well-balanced, it should easily evolve for 10-15 years and drink well through 2035."

Name: Tosca Prosecco
Review: åÒFresh peaches and apricots with a fruity nose withhints of apples and almonds and finishing bright and refreshingåÓ

Name: The Show Cabernet Sauvignon
