TastingNotes: Like a Hatch print for an Elvis gig, The Show grabsyour attention. Big and bold, it is dominated by full flavors of dried black cherries, jammypreserves and layers of spice and sweet vanilla.

Name: Erath Pinot Gris
TastingNotes: Enticingly fragranced with honeydew melon, rose petals and bread dough, this wine could not be a lovelier example of one of OregonåÕs favorite varietals. Flavors of green apple, Meyer lemon and a hint of banana offer a mouth-watering juicy palate. The clean, brisk finish begs another luscious fruit-filled sip.

Name: Croft Distinction Reserve Porto
TastingNotes: This rich premium, reserve port is blended from wines of superior age and quality to yield a wine of complexity.  It shows a ripe, jammy, well integrated nose of raisins and black plums with youthful fruit on the palate.
Review: åÊWine Advocate 88 pointsåÊ(JanåÊ2019)

Name: Michael David Zinfandel Old Vine The Seven Deadly Zins
TastingNotes: Notes of sweet plums and pepper dominate the nose, while flavors of blueberry, raspberry, cinnamon, and black pepper pack the palate from start to finish. The silky-smooth tannins hold the wine together and deliver a soft, fruit driven experience.

Name: Annabella Napa Valley Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Luscious tropical fruit notes with bold yet balanced acid profile which gives the mid-palate a juicy, almost nectary appeal as the flavors are balanced between ripe mango and sweet passion fruit. The final finish on the wine is generous with fruit and perfectly balanced with its acidity and understated oak.

Name: Gazela Vinho Verde
TastingNotes: The perfect light and fruity white wine. The brightacidity balances the subtle fruitiness and medium sweetness. Nice bouquet of lemons and apricots.

Name: Gnarly Head Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: This dark, bold Cabernet has solid tannins and jammy fruit, with aromas and flavors of black cherry, currant, dried cranberry and black peppercorn followed by a trio of clove, earth and light toast.

Name: Kangarilla Road Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon is one of the best buys in Cabernet in the marketplace. Aged 18 months in a mix of French and American oak it exhibits deep purple color with classic blackcurrant, crÌ¬me de cassis and toasty oak characteristics. The pallet has a mouth filling, creamy texture which combines plenty of chalky tannins and leads to a long, lingering finish."

Name: Nautlus Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: The 2016 Nautilus Sauvignon Blanc displays intense aromas of ripe passionfruit, elderflower, limes and fresh herbs. The palate introduces a delightful lime/citrus based mouth-watering intensity and finishes with a strong textural component. Delicious upon release, this wine will improve for 3-5 years post vintage.
Review: "Despite battling an unusually warm and wet vintage, this producer once again delivers the goods. This wine balances tropical and stone fruit flavors with green notes of tomato leaf and nettles, alongside a saline, sea swept quality. Texturally, it's like wet stones, with crystalline acidity that buoys the bright fruit and seashell saltiness."

Name: Diseno Old Vines Malbec
TastingNotes: Deep purple with crimson luster, the bouquet is of violets and cherry blossoms that unfold to a hint of tobacco. The mouth feel is sweet with earthy blueberry and rich chocolate, with black cherry and cassis flavors mingled with spicy black pepper and a touch of leather. The finish is long and persistent with soft, sweet tannins.

Name: Red Rock Merlot Reserve
TastingNotes: Has great concentration of Black Cherry, plum and boysenberry fruits with a nice full-bodied middle and a long soft finish.

Name: Ruffino Toscana Il Ducale
TastingNotes: The taste is refreshingly fruity and harmonious, making IL DUCALE the perfect wine for accompanying tasty Italian dishes. Medium bodied, with mellow tannins and a nice balance between fruit and acidity, the taste of IL DUCALE is long-lingering and characterised by hints of blue berries, raspberries and cocoa.

Name: Talley Arroyo Chardonnay
TastingNotes: On the palate, the Talley Arroyo Chardonnay has a creamy texture layered with flavors of pear, wet stone, and vanilla bean that is balanced by a fresh acidity leading into a toasty, elegant finish.

Name: Columbia Crest H3 Horse Haven Hills Merlot
TastingNotes: åÒThe H3 Merlot opens with aromas of raspberries, black pepper and earthy tones which lead to flavors of chocolate covered cherries and plum preserves on the silky smooth palate. The flavors and aromas cumulate in to an intense åÐ yet elegant åÐ finish." Juan Munoz Oca, Winemaker
Review: "Supple and generous, rich but not weighty, with ripe cherry, blackberry and tobacco flavors melding harmoniouslyas the finish rolls on smoothly. Drink now through 2019."

Name: Baileyana Firepeak Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Firepeak Chardonnay leads with bright flavors of crisp apple, pear and pineapple. Aromas of citrus and tropical flavors highlight the complexity of flavors that run throughout. Great acid structure and minerality create a beautifully textured and balanced wine.
Review: "Burgundy-raised vintner Christian Roguenant gets to show his stuff in this line of Firepeak wines. Wet cement, honeysuckle, crisp Asian pear and the slightest hints of tropicality show on the nose, while the palate offers yellow grapefruit, lemon skins, squeezed lime and lime-blossom flavors, wrapped around nervy tension."

Name: Renato Ratti Nebbiolo
TastingNotes: A slightly faded ruby red. Fine, delicate and persistent bouquet with characteristic trace scents of strawberry and raspberry. Pleasantly bitterish, velvety, at once elegant and full.

Name: Palacios Petalos del Bierzo
Review: "The entry level 2015 PÌ©talos del Bierzo, their regional wine, in the new official category that will start working in the appellation from the 2017 vintage, a blend of many different vineyards planted with field blends, where the breakdown might come to some 5% white varieties (Valenciana/DoÌ±a Blanca, Godello and Palomino/Jerez) and around 1% other reds (Pan y Carne, Negrada and Gran Negro), all from vines ranging between 40 and 90 years of age on slopes (half of the grapes around the village of CorullÌ_n and the remainder in the rest of Bierzo). It's a showy, approachable, aromatic and open version of PÌ©talos, and as I tasted it later on in the season, it felt more polished and round, with a lush texture. It's extremely aromatic, in a way similar to the 2012. This is always one of the best values not only of Bierzo but for the whole of Spain."

Name: Zuccardi Serie A Malbec
Review: "Wonderful wine with an ethereal purity. Lots of violets, black pepper and dark, purple fruit on the distinguished nose. Silky and pure in the mouth with well-integrated acidity underpinning the fruit purity and persistent finish. This is the best and purest expression of this region."

Name: Bodegas Muga Rioja Reserva
Review: "Complex nose with ripe black cherries, deeply integrated cedary oak, baking spices, dried flowers, leather, fresh tobacco and earthy notes. This is silky and mellow with long, laid-back tannins that deliver ripe dark plum flavors into a spicy and earthy finish."

column1: The Dolcetto d'Alba is intense ruby red with p<!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->urple reflections. It has a persistent profume of flowers and fruit with scents of violet adn smalll red fruit. The structure is balanced and elegant.

Name: "This is a fruity, dark and exuberant expression of one of Piedmont's most food-friendly grapes. The 2017 Dolcetto d'Alba opens to soft richness and fruity succulence, with dried blackberry aromas followed by candied cherry and prune. You really taste that 2017 sunshine in the ripeness of the fruit. Thankfully, the wine is not too heavy and remains a great pairing option for pasta or lasagna."
Schmitt Sohne Relax Riesling
TastingNotes: This fine Riesling wine offers an extraordinary premium wine quality. With forward fruit and floral aromas of apples and peaches with just a hint of citrus, the wine's natural acidity gives it a perfect balance that is refreshingly crisp and leaves your mouth watering.

Name: Orin Swift Papillon
Review: "Very deep purple-black colored, the 2015 Papillon Proprietary Red features expressive crÌ¬me de cassis, mulberries, plum preserves and chocolate box notes with wafts of underbrush, dried herbs and Indian spices. Full-bodied, rich, opulent and spicy in the mouth, it has a velvety texture and seamless freshness, finishing long with a lively pepper and herbs lift."

Name: Tour de Luchey Bordeaux
TastingNotes: Dark, rich color.  On the nose there is floral blackberry and black currant with a hint of chocolate. Dry and earthy, on the palate, with a hint of old wood and a note of leather that emerges with air. Full bodied and structured.

Name: Paul Hobbs Crossbarn Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Luminescent pastel gold in color, this chardonnay has an aromatic mÌ©lange of stone fruit with hints of lemon zest. The juicy palate is filled with slowly unfolding layers of gala apple, nectarine, and apricot with subtle notes of brioche & lees. The round texture is accentuated by vibrant acidity and a pronounced, mineral-driven finish.
Review: "The 2017 Chardonnay opens with exuberant green guava, warm peaches and pineapple notions with touches of almond croissant and acacia honey. Medium to full-bodied, the concentrated palate is packed with tropical and stone fruit flavors with a pleasant oiliness to the texture and a long savory finish."

Name: Volver La Mancha Single Vineyard
Review: "Bright purple.  Dark berries, cherry pit, licoriceand tobacco on the nose.  Slowly unfolds to offer sappy cassis and bitter cherry flavors lifted by tangy acidity and complicated by a peppery, spicy quality.  Finishes gripping and long, with resonating cherry and spice notes.  Give this some aeration or a couple more years of bottle age."

Name: Coto de Imaz Gran Reserva Rioja
Review: "This dark, relatively tight-knit Rioja proves thatthe Gran Reserva category doesn't just indicate the supremely well-aged, relaxed and reposeful style of Rioja, but can also serve to draw drinkers' attention to outstanding wines of density and tenacity which still have a way to run along their potential ageing trajectories. Look out for dark, urgent fruits here sweetened and back-lit by cunningly angled oak, with intense, deep, fresh and searching flavours in which the 10% of Graciano seems to be working overtime. A Rioja of innate drama."

Name: 337 Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Aromatic treasures of blackberry spice and espresso are accented by a dot of earthiness. The smooth, silky palate offers up plum compote and a touch of peppered saddle leather. Fruit-forward, it continues to open up with blueberries, green tea and a dusty tannin finish. Delicious."

Name: Dashwood Pinot Noir
Review: "The 2017 Pinot Noir is balanced and intense with prevalent cherry flavor complimented by notes of forest floor and a touch of salinity. A spicy, tobacco note along with firm and velvety tannins are present on the long finish."

Name: Smythe & Renfield Chardonnay
Review: "A tropical fruit bonanza greets your senses, as well as a touch of green apple, on the nose. Pear, dried yellow apple and wet stone nuances have good concentration, with a touch of lemon zest and a hint of minerality entice the palate on the finish."

Name: Smythe & Renfield Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Alluring notes of fresh cut grapefruit, lime and citrus are matched with ripe flavors of passion fruit and kiwis.  Excellent with grilled chicken, salads and seafood."

Name: Smythe & Renfield Pinot Noir
Review: "Right off the bat, you are hit with a ripe nose ofbright fruit and a touch of herbs. In the mouth there and intense rush of bright wild berry and red plum flavors wrapped in firm tannin and a grip of cedary oak. A must try for the Pinot lover in all of us!"

Name: Olivier Leflaive Bourgogne Blanc Les Setilles
Mcmanis Petite Sirah
TastingNotes: The McManis Family Vineyards Petite Sirah is vivid purple in color, with aromas of full toned Boysenberry, Cassis and Blackberry. Hazelnut and Toffee are evident in the bouquet. The wine is substantial, elegant and full of ripe black fruit flavors. These fruit flavors are savored in the mouthwatering finish, long after the wine has departed.

Name: Layer Cake Malbec
TastingNotes: Pure, rich and very elegant; a powerhouse of lush black fruit, silky cocoa, black spice and cream, wrapped around blackberry, cherry and ripe plum. Layered and complex with a nose to linger over, a finish that never ends. Sweet anise, hints of tobacco, black chocolate, more cherries and exotic spices, layers of jam. This wine will stand and perform anytime you think of a Cabernet and want something just a little more exotic. Born at the base of the Andes and fed by the purest spring watersåÉI love this wine.

Name: Altocedro Ano Cero Malbec
Review: "A juicy and rich wine with lots of dried fruit andmeat. Full body, round tannins and a savory finish. Delicious to drink now but has the stuffing to age."

Name: Urbans Riesling
TastingNotes: Very minerally and smoky, delivering concentrated flavors of baked apple, golden raisin and spice. The rich finish is spicy, with hints of cream.

Name: Cave L'Aurance Cremant de Bourgogne Brut
Review: "This is BY FAR the best cremant we have tasted in recent memory! Super clean flavors of apples, pineapples and a hint of toast are carried elegantly by the fine mousse. A nice subtle intensity to the flavors last through the lip smacking finish."

Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle Dry Riesling
TastingNotes: The Chateau Ste. Michelle Dry Riesling is a crisp, dry and refreshing style of Riesling. It exhibits fresh flavors of white peach and mandarin orange, and ends with a clean finish.

Name: Durigutti Bonarda
TastingNotes: Lush and spicy ripe-fruit driven nose, with a broad, fairly explosive palate of red cherry, plum, chocolate, and mint. Bright, refreshing acidity holds everything together and makes this an excellent choice with spicy foods.
Review: "Medium red-ruby. Expressive scents of dark berries, spices, smoky oak and earth. Quite suave and vibrant for Bonarda, conveying a sexy sweetness and noteworthy richness to its flavors of red- and blackcurrant, menthol and spices, with an unexpected floral element providing lift. Finishes with firm tannic grip but no dryness. A very good, solidly built Bonarda."

Name: Fado Portugese White
TastingNotes: Straw yellow with a light green hue. Ripe apricot and spice aromas. Intense fruit and a zesty acidity lingers on the palate.

Name: Fonseca 10 Year Tawny Port
TastingNotes: Fonseca Ten Year Old Tawny Port is russet in color with brilliant crimson highlights and a fragrant, ripe-fruit bouquet. Its smooth, silky texture and subtle oak nuances are balanced by a fresh acidity and tannic "grip" that culminate in a long, elegant, plummy finish.

Name: Francis Coppola Diamond Label Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Harmonious, with plenty of flavors of black cherry,plum, wild berry, anise and leather that fold together nicely into a structured long finish. the tannins are evident and will provide at least 2-3 years of aging.

Name: Valderiz Ribera del Duero
Review: "Dense and muscular, yet graceful, this red balances ripe blackberry and cassis flavors with savory black olive, bitter chocolate and mineral notes. The firm tannins are well-integrated, and lively acidity keeps this fresh through the spicy and floral finish. Drink now through 2028."

Name: Bramblewood Zinfandel
Review: "Deep ruby red in color, this Zinfandel shows forward blackberry and raspberry aromas melding with black pepper, licorice and currants. Black cherry flavors follow with nutmeg, allspice, pepper and dark chocolate undertones while the texture is rich and round with some sweet tannins giving backbone and structure."

Name: Charles Smith Columbia Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Dark and persistent with layers of red and black fruit, baking spice and earth.

Name: The Crusher Petite Sirah
TastingNotes: The nose of this inky purple colored wine is rich and complex with aromas of blueberry and cassis with a hint of spearmint. The palate is supple and tannic with lip-smacking caramel and French vanilla sappiness followed by a ripe cassis finish. The wine has balanced acidity and firm tannins and worth aging for a few years.

Name: Layer Cake Primitivo
TastingNotes: Comes right at you with huge, inky black fruit, spice and white pepper, layered and rich in the mouth with jammy black cherries, truffles, espresso and dense, creamy texture. Always in the background are hints of the old seabeds that are the Puglia terroir. This is by far the most versatile wine in the Layer Cake lineup; the big power makes it work with all kinds of meats and roasts, and the soft textures and sweet ripe fruit make it one of the few red wines that works amazingly well with spicy foods.

Name: La Marca Prosecco
TastingNotes: This sparkling wine is a pale, golden straw in color. Bubbles are full textured and persistent. On the nose the wine brings fresh citrus with hints of honey and white flowers. The flavor is fresh and clean, with ripe citrus, lemon, green apple, and touches of grapefruit, minerality, and some toast. The finish is light, refreshing, and crisp.

Name: Barefoot Moscato
TastingNotes: Delightfully sweet with lush fruity aromas. Hints of citrus skip across flavors of juicy peach and ripe apricots. A bright, crisp finish dances in at the end.

Name: Irony Monterey Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Irony Pinot Noir opens with aromas of red cherry, strawberry and undertones of clove and sage. Rhubarb flavors are layered with accents of red cherry, licorice and berry jam. Firm tannins and crisp acidity deliver a lovely balanced, medium-bodied wine with a smooth finish.

Name: Korbel Sweet Rose
TastingNotes: Bursting with flavors of bright cherries and berries, with a deliciously sweet finish.

Name: Frei Brothers Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Impressive structure and rich flavors of blackberry, cherry and spices.

Name: Frei Brothers Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: The cool climate enables Frei Brothers to produce aSauvignon Blanc that exhibits a crisp, mineral-like mouth feel. With citrus and cut grass aromas and a long yet clean finish.

Name: Morisfarms Morellino di Scansano
Review: "The 2016 Morellino di Scansano is fabulous. A hugeoverachiever, the 2016 possesses notable intensity and volume, with generous dark fruit to match its opulent, generous personality. Although quite deep and intense, the 2016 retains striking freshness. Aging in cement really seems to bring out the fruit character. Don't miss it."

Name: Seaglass Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Invigorating scents of lemon, lime, grapefruit, andfreshly cut grass waft from the glass, while clean, crisp notes of gooseberries and tangerines awaken your palate.

Name: Barefoot Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Barefoot Pinot Noir is a medium bodied wine with tantalizing flavors of ripe cherry and wild raspberry. Hints of Vanilla and spice complement a smooth lingering finish.

Name: Beringer Moscato
TastingNotes: This carefully crafted wine offers immediatelypleasing peach-scented and honeysuckle aromas with fresh, sweet flavors of juicy stone fruit, honeydew melon, Fuji apple and ripe pears. It is beautifully balanced with crisp acidity and a clean finish.

Name: New Age White Wine
TastingNotes: New Age White Wine is very light-bodied, but utterly crisp and clean with a sweetish attack on the palate filled with honeydew melon, apricot flesh and zippy, zesty citrus fruit. It has effervescence, and the sparkly quality of the wine adds freshness and again floral and peachy flavors to the experience.

Name: Grey Stack Rosemary's Block Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "This block is home to a mysterious clone of Sauvignon Blanc that appears to be the only one of its kind in the region and thought to hail originally from Northern Italy. The resulting wine is citrus-driven on the nose and on the palate, a pure expression that shows complexity and rich layers of flavor, with an intensity of lemongrass."

Name: Tommasi Rompicollo
Review: "A bright and fruity wine with sweet berry and lemon character, medium body and a fresh finish. Always a delicious bottle with cabernet and sangiovese. Drink now."

Name: Waterbrook Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Buttery aromatics layered with Golden Delicious apples unfold into fresh flavors of winter pear and honeydew melon. Finishes with light toasty notes and crisp acidity.
Review: åÒVibrant and expressive, balancing complex pear, quince and clotted cream flavors on a pinpoint of bright acidity, with a harmonious finish. Drink now through 2017.åÓ

Name: Domaine Cabirau Cotes du Roussillon
Review: "A blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Carignan, and the rest Syrah all from black, schist soils in the Roussillon, the 2017 CÌ«tes Du Roussillon is another beautiful wine from importer Dan Kravitz that represents a terrific value. Black raspberries, crushed flowers, spice, and hints of pepper all emerge from this medium-bodied, sweetly fruited, elegant red that's just a joy to drink. It should keep nicely for 5-6 years."

Name: Ruffino Chianti Superiore
Review: "The Sangiovese notes are dominated by violets and ripe cherries which are well integrated with the spicy scents of vanilla and cloves. On the finish the fruity sensations become riper and reveal elegantly toasted sentors of plum jam. Very smooth, yet fresh and lively. The mature tannins are sustained by the harmonious fruity structure. The long aftertaste leaves notes of mature cherries."

Name: Les Lys Vouvray Chenin Blanc
TastingNotes: Pale lemon color, youthful nose of stone fruit, lemon, a hint of honey and minerality. On the palate, it has intense flavors that are much more citrus-based than the nose, plus a little pear, with a steely minerality.

Name: Da Vinci Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: DaVinci Pinot Grigio has a brilliant light straw color and a full, ripe palate. It is an extremely well balanced wine with a bouquet of floral aromas coupled with ripe flavors of fresh apple, citrus and tropical fruit flavors. This crisp, clean Pinot Grigio finishes with notes of minerals and a vibrant acidity.

Name: Chateau Vrai Caillou Bordeaux Blanc
TastingNotes: The bouquet shows peach, pear and melon scents along with smoky, citrusy, floral and herbal nuances. The flavors are zesty and bright with a minerally-clean freshness that defines good white Bordeaux. The palate-pleasing peach and melon fruit elements are enhanced by nuances of pear, herbs and smoky spice. The finish is dry and clean with an intriguing twist of citrus and spice.

Name: Brazin Old Vine Lodi Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Big, bold aromas of spice and mocha fill your nose,while intense flavors of plum and chocolate, rich tannins and vanilla mocha notes rock your palate.  Brazin is a not a wine to be rushed åÐ donåÕt be afraid to savor its long, lingering finish.

Name: Hart & Mcgarry Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Well-crafted! Combines depth, complexity and concentration. Rich flavors of black cherry, blackberry, dusty berry, dark plum and cassis are backed by a silky texture. The mid-palate offers a touch of mocha and a hint of spice and nutmeg. The finish is long with ample tannins and will only get better in the next few years! This is the first release after hiring a new winemaker and the improvement in quality is obvious."

Name: Hart & Mcgarry Reserve Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This Delicious Napa valley Chardonnay has aromas ofcrisp apple, a touch of citrus & tropical fruit with a hint of vanilla oak.
Review: åÒSmooth and polished with a pretty core of green apple, pear, melon and lemon flavors overlaid by a hint of oak and crisp acidity. The finish lingers giving way to a well- balanced aftertaste.åÓ

Name: Black Pearl Oro
Review: "This Cabernet/Shiraz blend is engaging on the palate with intense, concentrated full bodied fruit flavors that are round, supple and plump. Mouth coating ripe tannins with flavors of black berry, black currant and fig are present on the warm and lingering finish. This is quite impressive for the money and can be enjoyed now or even a few years down the road!"

Name: Pazo de Senorans Albarino
Review: "The 2017 AlbariÌ±o is a rich, medium to full-bodiedwhite that has some serious oomph in its white flowers, stone fruits, and salty, marine-influenced aromas and flavors. Incredibly pure, perfectly balanced, and with a great texture, itåÕs a naked, raw expression of AlbariÌ±o that readers should snatch up."

Name: Picq Chablis
TastingNotes: Pale yellow in color. Lemon, tangerine, and mineralnotes dance on the nose. Rich and supple, with strong acidity yielding a cut to the citrus and mineral flavors. Finishes dry.

Name: Barefoot Riesling
TastingNotes: Barefoot Riesling hits all the right fruit-filled notes with perfect pitch. A delicate orange blossom aroma bounces off juicy apple and tangy lemon flavors for a slightly sweet finale.

Name: Cupcake Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: ItåÕs the long cool seasons in the South Island thatallows Cupcake Sauvignon Blanc grapes to mature slowly, giving the wine levels of complexity and a vibrant zing. This Sauvignon Blanc is reminiscent of a lemon chiffon cupcake. ItåÕs made up of integrated flavors of Meyer lemons, Key limes and a finish that awakens the appetite There are hints of grapefruit, gooseberry and citrus, and comes together with a long, creamy finish.

Name: Peirano Estate Vineyards Petite Sirah
TastingNotes: The senses are tempted by an array of black raspberry, spice, coffee, cocoa, cola and white pepper in the Peirano Estate Petite Sirah. The palate is filled with ripe boysenberry, black raspberry, plum and sweet black cherry and firm tannins, with a hint of smoke and dark chocolate. Enjoy this wine along with a nice grilled steak, baked potato with all the fixings, and good friends. This is a wine that can please now, as well as age out for many years to come.

Name: Peirano Estate Vineyards 'The Other' Red Wine
TastingNotes: Vibrant color and aromas of blackberry and plums are complimented by spice, toasty oak and cedar notes. A wave of black cherries and a hint of smoky dark oak lead to a long seductive Finish.

Name: 181 Lodi Merlot
TastingNotes: 181 Merlot is a lavish expression of classic Bordeaux-style Merlot, bursting with plush tannins and sumptuous notes ofblack cherry, vanilla, stone fruit and toast. Flavors of currant and spicy cedar end with a lingering, luxurious finish.

Name: Primarius Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Inviting aromas of raspberry and watermelon marry with hints of bacon, tar and earthy notes. Tantalizing cranberry, rhubarb and rose hips are interwoven on the palate. This Pinot Noir leaves wonderful flavors of cocoa and clove on the finish.

Name: Johnson Family Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Medium bodied and aromatic with deep red and black fruit flavors. Fleshy and supple texture with a crisp, balanced finish.

Name: Baron de Seillac Brut Blanc de Blancs
TastingNotes: Very pale yellow colour with green glints; complex nose with delicious bouquets of citrus fruits(lemon and grapefruit), of fruits (peaches) and, small white flowers. In mouth, straight attack and a lot of freshness; a very harmonious wine with good persistence.
Review: "Highly Recommended! Hands down my favorite sparkling wine in the store under $15. Ripe and clean with classic Brut flavors of apples, pineapple, citrus and a touch of honey. Tastly bubbles from France at a price that are too good to pass up! A steal."

Name: Baron de Seillac Brut Rose
TastingNotes: Beautiful sweet pink color, very pale; pleasant nose of small red fruits; in mouse, good lenghornamented with a delicious freshness; a fine balanced wine.
Review: "A tasty rose for an attractive price. Hints of strawberries and apples are there in abundance. You can't beat the price."

Name: Belle Glos Las Alturas Pinot Noir
Review: åÒDeliciously pure, rich and layered, with complex currant, blueberry and wild berry fruit that's supple, deep and persistent, ending with ripe tannins. Drink now through 2023.åÓ

Name: Cupcake Merlot
TastingNotes: Cupcake Merlot is a full-bodied yet smooth merlot displaying supple tannins. This is a softer, silkier Merlot with a good balance of oak and fruit. It starts with flavors of red cherries that evolve into decadent flavors of cocoa and espresso mingles into a plush, silky mocha finish.

Name: Cupcake Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Cupcake Chardonnay was crafted to emphasize the Central CoaståÕs creamy and structured Chardonnay character. It starts off with a touch of apple, a hint of tropical fruits and is complimented by a balance of vanilla and spice. We used malolactic fermentation with aging in small barrels to provide a rich mid palate that develops into a long, smooth, satisfying finish.

Name: Rengo Ripasso
TastingNotes: Solid core of currant and plum, plenty of depth with a spicy, mocha and slight oak notes. Medium to full bodied, with fine, fruit-coated tannins and a clean refreshing mineral finish.

Name: Cupcake Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Rich and enticing, the Cupcake Cabernet Sauvignon is a balance between generous profiles of fruit and oak. This full-bodied yet smooth Cabernet Sauvignon displays soft tannins, with primary fruit flavors of blackberry, dark cherry and plums. The dark fruits melt with the flavors of mocha and toasty oak before ending with a long and silky finish.

Name: Mendel Malbec
Review: "The aromas and flavors to this are pleasing with plum, chocolate and cedar character. Medium body and a fresh finish. Always excellent."

Name: Cellar No. 8 California Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Deep, dark rose in color, this stylish Pinot Noir starts off with ripe cherry and red berry aromas. Lush and complex on the palate, this wine shows off juicy strawberry jam and red berry flavors. And just a dash of nutmeg spice. These ripe fruit flavors are balanced by silky tannins.

Name: Renato Ratti Barbera
TastingNotes: Color is intense, cardinal red with sparkling hues.Forward bouquet, with trace scents of ripe plum and an undercurrent of mixed spices. Full flavor with long persistence. It will age for six-to-ten years.

Name: Santa Julia Brut Rose Sparkling
Review: "Elegant sparkling rose made with 100% estate grown, Pinot Noir. Aromas of fresh picked strawberries meet a creamy yet fresh palate, with fine bubbles and loads of acidity. Drink this on the patio with some hors d'oeuvres and a cheese plate, you'll be impressed!"

Name: Kono Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: As close as it gets to biting into a perfectly juicy Granny Smith apple, with a wonderful purity and mouthwatering acidity. This is also extremely smooth, with lime peel and grapefruit flavors that linger on the finish.

Name: Ciconia Alentejano Red
TastingNotes: The wine posses a complexity of aromas that suggestred berries, with some toasted notes as a result of a short period in oak, that in combination with good structure of bark allows it the presentation of a very rounded and balanced wine in the mouth.

Name: Gary Farrell Russian River Chardonnay
Review: "Powerful, with finely detailed dried apricot, apple and green pear flavors, supported by firm acidity. The broad finish offers buttery notes that are well-integrated with spicy accents. Best from 2020 through 2024."

Name: Angeline Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Flavors of strawberries, raspberries and cherry cola, finishing with tea and spice.

Name: Little Black Dress Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Aromas of berry and lightly toasted oak, a hint of vanilla spice and a lush, lasting finish.

Name: Alta Vista Classic Malbec
Review: "Spicy and rich with dried fruit character and intense fruitiness. Full-bodied, round and savoryåÉDrink now."

Name: Telegramme Chateauneuf du Pape
Review: "Very complex and composed. Bright aromas of wild, red-berries and herbs. Some blueberry pastry, too. Plush, ripe and concentrated palate with long, smooth, ripe and powerful tannins. Great depth and detail. Fresh, red-berry and plum flavors run riot on the finish."

Name: Gnarly Head Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Beautifully balanced wine with bright cherry and raspberry fruit flavors followed by hints of spice on the finish.

Name: Dunham Trutina Red Blend
TastingNotes: Aromas of ripe blackberry and dark chocolate lead to complex layers of rich cocoa powder, brandied cherries and a hint of cola. Lush, well-integrated tannins showcase another vintage true to its name. Enjoy now with friends over a memorable meal or cellar for 8-10 years...if you have the patience!
Review: "The 2015 Trutina from Dunham is a blend of 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Merlot, 10% Malbec, and the rest Cabernet Franc. It's another beautiful wine from this estate that over-delivers. Gorgeous crÌ¬me de cassis, black raspberry, vanilla bean, and Asian spice notes all emerge from this medium to full-bodied, seamless, elegant beauty that has real class. While it's not a blockbuster, it just glides across the palate, has notable purity of fruit, and a great finish, all making it a terrific value, even at the roughly $30 price point."

Name: Pacific Rim Sweet Riesling
TastingNotes: Moderately sweet and refreshingly low in alcohol with flavors of pineapple and peach.

Name: Quinta Do Cabriz Dao Red
TastingNotes: "A briliant blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz an Alfrocheiro. Smoooth and complex showing the true nature and terrioir of the Dao region. Enjoy with steak, lamb chops or veal in marsala sauce."

Name: Zestos Old Vines Garnacha
TastingNotes: Lots of intense red fruits backed by a touch of spice.

Name: Seaglass Riesling
TastingNotes: Exotic floral aromas and rich flavors of juicy, honey drenched apricots and peaches.

Name: Stuhlmuller Alexander Valley Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Beautiful citrus and lemon custard aromas as well as lovely orchard fruit notes. Flavors of green pineapple, pear, orange blossom and apple are revealed on the palate, supported by bright, food-friendly acid and subtle textural notes imparted from the French oak and sur lie aging.

Name: Casa Santos Lab Red
TastingNotes: The color is bright and ruby with tasting notes of ripe black and red fruits. The palate has a juicy plum and dark berry fruit flavor. Fine tannins are at the finish along with flavors of spice and licorice.

Name: Santa Cristina Chianti Superiore
TastingNotes: Ruby red color with purple hues. Ripe red fruit aromas, particularly cherry and redcurrant, dominate the nose, while hints of vanilla from the oak aging develop as the wine breathes. The palate is well-balanced and complex, with sweet tannins and ripe red fruit notes upfront, and more savory flavors lingering on the finish.

Name: Santa Cristina Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Straw yellow in color, the wine shows delicatearomas of orange flowers, bananas and tropical fruit. On the palate, the flavors are savory, refreshing and contain notes that recall the fruit first felt on the nose.

Name: Monte de Cal Reserva Red
TastingNotes: Very spicy nose, with dense, powerful flavors of dark plum, mineral and graphite leading to bittersweet chocolate on the finish.
Review: "This wine is a lot more serious then its price point indicates. Well structured with powerful flavors of dark plum, mineral and graphite leading to nice cherry notes on the finish."

Name: Duckhorn Napa Merlot
TastingNotes: Bright, lifted red fruit elements with darker, moreextracted layers. This depth is on display in the aromatics, where notes of Asian spice, red current, plum and blueberry crisp are supported by a subtle streak of earthiness. The palate is both velvety and balanced, with flavors that echo the aromas. These flavors are held together by granular tannins and accented by oak-inspired notes of molasses and nougat.

Name: Frank Family Vineyards Zinfandel
TastingNotes: The Napa Valley Zinfandel is garnet in color, and opens with aromas of raspberries, vanilla, and earthy dried herbs. Medium-bodied on the palate with an abundance of fresh fruit and black pepper flavors on the entry, this wine is round, silky, and finishes with flavors of ripe blackberries.

Name: Dr Frank Pinot Gris
TastingNotes: Delicate aromas of lemon, fennel and cherry blossoms delight the sense and draw you towards a soft fruity taste with a dry zesty finish.

Name: Dr Frank Gewurztraminer
TastingNotes: Aromas of orange blossoms, citrus and banana. The light residual sugar gives a subtle honey introduction followed by an acidic balanced enhanced with the slatey influence of our estate vineyards.

Name: Marchesi di Barolo Gavi
TastingNotes: Straw-yellow color with bright green reflections onthe rim of the glass. On the nose, the aromas are intense and refined, fruity and flowery with scents of golden apples, pear, almond and chamomile. Hints of golden apples, refreshing honeydew melon and citrus zest blend perfectly on the palate. The finish is harmonious and persistent.

Name: Cupcake Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Cupcake Pinot Grigio is full with a nose that showshints of pineapple, pears and sweet lemons. The body is full and gives way to a creamy mid-palate, integrating tropical fruits with the vibrant zing of citrus fruits.

Name: Joel Gott Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Joel Gott Unoaked California Chardonnay has aromas of ripe pear and honeydew melon with floral notes. On the palate, the wine opens with bright citrus and tropical flavors, leading to a round mouthfeel balanced by good acidity, and a long finish.

Name: Volpi Moscato
TastingNotes: Displays tropical fruit and floral notes with lively acidity and a light-bodied finish.

Name: Chalk Hill Estate Red Blend
Review: "The 2010 Proprietary Red Estate (43% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Merlot, 15% Malbec, 12% Petit Verdot, 10% Syrah and 1% Carmenere) is something to be endorsed as the wine world tries to move from a varietal-conscious, mono-cepage philosophy to where the best wines will tend to be blends, even if they are dominated by one grape or another. Chalk HillåÕs 2010 Red Estate exhibits an inky/purple color followed by aromas of black olives, cassis and toast. Rich, full-bodied and expressive, it is built for the long haul rather than for current drinkability. A beautiful texture, full-bodied mouthfeel, terrific purity and a long finish suggest it will be significantly more complex and softer in 5-10 years, and last for 20-25+ years."

Name: Zaccagnini Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: This wine shows tropical fruit, cut grass and minerals on the nose. On the palate, I found buttery lemon curd followed by granny smith apple with a medium body and a fresh citrus finish. The vibrant acidity of this wine carries its plush body well.

Name: Apothic Red Winemaker's Blend
TastingNotes: Apothic Red reveals intense fruit aromas and flavors of rhubarb and black cherry that are complemented by hints of mocha, chocolate, brown spice and vanilla. The plush, velvety mouthfeel and smooth finish round out this intriguing, full-bodied red blend.

Name: 1865 Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Attractive red-berry aromas lead to a palate that has a fresh and juicy array of vibrant, plush and smoothly spiced plums. Drink now."

Name: Tosca Toscana Rosso
TastingNotes: Sangiovese, the work horse grape varietal of Tuscany offers dried cherries and earth on the nose, with big cherry flavors and spice on the palate. Clean, fresh and well balanced. A great example of Sangiovese.

Name: Rare Vineyards Malbec
TastingNotes: Fruit forward this delivers a soft, silky style over the palate. Plenty of blueberry, red plums and hints of licorice/spice make it a nice match for medium to hearty dishes

Name: Merry Edwards Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: The aroma is floral and mouthåÂwatering, layered with ripe melon, peach and subtle mineral highlights. In the mouth, it is rich and seamlessly well balanced, kicking in a hint of grapefruit, cirrus and pear on the lingering finish.
Review: "A perennially popular and well-made wine, this vintage is no exception, shining in concentrated, layers of rich, bold flavor. A sweetness of peach and vanilla complement a more exotic element of rose petal and black licorice."

Name: Irony North Coast Cabernet Sauvingon
TastingNotes: The Irony Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon openswithwonderfully fresh aromas of blackberry jam, plum and red licorice followed by delicate rose petal notes. This full-bodied wine, with firm tannins and acidity, delivers blackberry and ripe plum flavors coupled with hints of dried sage and sweet vanilla.

Name: Leese-Fitch Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Aromas of fresh roasted hazelnuts, espresso, cherryliquor, and black currants. In the mouth, this Cabernet blend exudes deep blackberry notes with toffee, dark cherry, Dutch cocoa, tea leaf, and fig compote. On the finish, there are rich tannins, caramel oak notes, toasted coconut, and black raspberry with mouthwatering acidity.

Name: Jordan Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Concentrated, lovely black fruits aromas of blackberry, blueberry and cassis. The mouthfeel is luscious and full with continued flavors of blackberry, cassis, black cherry with a suggestion of vanilla, coconut and cedar. The soft, round tannins and understated acidity of this wine complement the bright fruit characters to create a balanced Cabernet Sauvignon approachable now or worthy of cellaring for at least 10åÐ15 years.
Review: "Jordan always swims against the tide, eschewing overt oak and overripeness. The wine is more Bordeaux-like than almost any from California, with subtle hints of herbs and spice, a fresh, clean, mouthwatering profile, and reasonable alcohol. Stick it in the cellar for a decade or more."

Name: Charles Smith Kung Fu Girl Riesling
TastingNotes: Apricot, kumquat, nectarine and lime leaves. A great mid-palate intensity with a long, long minerally finish.
Review: åÒAlways delicious, as well as an insane value, the 2014 Riesling Kung Fu Girl offers lots of exotic citrus, lychee and minty notes in a medium-bodied, delicious, vibrant profile on the palate. Downright gulpable, yet with plenty of classic Riesling flair, buy this beauty by the case and drink it over the coming year or so.åÓ

Name: 14 Hands Winery Hot To Trot Red
TastingNotes: Generous aromas of ripe berries and dark stone fruits open this ruby-huedwine. Fleshy flavors of cherries and plum are met with soft and velvetytannins, finishing with a hint of mocha.

Name: Gnarly Head Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Fresh, vibrant and fruit forward with tropical fruit aromas and flavors of pineapple, citrus, pear and melon with a touch of vanilla on the finish.

Name: Cucao Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This Chilean wine is exceptionally stylish for itsprice and offers great texture and delicacy on the palate. Ruby red fruits and hints of dark chocolate are rounded out by smooth tannins on the finish."

Name: Caposaldo Moscato
TastingNotes: Bright golden yellow in color, this wine delivers an assertive bouquet with exotic fruit and spice aromas and a fresh, vivacious and highly polished palate.

Name: Gruet Blanc de Noir
TastingNotes: The rich and toasty character of our Blanc de Noirsis balanced and superb. Aged for two-year minimum, the palate is developed and shows rich complex flavors. The amazing berries aromas and the creamy texture play a leading role and create a great finesse. Winemaker's Note: A fine salmon color, aggressive mousse and a lovely fruity wine with plenty of immediate charm and toasty aromas. There is also an explosive juicy flavor of raspberry.

Name: 14 Hands Winery Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Concentrated aromas of dark stone fruits and toast burst from the glass. Classic Cabernet Sauvignon flavors of black cherries with subtle hints of baking spice dance across the palate, bolstered by fine, round tannins.

Name: Fog Bank Pinot Noir
Review: "This Pinot Noir has great complexity and good structure. Nice cherry, strawberry and cinnamon flavors ending with a velvety finish."

Name: Ghost Pines Merlot
TastingNotes: This Merlot blend is layered with flavors of dark berries, licorice and espresso alongside lots of richness, full-bodied structure, and desirable length. In addition to these flavors, hints of cigar paper, cocoa, caramel and nutmeg are wrapped around a remarkably smooth mid-palate full of velvety texture and depth. On the long finish, suggestions of toasty oak make it through the palate with mouth-filling black fruit aromas and hints of cola framed by plush tannins.

Name: Jam Jar Sweet Shiraz
TastingNotes: Jam Jar Sweet Shiraz is packed with fresh, juicy flavors of blueberries, blackberries and raspberries with dark chocolate undertones. Striking a perfect balance between sweetness and acidity, this refreshing and approachable wine.

Name: Baron Zett Mosel Riesling
Review: "This one is a real find!! Unbelievable value for the price. This wine shows a wonderful floral nose followed by ripe flavors of melon, white peach and a hint of citrus complimented by a touch of sweetness and balanced nicely by a crisp lively finish."

Name: Waterbrook Reserve Merlot
Review: "Ripe, pure, focused and beguiling for its balance,offering blueberry, raspberry and plum fruit at the core, layered with hints of red pepper, clove and peach fuzz as the finish extends extraordinarily well. Drink now through 2017."

Name: Black Slate Porrera Priorat
Review: "The 2015 Black Slate Porrera is a custom blend of 60% Garnacha, 35% CariÌ±ena and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon from younger and older vines on slate soils. It's a ripe and heady village red that is part of a collection of village wines from Priorat produced by different wineries in conjunction with US importer Eric Solomon. It fermented in stainless steel and concrete vats for 25 days and matured in 225- and 300-liter oak barrels for 12 months. The wine has a traditional profile, with ripe fruit and noticeable impact from the oak, following the house style."

Name: Columbia Crest H3 Les Chevaux Red
TastingNotes: Aromas of fresh blueberries, anise and earth lead to firm and supple tannins on the palate. This red wine blend presents incredible depth, with layered flavors of candied nuts, licorice and dark chocolate that lead to a mocha finish featuring ample, sweet tannins.

Name: Duckhorn Decoy Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: This classic Cabernet showcases elements of currant, cherry, plum and olive. Great body and a long finish!

Name: Cucake Red Velvet
TastingNotes: Cupcake Red Velvet has over the top aromas of chocolate, deep rich blackberries, red fruits that follow through the palate to a creamy mocha finish that is unmistakable in its intensity and length, with a hint of coconut. ItåÕs reminiscent of a blackberry chocolate cupcake with a mocha coulis.

Name: Wente Sandstone Merlot
TastingNotes: Exhibits aromas and flavors of black cherry, blackberry and plum with hints of black tea and toasted oak. A smooth mouthfeel and inviting tannis lead to a long, fruity finish.

Name: Raymond R Collection Field Blend
TastingNotes: Red fruits of raspberry and bing cherry come forward on the nose, followed by aromas of anise, exotic spices of cardamom, and plum pudding. Very soft and supple on the mouth, with ripe, juicy tannins. Strawberry notes are vivid on the palate, and are intermingled with hints of cedar and a subtle tobacco finish.

Name: Hussonet Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Plenty of sweet black fruits and some real richness on the front palate. An easy wine to drink now. With more complexity and energy this would rate higher."

Name: 14 Hands Winery Merlot
TastingNotes: 14 Hands Merlot offers classic Washington aromas ofblackberries, plums and black cherries. Expressive flavors of berries and cherries are joined by subtle nuances of mocha and spice.

Name: Duckhorn Decoy Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This wine has enticing citrus zest, orange blossom and guava aromas with hints of banana cream pie and spicy oak. The palate is soft and velvety offering vibrant citrus flavors intermingled with rich tropical fruit. Excellent acidity adds length and brightness to a satisfying finish

Name: Sweet Bliss Sweet Red Wine
TastingNotes: The aromas are a divine harmony of ripe red fruit and subtle toasted oak with deep cherry flavors and a velvety chocolate mouth feel.

Name: Roagna Dolcetto
TastingNotes: Intense ruby color with violet shades. Full, fresh and fruity nose with a clear aroma of red fruits, especially cherries. Dry taste, pleasantly round, with a good structure consistent with the olfactory sensations.

Name: Marques de Riscal Proximo Rioja
TastingNotes: Plump and juicy with slightly candied red cherry fruit to go along with a touch of licorice on the plush finish.All silky, soft and easy to quaff.  An impressive new wine from an impressive old winery.93% Tempranillo, 5% Graciano and 2% Manzuelo from Rioja.

Name: Michael David Petite Petit
TastingNotes: A brilliant blend of 85% Petite Sirah and 15% Petit Verdot, this opaque purple-colored wine exhibits gorgeous aromas of camphor, blueberries, blackberries, licorice, toast and subtle background smoke.

Name: Kendall Jackson Avant Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This refreshing Chardonnay erupts with captivating layers of fresh pineapple, bright green apple, crisp Meyer lemon, juicy pear and wildflowers. It shows refreshing acidity and sleek mineral notes which are balanced by a rounded mid-palate and a long, pure fruit finish.

Name: Baron Herzog Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: A perfect balance of acidity, followed by ripepear, apple and tropical fruit notes.

Name: Columbia Crest Red Blend
TastingNotes: This complex red exhibits layer flavors of blackberries and plums with a subtle spiciness and silky mouthfeel that leads to a long, elegant finish.

Name: Santa Silvana Chianti Classico
Review: "Fruit forward with notes of cherry, plum and tobacco. Medium bodied with a lush texture on the palate and refined but firm tannins. Finishing with cherry and spice."

Name: Ruffino Prosecco
TastingNotes: Bright straw yellow with fine bubbles. The bouquet is fragrant and intensely fruity. It shows clean notes of apples, pears and citrus, accompanied by slight hints of hawthorn, wisteria and elder. Crisp, clean and delicate with fine bubble caressing. Intense sensations of apples and peaches drive a pleasant aftertaste, that is reminiscent of fruity and floral aromas.

Name: Peirano Merlot
TastingNotes: This ripe and toasty red brims with aromas of blackcherries, sweet raspberries, vanilla, and cocoa, while supple tannins leave a pleasing and lingering finish.

Name: Chapelle Saint Victor Provence Rose
Review: "Our most sought after and requested rosÌ© year after year. Organic, too! Beautifully crafted and refreshingly crisp, bright and juicy. The palate is nicely dry with elegant richness and good concentration to the tangy pit fruit and citrus notes. The finish is long with underlying salinity and mineral notes."

Name: Cupcake Moscato
TastingNotes: Cupcake Moscato is vibrant and expressive with floral notes that dominate with hints of peach and flavors of tropical fruits and lychee. It is a soft and luscious wine with just a hint of effervescence to tickle the palate and balance the sweetness. With bright fruit flavors and finesse, itåÕs reminiscent of a pineapple right-side up cupcake.

Name: Cupcake Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Cupcake Pinot Noir has the aroma of cherries that carries through the palate with a touch of red currants and a hint of spice. ItåÕs reminiscent of a cherry cupcake with currant coulis.

Name: Duckhorn Decoy Merlot
TastingNotes: Lush and enticing with aromas that strike an appealing balance between vibrant cranberry and deeper, dark berry notes, with sophisticated hints of white pepper and forest floor. The palate is rich and beautifully structured, offering a lush core of dark, ripe fruit wrapped in smooth, firmly textured tannins.

Name: Gnarly Head Merlot
TastingNotes: Lush, velvety tannins and rich fruit, with aromas and flavors of black currant, black cherry, and blackberry with ripe plum, sweet herbs and a hint of spice.

Name: Beach House Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: A playful personality of lemon grass and gooseberries typical to Sauvignon Blanc. Giving way to a characteristic contribution by Semillon of honeysuckle, tangerine and lemon blossom.

Name: Brewer Clifton Santa Rita Hills Chardonnay
Review: "A bright bouquet of honeyed citrus, preserved lemon, apple and beeswax, framed by a touch of nutmeg. On the palate, the wine is medium-bodied, finishing with good length and grip."

Name: Banfi Centine Rosso
TastingNotes: Intense ruby red with youthful hints. On the nose this wine is intense, vinous and spicy in which the Tuscan character of the Sangiovese is perfectly married with the international character of the Cabernet and Merlot. Gentle in approach, soft, easy-to-drink.
Review: åÒThe balance to this wine is so delicious with darkberry, blackcurrant and lightly flowery aromas and flavors. Medium body, fine tannins and a flavorful finish. Tangy and bright. A beauty. Great value. Drink now.åÓ

Name: Chono Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Ruby red. Toasty aromas of ripe strawberries, blackberry and cedar. All framed by ripe tannins and subtle spice that works well with red meat dishes and heavy sauces. 12 months in American and French oak."

Name: Peirano Estate Vineyards 'The Other' White Wine
Review: "Tempting vanilla and nutmeg aromas and ripe pear and pineapple flavors animate this full-bodied, smooth and delicious wine made with 75% Chardonnay plus Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. The generous fruit and oak components are layered and creamy in texture."

column1: Medium-bodied offering juicy black cherry and blackberry with a hint of cedar and vanilla on the finish.

Name: Jules Taylor Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This wine is pale lime in color. This Sauvignon Blanc is showing aromas of fruit salad, passion fruits and fleshed nectarines with underlying jalapeno peppers & vine ripened tomato stalks. The palate is surrounded by juicy acidity and tropical flavors of passion fruit, lychees and restrained herbaceous notes.
Review: åÒA ripe, lush style of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc,this features ample nectarine and cassis fruit, tinged with just a bit of green leafiness. Ample weight on the mouth gives way to a long, mouthwatering finish.åÓ

Name: Red Rock Winemakers Blend
TastingNotes: Red Rock Winemaker's Blend exhibits concentrated aromas of dark berry jam and boysenberry, offering a plush mouthfeel with flavors of blackberry, light brown spice and vanilla.

Name: Warwick Valley Black Dirt Red
TastingNotes: This wine has been aged in stainless steel tanks for a period of eight to nine months, creating an exceptionally smooth, easy drinking wine. It is particularly fruit forward in style with notes of cherry, plum and fig.

Name: Tenuta di Salviano Turlo
Review: "This has cherries with pine needle and an earthy background. The palate here is more defined than its predecessors showing delicate fruit and a walnut-like finish."

Name: Monsanto Chianti Classico Riserva
Review: "Aromas of plums, cherries and hints of green olives. White truffles and deep earth, too. Full-bodied, so layered and beautiful with a fabulous texture and ripe tannins. It is so pure and minimalist in the end, showing the effect of traditional, hands-off winemaking. DonåÕt miss this. Decant before serving. One for the cellar. Drink or hold."

Name: Dr. Karl Mosel Riesling
Review: "The wine is beautifully structured, crisp and fresh, showing all the components of a classic Riesling. The nose of fresh apple is followed by flavors of gooseberry, white peach, melon and a wonderful minerality expressing the true personality of the region. The fresh acidity keeps the flavors bright and lively. This is a great food wine, pairing with everything from salads to all types of seafood."

Name: Palacios Camins del Priorat
Review: åÒåÉthe entry-level 2014 Camins del Priorat is the only wine that contains French grapes and is more or less 50% Garnacha, 15% CariÌ±ena, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Syrah and 5% Merlot. The grapes are sourced from vineyards in many different villages, fermented in stainless steel, oak and cement vats with indigenous yeasts and aged in barriques and oak vats for six months. This ultra young, jovial wine is a commercial success in the thirsty local restaurant market. It is really affordable too, considering that it bears the signature of Ìlvaro Palacios. It is bottled at different phases, released already because 2012 and 2013 were short vintages, and this lot is the first bottling with around four months in barrel; the last lot is kept in large oak and cement vats so all lots are more or less four months in barrels. Ripe, juicy and somewhat balsamic, it shows a Priorat character that is highly drinkable with fine tannins and pungent flavors. It is a wine to enjoy at the table. I missed the 2013 because this wine sells like hot cakes. Very good wine at a very good price.åÓ

Name: Yellow Tail Moscato
TastingNotes: Displays bright fruit flavors of freshly crushed grapes, peach and passion fruit with a hint of sherbet. This wine has a light fizz that tingles in your mouth and highlights lively tropical fruit flavors followed by a clean and crisp finish.

Name: Whispering Angel Rose
Review: "This is so lovely with the strawberry and cream character but also so much minerality in the form of slate and chalk. Medium-bodied, this glides rather effortlessly on the palate but still shows flavorful notes of peaches and spices. Drink now."

Name: Volpi Ballerina Barbera
Review: "This Barbera from Carlo Volpi exhibits great balance and is well rounded. Loads of cherries and dark fruit with a hint of oak and is silky and lush on the finish."

Name: Layer Cake Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Beautiful deep garnet color. Aromas of blackberry, cassis, violets, cedar, tobacco, and hints of minerals and graphite. Sweet, densely packed and creamy in the mouth, but with firm, underlying structure that gives lift to the dark berry, chocolate, and coffee flavors. This is a very lush, soft, complex wine that coats the palate and spreads out on the long, lingering finish.
Review: "Smoky, meaty aromas meet concentrated, fully developed blackberry and cassis flavors in this full-bodied nicely oaky wine. It has a lot of spice and swagger for the price, along with polished tannins, a hint of sweetness and a good mouth-filling texture."

Name: Tikal Natural
Review: "I also tasted the 2015 Natural, which was a good chance to compare the two vintages of this Malbec with 30% Syrah from Vista Flores. All their wines are fermented with indigenous yeasts and there are no corrections, so the wines show the character of the vintage faithfully. This is the wine that seems to have had less influence from the Ì©levage, showing the work they do in the vineyard. 2015 was a cooler vintage and it resulted in a fresher wine, with good acidity and a fruit-driven nose. It has intense flavors, nice fruit and a very good core of acidity. Very good."

Name: Gnarly Head Authentic Red
TastingNotes: Authentic Red is a rowdy blend based on Zinfandel. Merlot and Cabernet with a splash of Syrah. It has a juicy core of blackberry, plum, and black cherry with layers of spice and chocolate.

Name: Gnarly Head Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Fruit-driven, with bright flavors and zesty acidity with flavors of citrus blossom and honeysuckle, followed by Meyer lemon, honeydew and white nectarine.

Name: Fado Portugese Red
TastingNotes: Vivid red/purple with dark center. Ripe red berry fruits with plums and licorice. Smooth ripe tannins, spicy fruit and toasty oak finish.

Name: La Serena Toscana Rosso
Review: "Cherry and raspberry aromas. Rich and full bodied with cherry, cassis, vanilla and spice notes and a lingering finish. La Serena is a blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot and aged 12 months in French Barriques."

Name: Chateau Ducasse Bordeaux Blanc
TastingNotes: Offering both aromas and flavors of apples and citrus fruits. A clean, crisp and refreshing wine.

Name: Charles Smith Velvet Devil Merlot
TastingNotes: True to its name, velvetly. Complex and just-so-right flavors, pipe tobacco, bing cherry, dried rose petals with a blend of subtle herbs and spice. Real wine. Real Merlot.

Name: Block Nine Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Block Nine Pinot Noir is a beautifully long and rich in ripe cherry and berry flavors. The aromas exhibit generous bright fruit with a mix of strawberry, violets, plum, tea, and a hint of clove. Flavorful and silky in the mouth with good body, this wine is showing seductive wild cherries and a hint of sandalwood to complete its complex finish.

Name: Pacific Rim Columbia Valley Riesling
Review: "Right on the borderline between dry and sweet, this richly fruity Riesling is pakced with flavors of peach, apricot, pear, a hint of mint, and a streak of wet stone. There is a lot going on for such an inexpensive wine."

Name: Domenico Clerico Barbera Trevigne
TastingNotes: The wine of deep purple-red color with very intensearoma of red berries - raspberries. Intensive, sustained, long, soft, fresh and pleasant aftertaste.

Name: 446 Monterey Chardonnay
TastingNotes: 446 Chardonnay exhibits appealing aromas of golden delicious apples, apricots, and pineapple. Medium bodied with a creamy mid palate, this delightful wine offers flavors of peach, coconut and hints of toasty vanilla spice.

Name: 667 Monterey Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: 667 Pinot Noir exhibits appealing aromas of red cherry, earth and light vanilla notes. Plush tannins and balanced acidity support core flavors of ripe Bing cherry, bittersweet cocoa powder and delicate hints of sage.

Name: Hess Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: The Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon is a full-bodied winewith rich flavors of blackberry and currant paste. Aging in American oak barrels for 16.5 months (25% new) brings a toasty nose of vanilla and nutmeg. The jammy entry of dark fruit carries through a well-balanced mid into fine-grained tannins in the finish.

Name: "This blend of 85 per cent cabernet sauvignon with touches of petite sirah, malbec, petit verdot and merlot, has a ripe-plum and blackberry core that delivers sweetly attractive and fresh into the finish. Drink or hold."
Conundrum Red Blend
TastingNotes: Aromas are rich, velvety and wonderfully appealing floral notes with tones of lavender, dried berries, baking chocolate and bacon bits. Silky round entry with acid to balance the high fruit concentration. The palate is fruit driven both before and after the high tannin middle core. The finish is long, not drying of tannin and beckons a second sip. Enjoy this wine slightly to well-chilled.

Name: Cercius Cotes du Rhone
Review: "The 2016 Cotes du Rhone is a full-bodied, lush example that shows just how sexy Grenache can be, even on a budget. The black cherry fruit comes in waves, showing just a bit of warmth on the finish. It should be ready to drink on release (this review is based on a tank sample) and be consumed over the next couple of years."

Name: Trentadue Old Patch Red
TastingNotes:
The 2016 OPR Old Patch Red is predominately Zinfandel, blended with Petite Sirah, Carignane, and Syrah, resulting in a very fruity yet complex and full-bodied Rhone-style wine. The wine is dark red in color with intense black cherry aromas, blueberries, and cherry cola as an immediate impression.

With aeration, nuances of ripe plums, vanilla, and cocoa are showing with a slight dose of oak and toast. On the mouth the wine is fresh and juicy, with youthful brightness, finishing long and fruity.

Name: Cupcake Prosecco
TastingNotes:
Aromas of white peach, grapefruit and honeydewmelon lead to flavors of creamy ripe lemon, refined citrus and a toasted brioche finish.

Cupcake crafts this wine using only the best Glera grapes åÐ the official grape of Prosecco åÐ from their vineyards in Italy. The process centers on the charmat method, in which the wine undergoes a secondary fermentation in stainless steel tanks to produce its characteristic clean finish.

Name: Hand Craft Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Robust aromas of cherry, blackberry, pepper and tobacco greet your nose. The layers of flavor that follow are nothingshort of fantastic with hints of black cherry, clove, spice, currants and dark chocolate.This full bodied wine is rich and robust with round tannins that lead to a long andgenerous finish.

Name: Hand Craft Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Pour a glass and enjoy the lovely Ââoral and honey aromatics with soft hints of lemon zest, green apple and toasty oak. Then savor a sip as you taste bright citrus, peach, honey, pear and creamy marshmallow Ââavors. This medium bodied wine is balanced with good acidityåÑmaking it refreshing by itself or perfect with food. The rich and juicy Ânish provides the perfect end to this delightful wine.

Name: Hand Craft Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Gorgeous cherry, vanilla and strawberry aromas are followed by ripe black cherry, sweet spice, vanilla and chocolate flavors. This medium bodied wine is elegant, supple, smooth and balanced--delicious by itself or perfect with food. The finish is soft and lingering with a perfect integration of structure, fruit and spice.

Name: Hand Craft Petite Sirah
TastingNotes: Jammy fruit from beginning to endåÑstarting with aromas of blueberry pie, nutmeg and pepper. In the mouth, Ââavors expand to include boysenberry, plum, blueberry and spice. This full bodied wine has a bold tannin structure and balanced acidity that lead to a long Ânish.

Name: Domaine des Billards Saint Amour
Review: "The 2017 Billards is a classic in the making, offering up a beautifully pure and still quite primary bouquet of red and black cherries, game bird, woodsmoke, a hint of raw cocoa, a complex base of soil tones and a discreet floral top-note redolent of a peonies. On the palate the wine is deep, pure and full-bodied with a fine core of eventually sappy fruit, an excellent structural chassis, moderate, seamless tannins and great focus and grip on the very, very long and nascently complex finish."

Name: The Pinot Project Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Cool garnet in color with aromas of pomegranate and fresh roses, The Pinot Project is balanced on the palate with notes of black cherry and five-spice and a smooth, lingering finish.
Review: "Aromas and flavors of ripe plum and sweet cherry make this full-bodied wine taste generous and inviting. While only 20% of the blend is aged in barrels, an impression of sweet oak spices rounds the edges and warms the palate."

Name: Reguengos Alentejo Red
TastingNotes: A wine which is crystalline in appearance, garnet-colored, an aroma of red fruits and fermentation on skins, smooth and full-bodied with smooth tannins lending it a prolonged aftertaste, denoting its constituent grape varieties.

Name: Wente Riva Ranch Chardonnay
TastingNotes: A crowd-pleasing Chardonnay from Wente, working in the Monterey area, the result all caramel, vanilla and lemon-lime with a sweet tropical chaser on the finish. The oak is subtle. This wine will pair deliciously with a range of food, particularly chicken and seafood.
Review: "There's a classic California Chardonnay backbone to this bottling, with aromas of toasted wood, crÌ¬me brÌÈlÌ©e, poached pear and apple custard, yet there are also more delicate hints of chalk and orange blossom as well. The palate combines ripe Pink Lady apples and vanilla spice and caramel richness."

Name: Dreaming Tree Crush Red
TastingNotes: A blend of the North CoaståÕs  nest varieties, this wine pulls you in with a  floral berry noteand then jumps up with a raspberry jam.

Name: Black Stallion Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "A soft and silky red with lots of dark-berry and toasted-coffee undertones, yet not overdone. Full body, round and silky tannins and a flavorful finish. Mainly cabernet sauvignon with some petit verdot, merlot and other red grapes. Drink now."

Name: Bonterra Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Intense aromas of grapefruit, kiwi and freshly cut grass mix with concentrated tropical aromas and a bright minerality. A blend of fruit raised in the prime growing regions of Mendocino and Lake counties, this wine is the product of local organic viticulture in full flower.

Name: Waterbrook Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Inviting blueberry aromas couple with cedar and slate notes on the nose. The rich, developed palate presents mulberry and currant with well integrated tannins.

Name: Peirano Old Vines Zinfandel
TastingNotes: The color of this wine is truly Immortal. Its rich darkcolor goes on and on and on. The deceptively subtle aromas of this wine combine red current, raspberries, red cherries, with earthy cedar marrying together to put your olfactory senses into a new dimension. In the mouth, the palate is wrapped in a mysterious, velvety layered mix of raspberry cordial, sweet mouth filling red fruit, blackberry and red current, leading to a lengthy rich mouth filling almost breathless finish.

Name: La Rioja Alta Vina Ardanza
Review: "Very fresh and vivid 2009 with berries, dark spiceand hints of walnuts. Full-bodied, reserved and so held back and muscular, but you donåÕt feel the tannins and the strength. A great wine. Give it two or three years. Try in 2020."

Name: Tololo Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: A straight forward example of Chilean Sauvignon Blanc, meaning there's citrus and mineral on the nose, juicy acidity and lime, grapefruit and tangerine flavors. It's clean and solid, with slight pithiness.

Name: Apothic White Winemaker's Blend
TastingNotes: Apothic White is a delicate blend of smooth chardonnay, aromatic riesling and luscious moscato, which create layers of tropical fruit complemented by hints of honey and vanilla.

Name: Berroia Txacoli Berroja
TastingNotes: Displays a lovely perfume of mineral, sea salt, lime, and spring flowers. Crisp, vibrant, and focused, it has excellent length and a refreshing, neat finish.

Name: Bon Ami Bordeaux
TastingNotes: Intensive red color. The nose has incredibly ripe aromas and dominant scents of blackcurrant.The impression in the mouth is extremely fine with soft tannins and notes of little, red berries. The finish is fruity and long.

Name: Blason du Rhone Cotes du Rhone
TastingNotes: A fantastic wine showing dark, brooding aromas of currant and smoke. Medium bodied, yet densely packed full of black cherry, smoke, licorice and herbs. The long, dense, fruit filled finish is delicious.

Name: 14 Hands Winery Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Bright apple and floral aromas are complemented by light notes of vanilla and sweet butterscotch. Juicy pear and apple flavors give way to subtle touches of toast and spice and ends with a soft finish.

Name: Edna Valley Winery Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: The wine is well balanced with citrus and tropical fruit flavors, showing undertones of wet stone and fresh cut grass. Lively acidity makes the wine crisp and ands length and minerality to the finish.

Name: Ghost Pines Red Blend
TastingNotes: This unusual blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Zinfandel, Merlot and Syrah showcases rich, lush fruit flavors of black cherry, blackberry boysenberry and blueberry. The mid- palate is full-bodied giving way to a long, lingering silky smooth finish.

Name: Duckhorn Decoy Zinfandel
TastingNotes: The aromas are ripe and appealing, offering layers of strawberry jam, raspberry and sweet vanilla, as well as hints of chocolate-covered cherries and white pepper. On the palate, the entry is full and balanced with lovely cranberry notes supported by the subtle influence of fine oak.

Name: Juan Gil Moscatel
TastingNotes: Complex aromatics with abundant ripe melon, peach, white pepper and floral notes. The palate delivers loads of juicy, refreshing fruit and a tangy, spicy finish. This is really a stunner at this price.

Name: Barefoot Red Moscato
TastingNotes: Barefoot Red Moscato is the Moscato enthusiast's red wine alternative! Red Moscato is refreshingly sweet and juicy, just like Moscato, but with distinct red fruit flavors. Simply put, Barefoot Red Moscato is a fruity, floral wine that happens to be red. It's best served chilled and can be a perfect complement to many foods, or just sipped as it is.

Name: Josh Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Rich, aromatic dark fruits and baking spices delight the nose, yielding fresh plum and blackberry fruit, violet, dried fig, vanilla bean and Chinese Five-Spice. The wine is juicy with the plum and blackberry flavors prominent, layered with smoky and sappy maple wood, roasted almonds and hazelnuts, finishing long with fine, firm tannins.

Name: Po de Poeira Douro Red
Review: "The 2009 Po de Poeira is a Douro blend of old vines (50%) with younger vines of Sousao, Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional, aged for 12 months in used oak. This is the best åÒsecondåÓ wine made at the winery and one of the best second wines IåÕve seen in Douro. It is a year in which it compares well to the flagship åÒfirståÓ wine. This is just one heck of a mouthful this year and it comes in at a terrific price point, too. Full bodied, mouth coating and earthy, speaking of the soil, pure and clean, this is a refined and complex wine with moderate tannins, a complex flavor medley and approachable demeanor. It is not an obvious wine and it does not always show a lot of concentration, but it always shows complex flavors and significant grip on the finish. I finally åÐ with extended aeration åÐ saw the fruit blossom, too. This is just lovely. There were a mere 250 cases imported of 3,000 produced. Grab it if you see it. Drink now-2019."

Name: Tosca Sparkling Rose
TastingNotes: Bright pink color with hints of raspberry and citrus. Good acidity and wonderful balance, The perfect aperitif or with any lighter food dishes.

Name: Tosca Moscato
TastingNotes: This frizzante style Moscato is refreshingly light and fresh with hints of peach and strawberry.

Name: Perimeter Red Blend
TastingNotes: Aromas of raspberry, cinnamon bark, black cherries and delicate gardenia greet your senses. Taste flavors of raspberry, cherry and vanilla.

Name: Perimeter Merlot
Review: "Sweet red fruits on the nose with a palate of raspberry, cherry cola and a hint of vanilla. Lush and round, there is some spice and a lovely strawberry vanilla finish."

Name: Skinny Girl White Wine
TastingNotes: The White Blend offers a balance between fruity andfloral, showcasing a bouquet of rose petal and freesia with vibrant stone and tropical fruit aromas. The off-dry style complements the subtle flavors of peach pie and guava, while richer notes of honey and candied orange peel round out the palate. Pleasing apricot and citrus flavors linger and the wine finishes with a pleasing, refreshing acidity.

Name: Faiveley Bourgogne Rouge
TastingNotes: Delivers classic Pinot Noir aromas and flavors.A deft touch of wood sets off ripe and expressive aromas of red berry fruit and violet hints that precede rich, round and vibrant flavors.A seriously good value!

Name: Dreaming Tree Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: The rhythm of this Cabernet Sauvignon highlights classic aromas of blackberry, cherry and herbal notes wrapped by toasted vanilla. ItåÕs an easy-drinking wine with a lot of character.

Name: Lopez de Heredia Vina Cubillo
TastingNotes: Clear, bright ruby color. Fresh with a slight aroma of licorice with consistent texture and persistent aroma, comparable to any Rioja Gran Reserva! This Crianza has all the seriousness of an older Reserva.
Review: "The first of the reds here is the 2008 ViÌ±a Cubillo Tinto Crianza from a cooler vintage that produced some austere and serious wines--a year with higher acidity and lively fruit. It feels effervescent and it makes you salivate. This is usually a blend of 70% Tempranillo, 20% Garnacha, 5% Graciano and 5% Mazuelo from 50-year-old vines that ferments in ancient oak vats, and ages in barrel for three years. This cuvÌ©e has increased its quality tremendously since the 1990s. These cooler years provide citric freshness, and a very fine texture and vibrant acidity. This is so easy to drink that it can be dangerous.This was the Rioja clarete fino--the everyday red. It's both elegant and powerful. Very good value, too."

Name: Domaine Gueneau Sancerre Blanc
Review: åÒFresh grapefruit aromas are weaved into some ripe pit fruit and pineapple notes.  The pallet is classic Loire Valley Sauvignon Blanc with just a bit more body and richness.  The finish is elegant, persistent and tangy and screams out for warm goat cheese on toast or fresh salads.åÓ

Name: Wente Charles Wentmore Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon offers rich and concentrated dark fruit flavors of cassis, blackberry, dark cherry and currant. Vanilla and black licorice follow the burst of fruit flavors giving way to a long, lingering finish with ample tannins and a hint of spice."

Name: Twisted Chardonnay
TastingNotes: A medium-bodied wine with aromas of refreshing citrus, green apple and pear. Crisp lemon flavors with honey and a hint of vanilla.

Name: Twisted Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: A  Light åÐbodied refreshing wine with delicate floral aromas of white peach, lime and nectarine.

Name: Twisted Moscato
TastingNotes: A swirl of citrus blossom, honeysuckle and melon flavors with a hint of vanilla crisp acidity for a reviving finish.

Name: Twisted Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Medium-bodied with aromas of black cherry, red currant and a hint of spice. Concentrated ripe fruit of dark berry and black pepper on the palate.

Name: Pine Ridge Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: A sweet and spicy nose of dark, ripe plum, blackberry pie and red licorice balanced with leather and star anise bursts from the glass in this deep garnet wine. The palate echoes the richness of the bouquet and surges with fresh cassis, black cherry and brambly black fruit flavors, supported by a framework of lush tannins, roasted espresso and dark cocoa.
Review: "Blackcurrant and walnut aromas with hints of driedherbs. Medium to full body, round and juicy tannins and a flavorful finish. A little old school but I like it. Drink in 2020."

Name: Feudi di San Gregorio Fiano Avellino
Rengo Valpolicella Classico
Review: åÒThis classic Valpolicella from Michele Castellani is rich and well balanced. It is medium bodied with cherry, plum and cocoa flavors. This can be drunk now or over the next couple years.åÓ

Name: Dreaming Tree Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The fruit jumps out of the glass and reminds you ofroasted pear or baked apple pie. Big fruit and brown spices that are backed by a distinct Central Coast citrus note.

Name: Corte Massima Prosecco Extra Dry
TastingNotes: This fresh and fruity Prosecco is made with grapes grown on the steep hills of Central Veneto and it shows a crisp and aromatic character. Well balanced and lively.

Name: Irony Chardonnay
Review: "The Irony Napa Chardonnay is distinct and elegant,offering beautiful aromas of melon, white peach and lemon with hints of vanilla.  The palate is rich and full with flavors of yellow apple and pear followed by a lingering finish."

Name: Ravenswood Vintners Blend Petite Sirah
TastingNotes: Packed with powerfully concentrated black fruit, cherry, plum and chocolate flavors that all pulltogether nicely into a long, lingering finish.

Name: Barefoot Pink Moscato
TastingNotes: Aromas of Mandarin orange and sweet jasmine crash into each other to create a deliciously sweet sea of pink goodness. Subtle flavors of cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate wash ashore in the flavorful experience.

Name: Chateau Bord Cotes du Rhone Laudun
