Review: "The 2016 Cotes du Rhone Villages Laudun Chateau deBord hints at crushed stone, pencil shavings and dark chocolate on the nose. It's full-bodied and super ripe on the palate, where at times it seems almost fudge-like, yet it also delivers bright raspberry fruit and a long, zesty finish."

Name: Fat Barrel Cabernet Shiraz
Review: "Red plums, red licorice, dried herbs and cedar. Medium to full body, fine tannins and a fruity finish. A blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon and 35% Shiraz."

Name: Red Diamond Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Flavors of red berries and black cherries. A touch of spearmint complements the flavors and ends with a crisp and lingering finish.

Name: Bodegas Ateca Honoro Vera
TastingNotes: This wine exhibits great aromatic complexity, richness with mineral and blueberry notes leading to a savory and spicy wine nicely balanced and very easy to drink.
Review: "This shows ripe red and black fruit such as cherries, plums and currants with violet and earth undertones. Medium body, soft and light tannins and a medium, fresh and earthy finish. From 100% garnacha. Drink now."

Name: Bluker Spatlese Riesling
Review: "The best word to describe this wine is elegant. Itopens with aromas of tropical fruit that introduces you to a pallet filled with flavors of pineapple, melon, citrus and just a hint of green apple. Excellent balance of sweetness and acidity make this a very versatile wine. It can be served as an aperitif or enjoyed with many styles of food. ItåÕs rare to find a Riesling of this quality at such an affordable price."

Name: Black Stallion Napa Valley Chardonnay
Review: "A clean and fresh white with jasmine, pear drops and cooked apples. Medium body, some crunchy acidity and a fine finish. Drink now."

Name: Lopez de Heredia Tondonia Reserva
Review: "Bright ruby-red. Ripe cherry, vanilla and floral pastilles on the smoky, oak-spiced nose. Sweet and supple on the palate, offering pliant red fruit and spicecake flavors with suave mocha and vanilla bean nuances. Quite lively and fresh for a wine from a hot vintage, and showing no excess fat. Finishes sweet, toasty and very long, with smooth tannins making a late appearance."

Name: Perrin Luberon Blanc
TastingNotes: Ok, maybe you havenåÕt had a Luberon white wine in awhileåÉor maybe ever, but this is a must try if youåÕre looking to drop less than ten bucks and be extremely satisfied.Great balanced of forward fruit and tangy acidity.A nicely full texture and soft finish bring it home.

Name: Perrin Ventoux Rouge
TastingNotes: A SUPERB VALUE!Blend of Grenache and Syrah that has elegant, fresh and ripe fruit with a nice lift to the core of red berries and spice.Silky and very easy going, itåÕs a no brainer.

Name: Smoking Loon Steel Bird Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Steelbird is a fruit-forward, unoaked Chardonnay exuding citrus aromas with vibrant flavors of green apple and lemon curd with a crisp, refreshing finish.

Name: Riffault Sancerre Chailloux
Review: "Delicious. Fulfills the promise of this heralded vintage better than other 2015 Sancerre weåÕve tasted. Rich and ripe, but remains tense, focused and ultra precise with inviting citrus and mineral flavors. A fantastic effort."

Name: Cross Springs Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This Cabernet is full-bodied, textured and concentrated brimming with black cherry, wild berry, black licorice, sage and currant flavors. The finish is supple and smooth with just enough spice and tannins."

Name: Izadi Rioja Reserva
Review: "A generous plum, chocolate and earthy nose with subtle oak. Dry tannins are well integrated. An impressive modern wine. Better in 2018."

Name: Josh Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Balanced with aromas of tropical fruits and citrus married with subtle oak notes. The palate is bright and fresh, with lingering flavors of juicy yellow peaches, lemon oil and crÌ¬me brulee. The wine shows great, soft texture and finishes long.

Name: Dr Frank Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The nose there is an intense blend of pear and apple notes. The fruit and acidity is perfectly balanced with a mere hint of oak and a crisp citrus finish.

Name: The Crusher Red Blend
TastingNotes: Opens with a fruity bouquet of Bing Cherry, wild strawberry, and black plum coupled with toasty notes of cedar and cinnamon bark. On the palate a flavorful array of boysenberries, raspberries and tart cherries take center stage complemented by hints of caramel, milk chocolate and espresso on the finish. This medium-bodied wine is wonderfully balanced with bright well-integrated acidity.

Name: Jean-Marc Lafage Bastide Miraflors
Review: "Boasts rockstar notes of ripe blackberry fruits, spice, dried garrigue, and hints of chocolate. Possessing a full-bodied, layered mouthfeel, sweet tannins, and sensational purity, itåÕs another one of those values that almost seems too good to be true. Drink it any time over the coming 3-4 years."

Name: Wachau Gruner Veltliner
TastingNotes: Bright yellow-green in colour, this wine offers distinctive aromas of green apple, white pepper, hints of mango, balanced with delicate herbal notes. This Federspiel is a traditional example of GrÌ_ner Veltliner with its medium-body crisp acidity, juicy fruits and white spice on the finish.

Name: Chateau Saint Roch Kerbuccio
Review: "Lovely kirsch nose with bags of ripe and authentic, Maury fruit. The palate is round, fleshy and warm with a delicious richness of oak, vanilla flavor and intense and complex finish. Lovely wine that's beautifully balanced with great typicity. Full-bodied and very polished."

Name: Seven Sinners Old Vines Petite Sirah
TastingNotes: Velvety textures upfront followed by deep rich flavors of blackberry jam, blueberry and spice, resulting in a long deep concentrated finish. Opulent and concentrated, while maintaining a food friendly balance, this wine is showing beautifully right now and will continue to age gracefully for the next 7 - 10 years.
Review: åÒThis Petite Sirah offers nice concentration of dark fruits. Blackberry, blueberry and wild berry are all present blending with just the right amount of spice giving way to a long and velvety finish.åÓ

Name: Black Kite Kite's Rest Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Flush with floral, ripe cherry, currant and brown spice notes nuanced by hints of sage and sweet tea. Beautifully balanced and nuanced, the Bing cherry and sweet oak notes carry through the long, broad finish.
Review: "Great fruit concentration and grace make this winea winner. It feels medium-bodied despite its high degree of ripeness, showing that balance is attainable with significant power. It has ripe, plummy aromas, fresh red cherry and cranberry flavors, supportive tannins and excellent acidity. "

Name: Sottimano Pairolero Barbera
TastingNotes: Dark, inky red, with loads of red fruits, minerals and a touch of graphite on the nose with a long, rich taste in which the fruity components and the spicy notes are well balanced by a good acidity.

Name: Gruet Blanc de Blanc
TastingNotes: Gruet Blanc de Blancs is a Brut styled sparkler, medium lemon in color with a fantastic bead in the glass that remains incredibly lively throughout the palate. Aromas of intense notes of brioche, followed by green apples, lemon zest, honeysuckle, and tropical fruit. Soft on the front of the palate with nice lingering acidity on the finish. Flavors of fresh green apple and pineapple with great structure from top to bottom.

Name: Duckhorn Decoy Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: This enticing wine displays lovely aromas of ripe strawberry and raspberry, as well as subtle notes of sandalwood and spice. On the palate, it is elegantly structured with abundant red fruit, excellent mid-palate weight and a lingering finish with a hint of fresh earth.

Name: 1 Red Blend Black
TastingNotes: 1 Red Blend is a medium-bodied wine with a balancedacidity and supple tannins. On the nose, rich aromas of blackberry and black cherry mingle with hints of spice. These dark fruit flavors carry through beautifully to the palate ending with a touch of pepper. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Zinfandel.

Name: 242 Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: 242 Sauvignon Blanc exhibits vibrant aromas of white peach, green melon and lemongrass. Medium bodied with a round mid palate and bright acidity, this refreshing wine offers flavors of guava, passion fruit and a hint of lemon zest.
Review: "There's nice restraint on the nose of this judiciously priced bottling by the Delicato group, with lemon-lime citrus and slightly green apple flesh on the nose. The wine is strongly textural once sipped, with sour apple, lime peel and riper stone fruit in the background, finishing grippy and clean."

Name: Janasse Terre d'Argile Cotes du Rhone
Review: "One of the finest Cotes du RhoneåÕs of the vintage with impressive levels of fruit and texture. Elegant and medium-bodied with good acidity, fine tannin and perfumed notes of spice, dried earth, sweet strawberry and flowers. Drink well for the next five years."

Name: Anjos Vinho Verde
Review: åÒLight-bodied and tangibly tart Vinho Verde with youthful notes of green apple, lemon and grapefruit. Fresh acidity with herbal notes and wild flowers on the spritzy finish.åÓ

Name: La Crema Pinot Gris
TastingNotes: Bright and balanced, this wine opens with aromas offresh white peach, Meyer lemon and subtle åÂoral hints. The lush palate is layered with åÂflavors of ripe pear, baking spice and exotic tropical notes. Mineral undertones are evident in the lengthy finish.

Name: Lauverjat Perle Blanche Sancerre
TastingNotes: Outstanding! Made from parcels of old vines, ranging older than 50 years. Remains rich, yet delicate and racy at the same time. Loaded with vibrant citrus, pear and floral notes. Limited Release; DonåÕt MISS IT!

Name: Dog Point Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "The crisp lime and grapefruit notes are lively andjuicy up front, set on a fleshy body. Becomes more complex on the finish, with honeysuckle details and a whiff of green tea."

Name: Alfredo Roca Chardonnay
Review: "A long, cool growing season in Argentina produced a full-flavored Chardonnay that combines tropical aromas and crisp green apple flavors with a well-balanced richness. With no evidence of oak aging, this outstanding value ends with a fresh and crisp finish."

Name: Cave L'Aurance Cremant de Bourgogne Brut Rose
TastingNotes: Remarkable value. We had high hopes for this rose after the consistent quality weåÕve seen from the Brut version from this winery for yearsåÉ.but wow! This totally over-delivers. Perfectly balanced with strawberry, roses and mineral notes that are nicely tense, yet with graceful lift and elegant touch. YouåÕll be glad you found this one!

Name: La Fleur de Lys Macon Villages Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Has an elegant richness to the ripe apple, honeyed pear and citrus notes. The finish is nicely persistant while presenting a soft landing for the creamy texture. Nicely done.

Name: Stoller Dundee Hills Pinot Noir
Review: "Aromas of berry tea and brown spices lead to a richly fruited palate that has ripe tannin that follow languid lines to the finish. Drink now. Screw cap."

Name: Julia James Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: This Pinot is fruit forward and smooth with fresh, red berry aromas and a velvety texture. The wine is versatile, yet stylish, making it the perfect afternoon or after-work sipper and exceptional companion to dinner with friends.

Name: Auspicion Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: A classic Cabernet in structure and flavor, Auspicion Cabernet Sauvignon is loaded with juicy black fruit and ripe berries, balanced by mild tannins.  The finish is accented by touches of chocolate, toffee, and vanilla.

Name: Auspicion Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Great fruit character, finesse, and body in the palate. Flavors of ripe pineapple, golden apple, and pear are balanced by citrus notes and a smooth, creamy finish.  A crisp, light-bodied wine meant to be enjoyed on its own or with lighter fare.

Name: Fess Parker Big Easy
Review: "The 2016 The Big Easy is fabulous. Rich, powerfuland flamboyant to its core the Big Easy hits thepalate with tremendous fruit intensity. Super-ripered cherry, raspberry jam, white chocolate,vanillin and new American oak shape this opulentSyrah/Petite Sirah/ Grenache blend. The 2016 issimply outrageously delicious."

Name: Bogle Essential Red
TastingNotes: Rich, enticing layers of complexity, starting with that first irresistible sip. Ripe  fruit, intense with flavors of boysenberries and sweet cherries. Luscious vanilla, caressing the palate from barrel aging in American and French oak. Juicy and silky throughout, with a finish that lingers of black licorice and spicy pipe tobacco.
Review: "A sleek texture and delicious, focused fruit flavors like cranberry and black cherry make this full-bodied wine mouthfilling and compelling. It offers density and richness, too, which helps extend the lightly sweet finish."

Name: Yellow Tail Pink Moscato
TastingNotes: Bursting with fresh fruit like strawberry and watermelon and just a hint of floral flavors. Full of natural sweetness.

Name: Jean Noel Haton Brut Rose
Review: "Mouthwatering and spicy, with a fine bead supporting the subtle flavors of macerated strawberry and white cherry fruit, gingerbread, rose petal and pink grapefruit zest. Not a powerhouse but harmonious throughout. Drink now through 2019."

Name: Stonestreet Estate Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Blackberry and mocha aromas. The palate boasts cherry, blackberry, and a hint of tobacco. Full and smooth with dusty tannins.
Review: "The 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Estate is a gorgeous entry-level wine in this range from Stonestreet. A whole range of floral and savory notes give the Estate aromatic nuance to play off a core of vibrant red fruit. Medium in body and impeccably polished, the 2016 is flat-out delicious, even in the early going."

Name: Perimeter Riesling
TastingNotes: Offering an apricot & tangerine nose, this palate cleanser is layered with bright pear fruit flavors on the palate punctuated with a crisp acidity for a refreshing, lingering finish!  Enjoy chilled.

Name: Nieto Benjamin Malbec
Review: "This medium-bodied Malbec hails from the Lujan de Cuyo sub-region of Mendoza where the warm days and cool nights produces a balanced and elegant wine. Aromas of ripe red fruit, plum and cola are met with soft tannins and a long finish. An excellent paring with burgers, steak and chicken off the grill."

Name: Daou Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Soft ripe blackberries and cooked black current dominate the initial aroma both on the mouth and nose. The seamless texture of vanilla bean and holiday spices combined with rich black fruit and cedar are evidence of true balance. There are firm tannins that are softened by bright acidity. Finally, there are an explosion of ripe raspberries, and blueberries with a hint of tobacco and pepper on the finish.
Review: "(60% new French oak) Deep bright-rimmed ruby.Intense cherry and red berry scents, along with hints of cracked pepper, pipe tobacco and vanilla. Juicy and focused on the palate, offering concentrated red currant, bitter cherry and spicecake flavors that deepen slowly and turn sweeter on the back half. Fine-grained tannins build on a long, spice-laced finish that leaves behind a suggestion of cherry compote. In the context of top-notch California Cabernets, this wine delivers remarkable value."

Name: Cross Springs Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Clean and straw-like in color with aromas of tropical melon, green apple and creamy vanilla. Nice flavors of pear, butter scotch and citrus with a crisp, full rich texture and a long smooth finish.
Review: "Ripe, crisp and flavorful with layers of apple, pear, peach, and citrus notes that end with a dash of tropical fruit. Balanced and focused with a complex lingering finish."

Name: Rive Droite Rive Gauche Cotes du Rhone
Review: "Beautifully perfumed and inviting aromas lead to arich wine full of juicy black fruit flavors and spicy black pepper notes. The palate is full, silky and round with elegant structure to provide effortless enjoyment. Great for a wide variety of meals, steaks, burgers, pizzas, dried meats."

Name: Corte Orsini Toscana Rosso
Review: åÒThe aroma of dark fruit and floral scents starts the journey on this Tuscan gem. Blackberry, plum and mocha characteristics with friendly, soft tannins and a little pepper and cherry on the finish. Well structured.åÓ

Name: Foxglove Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Round in texture with deep fruit and herb finish.

Name: Morgan Highland Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This focused, elegant ChardonnayåÕs aromas feature pear, clove, green apple, and caramel. On the palate, aromas are complemented by a light touch of meyer lemon, graham cracker, and nutmeg. Incredibly food-friendly, the 2017 Highland Chardonnay is a perfect match for cream-sauced pastas, roast pork, and seafood.
Review: "Offers mouthfilling richness, withgenerous flavors of butterscotch,baked apple and glazed pear,accented by a twist of citrus zest.Spicy and toasty notes fill the finish.Drink now through 2023."

Name: High Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Delicious, fruit-soaked flavors and a smooth texture make this full-bodied wine almost irresistible. It is drenched in ripe blackberry, blueberry and cocoa flavors, and feels shaped by new oak without becoming overtly oaky in flavor. Best through 2023."

Name: High Valley Zinfandel
Review: "Concentrated and focused with rich, briary fruit flavors of cherry, plum, wild berry and boysenberry. Vibrant spice merges through the big tannins on a long complex, earthy finish."

Name: 19 Crimes Red Blend
TastingNotes: Polished, expressive and distinctive, with a green olive note weaving through the ripe blueberry and spice flavors, lingering easily on the deftly balanced and medium-weight finish.  Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Grenache, and Cabernet Sauvignon.

Name: Triton Tridente Tempranillo
Review: "Massive black fruit, and correspondingly large andseriously chewy, dry tannins. This wine needs some substantial food to cope with the latter. Love the finish. Drink now."

Name: Mondavi Private Selection Heritage Red Blend
TastingNotes: The wine is fresh and light with a smooth texture. It features a juicy blend of ripe strawberry and red raspberry fruit with a hint of chocolate.

Name: Comoloco Monastrell Jumilla
TastingNotes: Ripe cherry, plum and cracked pepper on the fragrant nose. Bursting with silky, spicy and supple fruit and seamless in texture. Good closing lift and freshness. Lots of appealing fruit here.

Name: Casa Castillo El Molar
Review: "High-pitched red fruit note on the 2017 El Molar, and it's a wine with a lot of light, something quite remarkable for a warm and Mediterranean year like 2017. Garnacha that feels like a wine from a cool year, with plenty bright red fruit. Completely harmonious and relaxed. This seems like the finest vintage for this wine."

Name: Rare Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Makes for a tasty aperitif with its refreshing, crisp grapefruit flavors and clean finish. Nice intensity and quite lively with persistent citrus notes.

Name: Apothic Dark Winemaker's Blend
TastingNotes: Blends dark fruit flavors of blueberry and blackberry with opulent notes of coffee and dark chocolate for a rich, yet silky smooth, palate.

Name: Perimeter Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The Perimeter Cabernet takes a less serious look at Cabernet with bright red fruits and some impressive raspberry notes  that compliment the mild tannins. Light and lively, this Cab will certainly be a crowd pleaser."

Name: Mas Vida Cava Brut
TastingNotes: A great example of how the Cava category is growingand growing in quality. Clean and pure with grapefruit-like citrus flavors and hints of honey and peaches. Crisp and refreshing, this is a perfect accompaniment for an entire meal, brunch or a celebration. Live more, Mas Vida!

Name: Chateau Beausejour Bordeaux
Review: "Full-bodied with lots of blackberry fruit, licorice and a tar undertone. Juicy finish."

Name: Smoking Loon Loonatic Red
TastingNotes: A balanced sweet and savory nose, full of mixed berries and grilled pear, evokes summer picnics and barbeques. Flavors of raspberries, black currants, and cherries pair with notes of black pepper and smoky nuance from the rich French oak aging. Dark and juicy, with rounded tannins and bright sweetness, this wine has a long and flavorful finish, with just a hint of toasted marshmallow.

Name: Manallino Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: This wine is crisp, well-balanced and dry with pleasant fruit characters with hints of peach and apple aromas. Delightful with light pasta and chicken dishes.

Name: Pedra Cancela Red
Review: "Some really intense vanilla oak, violet, leather and graphite character to this wine. Elegant Early Grey-infused palate with red fruits, chocolate, licorice and savory minty finish."

Name: Luca Grucci Pinot Grigio
Review: "A beautiful floral and fruity bouquet with a rich,round mouth feel with hints of apple, slate and toasted almond and a very good finish."

Name: Carnivor Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Our boldly blended California Cabernet Sauvignon isan exceptional complement to your favorite red meat, layered with hints of rich blackberry, luscious caramel, and smooth toasted oak.

Name: Greywacke Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: A vibrant combination of fresh basil and spicy tomato leaves, tossed with tangy nashi pear and mandarin, sprinkled with a little lemon zest. A highly perfumed wine with blossom-like floral aromas and a subtle flintiness that alludes to an underlying core of minerality. A mouth-watering, refreshing style with a deliciously crisp, yet luscious finish.
Review: "This youthful sauvignon has attractive lime-leaf and fresh-herb aromas with passion fruit and a succulent, fine and fresh lime finish. Immediate enjoyment here. Drink now."

Name: Atalaya Laya
Review: "Blueberry and blackberry aromas and flavors. Hintsof black tea. Full body. Layered and very rich. Juicy and succulent. Some mahogany at the end. Drink now."

Name: Mas de Leda Tempranillo
Review: "100% Tempranillo blended from vines over 40 years old.  A wine of high intensity, yet elegant precision.   The tannins are like velvet wrapped around the black fruit and dark spices.   The lush texture is expansive and pure on the long finish.  A special wine made by famed former Vega Sicilia winemaker Mariano Garcia and his sons."

Name: Cune Rioja Crianza
TastingNotes: Bright garnet color with purple trim. A young Crianza, where red berries aromas remain over the oaky and balsamic notes from its ageing in American oak. The palate is a pleasant wine, round and balanced with notes of sweetness, pastry and a licorice aftertaste.
Review: "The 2015 Cune Crianza is a traditional blend of 85% Tempranillo and 15% split between Garnacha and Mazuelo. The wine is sold at unbelievable prices, and 2015 is one of the best vintages in recent times. It fermented in stainless steel vats with neutral yeasts and matured in American oak barrels for one year. They like to keep their house style while also showing the nuances of the year, which is fuller, riper and more balanced than the two previous years. It's approachable, with red fruit intermixed with spices and a creamy touch. The palate is soft and approachable, with fine tannins and lively acidity. It's easy to drink and very good with food. 4.5 million bottles produced."

Name: Bread & Butter Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The aromas of fresh butter, vanilla oak, and citrusfruit combine in a way that reminds me of orange Creamsicle, with a floral, jasmine hint. A decadent introduction. The aromas introduced in the nose continue on the palate. Buttered popcorn and vanilla oak characters mingle with flavors of honeydew melon, lemon peel, papaya, jasmine, honeysuckle, banana, and lychee.

Name: Vietti Perbacco Nebbiolo
TastingNotes: Offers up generous fruit along with menthol, spicesand hard candy, showing notable intensity while retaining an essentially mid-weight style. Strong, intense and powerful when young, complex and elegant with the ageing. Food Pairing: Hearty stew, wild game, roasted red meats and sharp, aged cheeses.

Name: Belle Ambiance Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Aromas of blackberries and a bit of country lane bramble along with hints of cedar and vanilla before plunging into flavors of ripe plums and black cherries beautifully highlighted with a hint of cedar and spice. This medium-bodied wine is jammy and juicy, with plush, velvety tannins.

Name: Belle Ambiance Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Aromas of lemon zest, honeysuckle and hints of toasty oak that are beautifully set off by flavors of citrus, orchard-fresh green apples, pears and creamy marshmallows. This medium-bodied wine delights with light tannins balanced by good acidity. Enjoy its rich, juicy finish.

Name: Belle Ambiance Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Delicate aromas of lemon blossoms, honeysuckle, tropical fruits, white peaches and jasmine flowers. Then savor the luscious flavors of white nectarines, tart lemons and sweet honeydew melon. As Pinot Grigio should be, this medium-bodied wine is crisp and bright, with a tangy and lingering finish.

Name: Belle Ambiance Dark
TastingNotes: Aromas of black cherries, plums, toasty oak, spicesand vanilla. Then discover indulgent flavors of rich dark fruits, spice and cocoa lifted by a touch of sweetness. This full-bodied wine also delivers big tannins, balanced acidity and a lingering, juicy finish. A blend of Zinfandel, Merlot, Syrah and Malbec.

Name: Belle Ambiance Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Lose yourself in the alluring aromas of cherry, plum and cocoa before indulging in the soft, elegant flavors of sweet fruit and toasty oak as they dance across your palate. From the soft tannins to the balanced acidity and clean, fruit-filled finish, this enchanting wine expertly captures the essence of everything that makes Pinot Noir so irresistible.

Name: Nisia Rueda Verdejo
TastingNotes: Nisia Verdejo is a bright straw color. Aromas of white flowers and fresh fruit, plus expressive, fine notes of dried herbs. On the mouth, this is a flavorful and fruity wine with good acidity and balance.

Name: Hitching Post Cork Dancer Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Comprised of many of the best vineyards of Santa Barbara; expressing ripe berry fruit, with dark plum notes; balance with a solid dose of acidity and sweet oak; truly a tremendous valued Pinot Noir.

Name: Mark Ryan The Dissident Red
TastingNotes: Aromas of bing cherries, savory roasted game, cedarand black pepper, and luscious black cherry and spice join them in the flavor. The balanced acidity and polished tannins lead to an elegant finish
Review: "The 2017 The Dissident functions as a second wine and gets some declassified fruit from the top cuvees, but it also has designated vineyard sources. It offers a deeper, richer style with lots of cassis, ground herbs, lead pencil, and earthy aromas and flavors. Medium to full-bodied, pure, with terrific depth of fruit and purity, it's going to be a smoking value."

Name: Leese-Fitch Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Dark garnet in color, with smells of ripe fruit; sweet plum with a touch of vanilla. The flavors start ripe with cherry preserves, summer plum, fresh strawberry pie, brioche, and finishes with hints of earthy notes, portabella mushroom, clove spice, and dried cranberry.

Name: Chalk Hill Sonoma Coast Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Light golden in color and displays expressive fruitaromas of yellow apple and tropical fruit complexed by toasty vanilla and crÌ¬me brulee. The bouquet is pure and direct with guava, nectarine, golden delicious apple and pears. The palate is rich, full and citrusy with traces of butterscotch and vanilla in the finish. The fruit is reigned in by great acidity and has a persistent malty flavor.

Name: Lopez de Haro Crianza Rioja
Review: åÒThe 2010 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Crianza feels quite classical in its style, lightly-colored, with clean red spicy fruit, a touch of leather and a polished, soft palate that makes it very pleasant and easy to drink. At this price level this wine is a steal! Drink 2014-2018.åÓ

Name: Villacreces Pruno Ribera del Duero
Review: "Smoky and loamy earth notes frame a core of black cherry and plum in this firm, dense red. Balsamic acidity balances muscular tannins, which yield to a floral, minerally finish. Drink now through 2028."

Name: Les Darons Languedoc Red
Review: "The 2017 Languedoc Les Darons is made from 75% Grenache, 20% Syrah, and 5% Carignan thatåÕs mostly from older vines in the Minervois. It saw a touch of whole clusters in the fermenters and is still aging all in concrete tanks. It's deep purple (almost inky) and offers a sensational perfume of blueberries, blackberries, licorice, ground pepper, and earth. Deep, full-bodied, beautifully concentrated, and long, it shows the purity and sexiness of the 2017 vintage and is going to be a killer value."

Name: Giacomo Mori Chiani
Review: "The 2014 Chianti is a gorgeous wine. Bright, pure and focused, the Chianti is once again and overachiever in both its class and price range. Sweet red cherry, rose petals and spices are pushed forward. The 2014 offers lovely density, especially for the vintage. Mori gave the 2014 eighteen months in cask."

Name: Bousquet Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Blackcurrants, clay, tile and dried redcurrants. Full body, tight tannins, fresh acidity and a fruity, velvety finish. Drink now or hold."

Name: New York Yankees Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Aromas of currants and dried cherries, while extracting the colors and flavors of Paso Pobles. The wine was aged in a combination of American and French oak to add complexity and to allow the wine to soften prior to bottling.

Name: Izadi Rose
TastingNotes: Floral and fresh fruit aromas. The palate is sweet,with very delicate mouth.

Name: 1865 Single Vineyard Carmenere
Review: "A little tight now but some pretty chocolate, berry and stone character. Medium body. Firm finish."

Name: Callejon del Crimen Gran Reserve Petit Verdot
Review: "Good medium ruby. Blackberry, licorice pastille, smoke and violet on the nose. Then a bit sweet and more relaxed in the middle palate than the Malbec Gran Reserva, showing a slightly medicinal cast to its black fruit and herb flavors. I like the texture here and the mild saltiness. Tannins are present but fine-grained. Nicely done."

Name: Mendoza Vineyards Gran Reserva Malbec
Review: "Magnificent nose with an impressive array of violets, potpourri, plums, blueberries, black peppercorn, tobacco and cedar wood aromas. Fleshy, weighty and round with a great acidity, an elegant velvety texture and a very long finish. Brilliantly crafted, superb, definitely a gold."

Name: Marquis de Arienzo Crianza Rioja
TastingNotes: Fruit forward, accessible and very food friendly. Has all the elements in all the right places and is drinking beautifully. Vanilla, cherry, spice and strawberry flavors are robust and energetic.

Name: Chalk Hill Wits End Luna Shiraz
Review: "Night harvested, part fermented in French oak, part in stainless steel, the parcels kept separate until bottling, a touch of Barbera included in the final blend. This is bloody delicious, red and black fruits to the fore, superfine tannins providing texture and structure. Fantastic value."

Name: Columbia Crest H3 Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Our Sauvignon Blanc opens with citrus aromas followed by a layer of minerality and pear flavors that give way to a crisp, clean finish.

Name: Meiomi Chardonnay
Review: "Constellation purchased this brand in 2015 for itssuperripe Pinot Noir, but this balanced Chardonnay may be the key to its future. Sea salt, marcona almond and yellow pear scents show on the nose, while the palate leads with strong acidity, settling on lemon peel, subtle smoke and dried herb flavors."

Name: Michael David Freakshow
TastingNotes: Bing cherry, toasted French vanilla bean and ahint of juniper berry on the nose. In the palate oak and fruit flavors are complemented with refined tannins and flavors of dark ripe plums, mission figs and toasted legumes.

Name: Quintay Clava Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "This has attractive fruit-salad character with some nice gooseberry and passion aromas, then a juicy and crisp palate with good length. Drink now. Screw cap."

Name: Duckhorn Decoy Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This is a vibrant and fruit-forward expression of Sauvignon Blanc with abundant aromas of pineapple, honeydew, lime leaves and lemon zest. The fruit continues on the palate, which is full and round with ripe melon flavors and bright refreshing acidity. It lingers in your mouth before ending with a hint of citrus zest.

Name: Beaurenard Rasteau
TastingNotes:
This highly concentrated wine, made from vinesplanted on the best slopes and terraces of the famous Rasteau soils, has an appealingly strong personality.

Besides aromas of very ripe fruit, it is generally laced with notes of spice and garrigue scrubland scents specific to this terroir.

Appealing tannic structure, a rounded body, rich and powerfulåÉthis is the Beaurenard's typically strong character.

Name: Matetic EQ Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "From a cool vintage, quite normal for the coastal part of Casablanca, pretty much like 2013, with good yields and no frost or other issues. The palate is tasty and fresh, with great texture, very focused and clean flavors and a salty finish, the signature of the sea and the granite. This is a bargain and one of their finest harvests. It should develop nicely in bottle."

Name: Ritual Pinot Noir
Review: "This is a high-toned and focused red with strawberry, lemon and cherry aromas and flavors. Medium to full body, vivid fruit and a long and flavorful finish. Screw cap. Drink now or hold."

Name: Il Tauro Salice Salentino Riserva
TastingNotes: Rich and round fruity aroma, dark fruit and berry flavors, medium bodied with a distinctive texture and a Soft velvety finish.

Name: Hahn Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Deep rubyin color, Hahn Estates Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noir is rich, layered and complex. Bright red berry fruit dominate the nose and palate, along with the lush dark fruit flavors characteristic of Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noir. Notes of spice, dried herbs, violets, minerals and toasty oak are balanced by cool-climate acidity and silky tannins.
Review: "Offering a mix of dried berry, black tea, spice and loamy earth flavors, this succeeds, delivering moderately ripe fruit and loamy tannins. Best from 2019 through 2024."

Name: The Calling Dutton Ranch Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Rich and smooth wine with subtle hints of oak and crisp flavors of Meyer lemon, honeydew melon and juicy white nectarine.

Name: Gnarly Head Authentic Black
TastingNotes: True to its name, Gnarly Head Authentic Black openswith brooding aromas of black cherry and black licorice providing a powerful entrÌ©e to this big, robust Petite Sirah-å_Ûbased blend. Dark and inky in the glass, concentrated flavors of blackberry and plum are framed by hints of dark chocolate on the finish.

Name: Menage A Trios Midnight
TastingNotes: A passionate blend bursting with dusky aromas, an extraordinarily deep color, and rich, ripe black fruit.

Name: Racine Pinot Noir
Review: "Very detailed and elegant. Love the floral aromas upfront. Loads of tasty ripe, jammy red fruit with underlying minerality that carries nicely through the spicy, lingering finish. The silky, soft texture remains fresh and vibrant."

Name: Ottosoldi Gavi di Gavi
TastingNotes: Sparkling straw-yellow in color. Floral scents withlingering tones of ripe fruits on the nose, tertiary aromas promising longevity. Enormously fresh, full rich flavor, long-lasting with mineral tones. Perfectly suited to all good food.
Review: "Plenty of delicious daffodils, Williams pears, sliced crabapples and grapefruit. Great energy, focus and depth to this on the palate, which is oily and dense but reserved and vibrant, thanks to pretty acidity. Drink now."

Name: La Crema Willamette Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: The nose is complex with hints of violets, star anise, marionberry (an Oregon native) and bay leaf, while the palate displays more brambly fruit, coffee bean, pomegranate and candied orange zest.

Name: Maquis Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "A very serious Cabernet with blackberry and currant character. Hints of vanilla. Full body and chewy tannins. Needs time to come together. I like the balance and freshness."

Name: Corte Corsano Chianti Classico
Review: "Floral aromas of cherry and roses with bing cherry, currant and spicy flavors. Medium bodied with ripe tannins and an excellent finish."

Name: Melville Estate Chardonnay
TastingNotes: With an electric green-gold hue this wine has an elusive and fresh aromatic array of saline, limes, lemon drops, lemon-lime margarita, green apple skin, white currants and white apricots. Even more alluring are the other aspects of chalk, saltwater taffy, angel food cake, gingerbread, seashell, Italian parsley and orange-flower blossom. In the mouth, the wine is ample and fleshy yet remains very chiseled, delineated and crisp.With an electric green-gold hue this wine has an elusive and fresh aromatic array of saline, limes, lemon drops, lemon-lime margarita, green apple skin, white currants and white apricots. Even more alluring are the other aspects of chalk, saltwater taffy, angel food cake, gingerbread, seashell, Italian parsley and orange-flower blossom. In the mouth, the wine is ample and fleshy yet remains very chiseled, delineated and crisp.
Review: åÒThe 2013 Chardonnay Estate Sta. Rita Hills is a smoking effort that represent a fabulous value in Chardonnay. Made in a pure, clean style, it was barrel-fermented and aged 8 months in neutral oak. It gives up serious notes of lemon, lime peel, tinges of wild herbs and salty minerality to go with a medium-bodied, balanced and elegant profile on the palate that keeps you coming back to the glass. ItåÕs superb now, but will also age nicely for 3-4 years.åÓ

Name: Arrowflite North Coast Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This full-flavored Chardonnay has a creamy palate with hints of brioche, popcorn and citrus blossom.
Review: åÒRipe, lush and complex with tremendous balance and depth. Rich flavors of pineapple, pear, fig, citrus, tangerine and honey followed by a great finish with firm acidity. An up-front fruity style Chardonnay that is drinking well now.åÓ

Name: Au Contraire Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: An elegant and silky mouthfeel with fine-grained tannins and firm acidity showcase the wine's ripe red fruit. Pairs well with grilled and roasted meats such as lamb, pork, poultry, duck and light sauces, or with delicate cheeses.
Review: åÒNotes of cherry, raspberry, plum and violet are accented by a spiciness from French oak barrel aging. Beautifully balanced with silky tannins!åÓ

Name: Domaine de Bila Haut Occultum
Review: "One of the more polished, sexy examples of the cuvee, the 2015 CÌ«tes du Roussillon Villages Latour de France Occultum Lapidem checks in as a blend of 50% Syrah, 40% Grenache and the balance Carignan and MourvÌ¬dre, aged all in concrete tanks. It boasts killer notes of black raspberries, cassis, pepper and licorice, with just a hint of chocolate appearing with time in the glass. This medium to full-bodied, layered and beautifully textured red is an incredible value and will be impossible to resist over the coming 4-5 years, and IåÕm sure it will keep even longer."

Name: Kentia Albarino
TastingNotes: Aromas and sensations of ripe fruit (apple and peach), mineral notes, citrus, white flowers against a pleasant herbaceous background. Oily in the mouth, tasty, complex, powerful and full-bodied. Well structured and with a vibrant acidity that adds freshness.

Name: Lafond Santa Rita Hills Pinot Noir
Review: "This is one of the more elegant and satisfyingly dark expressions of Pinot Noir in its price range, starting with aromas of sugarplum, hibiscus, dark berries, crushed slate and moist earth. The palate combines rose petals, baked boysenberry and dark cocoa with a strong streak of earthy minerality, all upheld by chalky tannins."

Name: Motte Maucort Bordeaux
Review: "Round, silky texture and lots of depth to the brambly black fruit and cherry flavors. Good concentration on the mid-palate. Hints of coffee and mocha come through on the elegant, soft finish. Outstanding Value."

Name: Bousquet Gaia Red Blend
Review: "A juicy and fruity wine with some tannin backbone.Medium to full body. Polished and pretty. A blend of Malbec, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon."

Name: Noemia A Lisa Malbec Blend
Review: "Aromas of earth and spices with hints of berries and dried meat follow through to a medium body and soft and silky tannins. I like the smoky and decadent fruit on the finish. Drink now."

Name: Confidencial Reserva Red
Review: "This is rich, full-bodied and structured. It has layers of firm tannins, rich black fruits and acidity. The strong mineral texture gives the wine a definite character while suggesting the wine could age further. Drink this fine wine from 2019."

Name: Hunter Chaps Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Lush flavors of berry and cassis are present on the palate. This wine is bright and expressive with a touch of candied plum on the lengthy finish. Enjoy with some grilled sausage or some tender bbq chicken."

Name: Hunter Chaps Chardonnay
Review: "Pale straw in color with toasted vanilla notes on the nose, this medium bodied chardonnay boasts flavors of apple, pear with a touch of oak that brings it all together. A beautiful compliment with some broiled fish or roast chicken."

Name: Tommasi Poggio Al Tufo Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "A Cabernet Sauvignon that flits between black peppers, beautifully fresh elderberries, lavender and violets. Medium to full body, lots of spicy undergrowth flavors and a long, chewy finish."

Name: Apothic Crush
TastingNotes: An alluring blend of Petite Sirah and Pinot Noir. This limited release red wine blends red fruit flavors with notes of caramel and chocolate for a luscious yet velvety, smooth wine experience.

Name: Orin Swift Abstract
TastingNotes: Opaque and purple to the rim of the glass, an elevated display of aromatics is immediately present. Fragrant dark fruits, spring flowers, violet, and hint of garrigue greet the nose and tempt added review. Extraordinary freshness is present upon entry leading to lush flavors of sweet boysenberries, kirsch, licorice, dark cherries, and exotic floral notes. The palate is thoroughly treated and left with a finish of bright acidity and round tannins, which exist in seamless balance.
Review: "Plump and appealingly gamy, with black raspberry, smoky beef and cracked pepper flavors that take on depth toward big but polished tannins. Grenache, Syrah and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2023. 40,000 cases made."

Name: Dark Horse Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Winemaker, Beth Liston, knocked the dust off the traditional Chardonnay flavor profile to give this classic varietal a true Dark Horse makeover. Thanks to her signature mix of classic and innovative techniques, Dark Horse Chardonnay has made believers out of the very label-chasers who thought quality wine had to come at a price.

Name: Las Huertas Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Amazing value from the Chilean vineyards of the Lafite-Rothschild family (First Growth Bordeaux) The Cabernet opens with a fresh, fruity nose of strawberries and raspberries, blended with notes of black pepper and bay leaf. Deep and well balanced, this juicy red is a perfect match for red meats."

Name: William Hill North Coast Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Our William Hill Estate North Coast Cabernet Sauvignon has a rich palate of dark fruit flavors, with subtle hints of caramel and cocoa. The Sonoma and Napa fruit gave this wine its ripe blackberry and black cherry flavors, while the grapes from Lake and Mendocino brought tremendous structure and presence to the blend. This Cabernet, which was blended with a touch of Merlot to round out the mouthfeel, will reveal more complex layers with time in the bottle.

Name: Dreaming Tree Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Flavors and aromas of ripe cherry, wild strawberry,and caramel. Complex with supple tannins

Name: Andrew Murray Tous Les Jours Syrah
TastingNotes: Remarkably dark and full-bodied, and yet it has such gentle tannins. It is truly a pleasure to drink, especially at the price. Lots of fruit and spices here...no need to wax poetic about this one as it tastes just plain yummy.

Name: Manutara Desafio Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Deep black red, in nose feels like red cherry fruitmixed with notes from custody in barrels as vanilla. The palate has smooth and round tannins with mid to high body. The lingering finish confirms cherry and mint accomplished by notes of tobacco and smoke because of the passage through barrels.
Review: åÒSeductive floral and red fruit notes with cassis, raspberry and coffee aromas that yield to creamy mocha notes in the glass. The palate is lush and balanced, and therefore captures the best of what Chile offers. A very pure and well-made Cabernet Sauvignon that can be drunk now or over the next 5 years.åÓ

Name: Chateau Puycarpin Bordeaux
Review: "Rich and ripe with dark cherry and vanilla flavors.  Excellent balance and depth with licorice, spicebox and graphite notes dancing along on the pure finish.  Another great vintage for this Chateau."

Name: Domaine Gueneau Sancerre Rose
TastingNotes: One of our favorites of the vintage. Juicy and tense with saliva inducing acidity to carry along fresh strawberry and pink grapefruit flavors. Beautifully put together. We suspect we will all be drinking quite a few of these this season.

Name: Castellani Ziobaffa Rosso
TastingNotes: An intense bouquet, elegant and fruity, with lovelyaromas of violets. On palate is full, warm with perfectly balanced tannins with hints of licorice, spice and red fruits.
Review: "Rich and decadent with cola, berry and chocolate character. Full and soft. Decadent style. Fun and funky organic wine! Drink now."

Name: Lofthouse Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Textbook Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, the Lofthouse offers pronounced notes of gooseberries and kiwi with hints of fresh cut grass. Medium-bodied with a good concentration of vibrant citrus flavors, crisp acidity and a long zesty finish."

Name: Alma de Los Andes Malbec Reserva
Review: "Rock solid and balanced. Heavily oaked resiny flavors rest on top of core blackberry fruit, while this shows woody dry tannins and salty baked berry flavors on the finish."

Name: Mendoza Vineyards 1907 Malbec
Review: "A rich nose in this Malbec with dried flowers, strawberries and orange skins. Medium body, firm tannins and a vibrant finish. Drink now."

Name: Marques de Riscal Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Very fresh and inviting notes of grapefruit, with hints of peach and lime that hit the palate with elegance and balance. The finish is nicely tense and long and features a hint at white flowers."

Name: Dark Horse Red Blend
TastingNotes: The Dark Horse Big Red Blend has deep flavors of dark berry and black currant, supported by plush tannins, hints of dark roasted oak and a long finish. This Red Blend underwent alcoholic fermentation with hand chosen yeast to provide enhanced color, structure and fruit characteristics. A blend of Malbec, Rubired, Syrah, Tempranillo, and Merlot.

Name: Lafond Santa Rita Hills Chardonnay
Review: "Lemon peels, sea salt, hazelnut and honeysuckle aromas play up the more voluptuous side of Chardonnay, and hint at marshmallow without going so far. The palate is surprisingly zippy with acid and Meyer lemon zest, but also shows richer hints of browned butter and toasted almond toward the finish. It's a crowd-pleaser for many tastes."

Name: Jean Noel Haton Brut Reserve
Review: "A racy Champagne, with a subtle, smoky base note underscoring the flavors of black raspberry, pastry, lemon zest and white peach puree. Tightly knit and creamy through to the spiced finish. Drink now through 2020."

Name: Leese-Fitch Chardonnay
TastingNotes: This Chardonnay is bursting with aromas of ripe Lychee nut, tropical melon, and crisp Anjou Pear. After the initial blast of fruit your senses with be bathed with aromas of roasted chestnut, vanilla caramel apple, and an ample dose of rich French Oak. The palate is full-bodied with a fresh entry, medium weight mid-palate, and a creamy, lingering finish that just won't quit! This is a very versatile wine that has great balance of fruit notes with rich and memorable creaminess.

Name: Este Vinho Verde
TastingNotes: Almost clear in color, the wine has lemon zest and herbs on the nose. Clean, light citrus on the palate along with a slight spritz on the tongue. Refreshing!

Name: Perimeter Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Our Chardonnay delicately blends the aromas and flavors of tropical fruit and dried apricot with balanced oak and lingering notes of butterscotch on the finish.

Name: Fog Bank Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Zesty and vibrant with fruit flavors of pear, orange, honeydew melon and a touch of lemon that are followed by an easygoing, crisp finish.

Name: Encore Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Aromas of bright & lush blackberry with subtle spice notes. It offers plenty of fruit flavor including black fruits, Bing cherry and a touch of mocha; all complemented by a firm structure, medium body, great mouthfeel and lingering finish. There is much to like in this bottle."

Name: Josh Legacy Red
TastingNotes: Josh Cellars Legacy is a blend of red wine that is plush and juicy. Aromas of blueberry pie, fresh raspberries, sage, rosemary and cigar box fill the glass. The wine is dense and lush with flavors of plum, black currant, and dark chocolate, offering a luxuriously smooth texture and a long, juicy Bing cherry and cocoa powder finish.

Name: Carm Bispado Red
Review: åÒBeautiful, bright nose of blackberries and figs.Well integrated tannins, the fruits and acidity meld together nicely. Palate offers ripe red berries with a hint of tobacco on the long succulent finish. Impressive at this price.åÓ

Name: 14 Hands Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This vibrant Sauvignon Blanc opens with light aromas of citrus and passion fruit. Bright flavors of gooseberry, grapefruit and guava lead to a crisp, juicy finish that lingers on.

Name: Storico Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Light and dry with melon and pear flavors. Youthful, lively and fruity with a soft mouth feel.

Name: La Calonica Rosso di Montepulciano
Review: "Bouquet of cherries, currant and mocha with cherry, spice and earth flavors. Full bodied and well balanced."

Name: La Calonica Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
TastingNotes: Dark ruby garnet color with a powerful sweet nose of plums leather and game. Silky and long, with lovely blackberry and hints of black pepper. The bouquet is delicate and the palate is dry with a slight scent of violet.
Review: åÒDark lush black cherry, cherry and plum with a wonderful array of spice with pepper, cinnamon and nutmeg. Firm tannins with well-balanced acidity.While you can certainly lay this wine down for a couple years, this wine is drinking beautifully today.åÓ

Name: Durigutti Cabernet Franc
Review: "This is very floral and inviting on the nose with notes of rosemary, violets, lavender, citrus, orange peel and boysenberries, as well as lots of spicy undertones. Full-bodied and really seductive with tightly-wound, grainy tannins, vibrant acidity and a long, succulent finish. Drink in 2021."

Name: Dark Horse Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Dark Horse Cabernet Sauvignon has bold flavorsof blackberry and cherry supported by firm tannins, brown spice and a dark chocolate espresso finish. This Cabernet Wine was carefully aged to develop dark fruit flavors and dark roast aromas.

Name: Dark Horse Merlot
TastingNotes: Dark Horse Merlot has a robust and fruit-driven taste. Rich aromas of ripe blackberry, complemented by elegant toasted oak that imparts hints of nutmeg with a long, plush finish.

Name: Boisset Bourgogne Rouge
TastingNotes: Silky and elegant with plenty of ripe cherry fruit accompanied by roasted figs and vanilla. A nice touch of crispness on the finish makes it very appealing at meal time. Really nice overall mouthfeel.

Name: Chono Single Vineyard Carmenere
Review: "Leading South American winemaker Alvaro Espinoza considers Carmenere Chile's signature varietal, and it shines through in his 2012 Chono. Classic red fruit notes are met with smoke and spice, leading to juicy cherry-vanilla flavors which are braced by zesty acidity. Wonderfully supple and ripe with a silky mouthfeel."

Name: Marietta Christo Red
Review: "The 2015 Christo is a RhÌ«ne style blend of 64% Syrah, 23% Grenache, 7% Petite Sirah, and 6% Viognier. Beautiful blackberry fruit, peppery herbs, underbrush, and a hint of olive all give way to a medium to full-bodied, plump, textured beauty that shines for its charm, texture, and pleasure-bent style."

Name: Alba Vineyards Dry Riesling
TastingNotes: Rich dimensional aromas of green apple and pineapple with a silky fruity-yet-dry medium-to-full body and a lavish, tangy peach skin accented finish. A sensational food friendly white wine.

Name: Jack's House Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Aromas of plums are underscored by dark chocolate and coffee. On the palate it opens bright, followed by plush black currants and a lingering finish

Name: Bread & Butter Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Elegant, but bold with spice and complex fruit. There is an earthy edge with ripe raspberries, rose water, and dark fruit. The acid compliments the fine tannins providing a silky structure that is optimally drinkable now and over the next 5 years.

Name: Claremont Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: This Cabernet shows an abundance of ripe, up-front fruitiness, with blackberry, cherry, currant which are balanced by hints of cedar. Ends with graceful tannins and a full finish.
Review: "Ripe and harmonious with ample cassis, blackberry and cherry flavors that are followed by a touch of toasted oak and spice. A great affordable value for an everyday Cabernet!"

Name: Long Barn Chardonnay
Review: åÒRipe & rich with balanced aromas of pear, vanilla and toasted oak. The palate is coated with similar notes along with hints of apricot, apple and a lingering finish that leaves you wanting more. Pairs perfectly with broiled lobster tail or even a roast chicken with vegetables.åÓ

Name: Long Barn Pinot Noir
Review: åÒThis Pinot promises plenty of raspberry and brightcherry on the nose mixed with slightly earthy undertones and a hint of vanilla spice. The palate shows a berry blend of raspberry, strawberry, and cherry with delicate textures and a medium bodied style. Perfect for pairing, this particular Pinot will bring out the best in grilled pork, poultry, or even portabella mushrooms.åÓ

Name: Kendall Jackson Pinot Gris
TastingNotes: This wine contains ripe citrus flavors with rich aromas of tropical mango, melon, and juicy peach. The bright fruit flavors and layered texture contribute to this wine's versatility. Great by the pool, on the dock or before dinner.

Name: Laplace Madiran
TastingNotes: This is a concentrated, powerful and utterly likable red with abundant plum, blueberry, blackberry and black currant on the nose and palate.

Name: Perimeter Black Dark Red
Review: åÒAromas of black cherry and hints of black licoricejump from the glass.  This dark red blend has lush bold flavors of dark berries, plums with a full bodied texture.  ItåÕs a bold and rich wine that captures the essence of its genre.  A definite must try for the Dark Red wine lover.åÓ

Name: Ottosoldi Barbera
TastingNotes: Gentle aroma of red berries and chocolate . On the palate notes fresh fruits like cherry and raspberry mix beautifully with earthy notes.

Name: Rayun Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: An intense and fresh citric nose with notes of green apple and zippy gooseberry,combined with a crisp refreshing palate with good persistent finish.

Name: Maturo Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
TastingNotes: A rich and fruity red wine that is medium bodied, dry and well balanced. Pleasant notes of red berries and cherries, with a clean, fruity and long finish. 6 months in large oak help adds to the complexity of the wine.

Name: le Petit Silex Sancerre
TastingNotes: Pale yellow color. Intense aromas of white flowers and citrus fruits, mixed with a touch of minerality. In the mouth the wine is crisp and full of freshness, typical of the region.

Name: Menage A Trois Silk
TastingNotes: Brimming with alluring aromas, full-bodied, bright red fruit flavors, and a marvelously smooth mouthfeel, Silk exposes the softer side of MÌ©nage ÌÊ Trois.

Name: Fess Parker Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: On the nose, this wine exhibits aromas of black cherry,forest floor, lavender, raspberry, rose petal and vanilla. Flavors of Bing cherry, red currant, cranberry, earth, cacao and a touch of mineral can be savored.

Name: Chateau Peyrabon Bordeaux
Review: "With its high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has a good structure and ripe, generous black-currant flavors. Its fresh character gives juiciness that contrasts with the rich fruits. It's a wine with tannins and aging potential. Drink from 2023."

Name: Zuccardi Concreto Malbec
Review: "This is a unique wine for Mendoza with a cool-fruit and serious slate character. Undertones of dried herbs and bark. Full body, integrated fruit and tannins. Wet earth, too. Reminds me of the reds in Spain's Galicia, but so new in Argentina."

Name: Santa Julia Reserve Mountain Blend
Review: "This blend works so well! Floral, with ripe, crunchy black fruit, softness, elegance and purity. Full-bodied and youthful with a persistent finish. Fabulous value."

Name: Mark West Black Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Full bodied, rich and smooth, with hits of black cherries and plums, mocha, vanilla, and caramel.

Name: La Cattura Tuscan Red
Review: "A beautiful wine that shows red fruit such as cherries and red plums as well as stones, cedar and orange skin. So complex. Medium body, firm and rich tannins and an extremely clear and long finish. Drink now or hold. Made from organic grapes."

Name: Las Cartas Red Blend
Review: "Sourced from an exclusive vineyard at Lagar de Bezana, this Cabernet Sauvignon dominated blend adds a touch of high elevation Syrah. Attractive notes of fresh cherries and dark chocolate jump from the glass. Soft tannins and excellent structure compliment the palate with just a hint of cedar brought on by the oak aging."

Name: Shaw & Smith Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "If it's not broken, don't fix it. The innumerable buyers (or restaurant customers) know what they are getting with this consistently excellent example of sauvignon blanc. It's pitched between green pea/grass on the one hand, tropical on the other. It scores for its overall balance and juicy length."

Name: Black Cabra Malbec
Review: "Dark ruby red, this is a soft and silky Malbec loaded with aromas of blackberries and violets, with subtle notes of pepper and cloves. Black cherries and plums fill the medium to full-bodied palate, with hints of cedar and vanilla on the long finish. Impressive red from Jean-Claude Berrouet (Chateau Petrus) who also makes the Tapiz Alta line."

Name: William Hill North Coast Chardonnay
TastingNotes: With roots deeply anchored in the Napa Valley,William Hill Estate Winery crafts Chardonnay and Bordeaux varietal wines from the undiscovered vineyards of CaliforniaåÕs most celebrated regions. Beginning with William Hill EstateåÕs 140-acre benchland vineyard near the Silverado Trail, Winemaker Mark Williams turns to the hidden corners of southern Napa, the North Coast and the Central Coast to create a unique collection of rich, expressive wines.

Name: Vina Carmen Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "One of a series of tasty Gran Reservas from Carmen, showing the freshness of a cooler year but not lacking in focus or concentration. Fine tannins, leafy, herbal flavours and notes of clove and vanilla spice."

Name: Bob's Chenin Blanc
TastingNotes: Plump, with an off-dry edge to the lemon, shortbread and white peach flavors.  Delivers a flash of pineapple on the finish.  Great introductory wine to a South African staple varietal.

Name: Bob's Pinotage
TastingNotes: A medium-bodied wine showing plum and blackberry flavors with a briary edge and smoky finish.  Great introductory wine to a South African staple varietal.

Name: Bloem Red Blend
TastingNotes: In this blend, black currant and cherry fruit aromas are balanced with exotic spice and earthy undertones. The wine is smooth with a dry, lingering finish.
Review: åÒThe 2014 Bloem Red Blend offers simple cassis and blueberry scents on the nose. The palate is medium-bodied with clean, fresh blackberry and blueberry fruit with a hint of balsamic on the finish.åÓ

Name: Remhoogte Bushvine Pinotage
TastingNotes: True to its parents this Pinotage shows both the earthy and savoury elements of Pinot Noir combined with the riper and more textured elements typical of Cinsault from Hermitage. Ultra fresh and pure with cherries and mulberries dominating the nose with hints of fynbos and a slight earthiness bringing depth. The ripe berried fruit follows through onto the palate where chalky tannin and fresh spice gives this wine a mouth wateringly savoury finish.
Review: åÒThe Remhoogte Bushvine Pinotage 2013 has a lovely bouquet showing aromas of red currant, strawberry and mocha. The palate is medium-bodied with sweet ripe black cherries and blueberry fruit, fleshy in the mouth, with a harmonious finish.åÓ

Name: Remhoogte Honeybunch Chenin Blanc
TastingNotes: The wine has a pale golden yellow colour. The nose is complex and begins with fresh aromas of tropical fruit and honeysuckle, with undertones of subtle butter scotch and spicy acacia karoo. The Palate is rich and full bodied with a creamy texture and is livened by a fresh acidity and has a lingering, crisp finish. Honeyed aromas and flavours will develop with aging in the bottle.
Review: åÒThe Remhoogte Honeybunch Reserve Chenin Blanc 2013has a very attractive nose with honeycomb and tropical fruit jumping from the glass. The palate is very creamy with flavors of honey and pear with hints of lemon. A touch of acidity ties everything together and leads to a long, focused finish.åÓ

Name: Gigognan Cotes du Rhone
Review: "Enticing aromas of dark plum, dark spices and vanilla lead to an opulent, creamy texture. Juicy ripe fruit completely coats the palate, remaining full and fresh. The elegant, long finish hints at roast fig and ripe black cherry and little note of roasted walnut."

Name: Josh Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Aromas of cherry, strawberry and toasty oak overwhelm the bouquet. Dark cherry and chocolate flavors fill the mouth with a rich intensity. The palate of the wine is plush and subtle but with a firm texture and finish.

Name: Z. Alexander Brown Uncaged Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This red over delivers from nose to palate. Deeplyrich aromas of dark chocolate lead as blackberry jam pervades. The acid is bright for food-pairing."

Name: Collina dei Lecci Brunello di Montalcino
Review: "The plum and dried berry character is intense withsome flower undertones. Full body, rich and layered. Flavorful finish. Fruitier style. Drink in 2019."

Name: Lecciaia Brunello di Montalcino
Review: "A wealth of dried cherry and flower aromas follow through to a full body, fine tannins and a raspberry and cherry aftertaste. A fruity yet subtle red. A beauty. Fantastic for the vintage."

Name: Gnarly Head 1924 Double Black Red Blend
Clos de la Roilette Tardive Fleurie
1865 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "This is a Sauvignon Blanc with lots of lemon rind and chalk-like character. Some fossilized shell, too. Medium body, bright and crisp. Juicy. Drink now."

Name: Raat's Red Jasper
TastingNotes: Shows dark berry fruit on the nose, along with the perfume and violets. The palate offers luscious brambly berry fruit intertwined with hints of tobacco and dark chocolate. Silky tannins caress the palate, and a lovely minerality shines through on the long, supple finish.
Review: åÒThe 2013 Red Jasper is a blend of 85% Cabernet Franc, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Malbec and 2.5% each of Merlot & Petit Verdot. This is a classic, tobacco-tinged bouquet that remains very well defined. The palate is also less fleshy, revealing its structure and agreeable austerity that renders this very åÒclassicåÓ in style. The acidity is perfectly in tune with the fruit with an almost foursquare finish. åÓ

Name: Araucano Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "After lengthy research, French winemaker Francois Lurton launched his reserve series of Cabernet Sauvignon from the best plots in Chile's Lolol Valley. Using environmentally-friendly (biodynamic) methods, he has created a full-bodied red loaded with aromas of black fruits, plums and spice. 2015 was a hot year in the valley, contributing a ripe palate, full tannins and a touch of sweet grilled peppers on the finish."

Name: Orin Swift Palermo
TastingNotes: Rich aromas of seasoned oak meld effortlessly with ripe boysenberry and candied cassis. The entry of the wine is soft and delicate, but quickly evolves into a serious mid-palate replete with opulent and concentrated flavors of dark fruits. Black currant and kirsch provide background to lively raspberry and cherry notes that create a near endless finish.

Name: Orin Swift Machete
TastingNotes: A nearly opaque color sets in the glass with a hard, red complexion that is almost black. Aromas of ripe blueberries and candied plum mingle with toasted oak and charred vanilla. The entry is soft and inviting which paves the way for a lush mid-palate replete with layers of ripe boysenberry and cassis. The finish showcases ripe tannins and pronounced fruit which frames the two for nearly a minute.
Review: "Generous and expressive, big and brawny, offering a mouthful oftannins but also brimming with flavors and aromas, including Earl Grey tea, dark chocolate, dried violet and toasted gingerbread. Rich notes of plum and black cherry are balanced by forest floor and earthy accents, lingering on the long finish. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2030."

Name: Begonia Sangria
TastingNotes: Begonia is a premium sangria fashioned to communicate the bright orange citrus flavors of the Mediterranean. Exhibits bright citrus aromas and fresh red berry flavors, smooth and delicious. Enjoy chilled, poured over ice and/or garnished with fruit.

Name: Charles Smith "Cs" Substance Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Precise and vibrantly structured, with black cherry, espresso and spice flavors that take on richness toward polished tannins. Drink now through 2024."

Name: Underwood Rose
TastingNotes: Strawberry and peach stand as the most pronounced notes, in what is ultimately a fruit-forward wine. It doesn't venture into overt sweetness but keeps things even and enjoyable.

Name: Fritz Fisk Riesling
Review: åÒThis wine embodies the elegant and racy style of aclassic Riesling. It is an easy drinking wine with the right balance between sweetness and acidity. The first impression is dominated by citrus and stone fruit. Orange zest and grapefruit accompany white peach. The palate starts with full fruity flavors ending with fine crisp acidity.åÓ

Name: Lote 44 Malbec
Review: "A fresh and bright red with lemon rind and light berry character. Medium body, light tannins and a crisp finish. All about drinkability. Drink now."

Name: Chateau Thivin Broiully Reverdon
Review: "The 2017 Brouilly Reverdon bursts from the glass with lovely aromas of blackberries, cassis, plums and potpourri. On the palate, the wine is medium to full-bodied, bright and juicy, with sweeter fruit than the 2016 rendition but a shared sense of crunchiness and vivacity. It was only bottled three weeks before I tasted it, but it was already showing very well."

Name: Tonel 46 Reserve Malbec
Review: "The perfumed and harmonious 2016 Tonel 46 Malbec was produced with grapes from their estate vineyards in Los Chacayes and El Manzano in TunuyÌÁn in the Uco Valley. It matured in second use French oak barrels for six to eight months. It's floral and spicy and has an approachable palate with fine tannins, bright, juicy fruit and high acidity that makes you salivate."

Name: Dreaming Tree Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Fresh and juicy with tropical fruit aromas of passion fruit and kiwi. Finishing crisp and clean with hints of grapefruit and zesty lime.

Name: Lagar da Condesa Albarino
TastingNotes: Briny citrus, saline and lees aromas drive thenose on this minerally AlbariÌ±o that also offers mild oak notes. Flavors of green banana, peach, apple and woodspice finish crisp and with a touch of elegance.

Name: Ravage Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Our flavors are smooth, bold, and audacious. Dark berries layered with luscious vanilla and mocha to round out the palate. The tannins are soft enough to add balance while giving structure and depth.

Name: Intrinsic Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Tremendously complex, this Cabernet Sauvignon boasts leather and cherry aromas, subtle mineral notes, and a finish that goes on forever.
Review: "A red with lots of sweet-tobacco and currant aromas and flavors. Medium to full body, round and juicy tannins and a flavorful finish. Harmonious and fine. Drink now."

Name: Quinta Do Portal Rose
TastingNotes: It has a delicate pink color which is obtained by ashort maceration on the skins. Modern winemaking retains aromas of young red fruits with lovely floral notes. It is deliciously crisp and refreshing and is best served chilled as an appetizer or with white meat dishes, fish and shellfish.
Review: "The 2018 RosÌ©, in bottle for about four months when tasted, is an equal blend of Tinta Roriz (much less this year) and Touriga Nacional, very dry and coming in at 13.5% alcohol. This is another in a long and consistent string of fine pinks from Portal. The styles are different, but the quality remains predictable. This is a brighter and fresher feel than the 2017, but it also has fine concentration for this year and clean, dry flavors. Beautifully done again, this seems to be a no-brainer purchase every year."

Name: Route Stock Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Complex aromas of black plum, blackberry and roasted coffee, entwined with delicately roasted spices. The palate is rich and layered with ripe black fruit flavors and seamlessly integrated toasted-oak notes.
Review: åÒWith small additions of Merlot and Cabernet Franc,this wine opens in green olive and celery, with a tease of mint, before unleashing a mouthfilling core of black cherry and cassis. Lively acidity presides over all, giving a powerful backbone to a sophisticated wine.åÓ

Name: Folium Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: After tasting this one we grabbed every case that was available for the vintage! Tense and focused with loads of grapefruit and pineapple flavors. Tangy, pure and really fresh. DonåÕt miss it!

Name: Lyle Thomas Oregon Pinot Noir
Review: "Rich with impressive purity offering vibrant strawberry, cherry and raspberry flavors followed by sweet spice and a hint of pepper. Well-balanced with a wonderful, lengthy, seductive finish."

Name: Casas del Bosque Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "A very bright, red-fruit nose with a wealth of fresh berry flavors and a succulent, juicy and sleek palate that has fine tannins and plenty of flavor. Drink now."

Name: 1865 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir
Review: "This is a really impressive Chilean Pinot Noir that shows lots of earthy nuance, combined with cranberries and citrus. Medium body, finely grained tannins and a spicy, medium-chewy finish. Shows really good complexity and form. Drink now."

Name: Daou The Pessimist Red Blend
TastingNotes:
The 2017 Pessimist has a powerful and intensely aromatic nose that ascends to greet you with blueberry, boysenberry and black plum fragrance. Evolving layers reveal elderberry and truffle, with cocoa and cardamom spice accents, further augmented by hints of eucalyptus, leather, cherry pipe tobacco and grilled meats.

Broad and expansive on the palate, bestowing lush and generous flavors of black cherry, blueberry, crÌ¬me de cassis and damp forest floor. Notes of lavender, anise and black olives complement the rich fruit. Massive in weight yet elegantly structured, this wine is a powerhouse that reveals itself in controlled stages.

The finish is smooth and leisurely. Essences of pure dark berry fruit seemingly refuse to abate with a gorgeous fitting finale.

Name: Boschendal The Rose Garden
Review: "Raspberry, cranberry and red cherry aromas are thehallmarks of this delicate rose, with wild berry flavors on the palate and a hint of spice adding complexity to the finely textured finish."

Name: A List Chardonnay
Review: åÒFrom Western AustraliaåÕs Margaret River appellation, the A-List Chardonnay has notes of bright white peach and stone fruits with a whiff of French oak and zingy minerality. Fantastic value from this region.åÓ

Name: Quiet Resolve Hanna's Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "The HannahåÕs Choice Sauvignon Blanc has a rich concentrated nose of intense pears, gooseberries, and candied lemons. It is medium-bodied, with great purity and mouthwatering grapefruit and lime flavors. Silky in texture and powerful with balancing acidity rounding out the wine."

Name: Josh Merlot
TastingNotes: The bouquet of this Merlot is complex with violets, sweet plums, rosemary, and vanilla bean. On the palate, the wine is velvety and soft in texture, with flavors of juicy plums, blackberries, and Bing cherries, and a long cocoa powder finish and fine tannins.

Name: Black Cabra Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Lush flavors of red fruits and strawberry jam. Oak aging adds complexity and notes of spice and vanilla.
Review: åÒBright ruby red with big aromas of red fruits, black cherry, spice and chocolate. Ripe and semi-sweet in the mouth, with flavors of blackberry, mocha and oak. Impressive red from Jean-Claude Berrouet (Chateau Petrus) who also makes Tapiz Alta.åÓ

Name: Dark Horse Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: A velevety smooth, almost creamy flavor wave. Luscious, velvety and cherry flavors texture dance on the palate.The light notes of molasses help lift the fruit and floral character. This Pinot Noir offers a balanced palate with a subtle sweetness.

Name: Chalk Hill Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Medium ruby in color and displays expressive fruit aromas of dark cherry, truffle, espresso, dried cherries and incense. The palate is bright and full of cherry cola fruit with vanilla and oak undertones and a wonderful velvety texture. The finish on this Pinot is very long and detailed with softness and notes of maraschino cherry and oriental spice.

Name: 1000 Stories Bourbon Barrel Aged Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Batch #004 is the first release of the 2014 vintage and once againMendocino Zinfandel plays a big role in the blend with classic oldvineyards such as Sargentini and Rucker vineyards. Head trained and dry farmed, these vineyards give nice raspberry fruits. Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel also makes a big impact on the blend in Batch #004. Dry Creek is a classic and well known source for great Zinfandel and has added a new dimension to the 1000 Stories blend. Black fruits with distinct notes of black pepper and even a bit of clove spice add complexity to the blend. Also new to this batch is the addition of Lodi Zinfandel, with its iconic bold flavors and big character. Rounding out the blend are some Zinfandels from Colusa County, Syrah from Paso Robles and Petite sirah from Mendocino. A portion of the wine is aged in French and American oak for 6 months and then aged further in bourbon barrels. WeåÕve selected new and used bourbon barrels for these small batches of Zinfandel, which impart characteristics specific to these barrels: charred vanilla, dried herbs and a hint of caramel.

Name: Cune Gran Reserva Rioja
Review: "This generous red shows a traditional character, with leafy, dried herb, tea and spice notes framing dried cherry, licorice and leather flavors. Firm tannins and balsamic acidity impart structure, and this shows plenty of depth, with a juicy, spicy finish. Drink now through 2025."

Name: Jaboulet Petite Chapelle Hermitage
Review: "Heady aromas of black and blue fruits, Indianspices and candied flowers. Stains the palate with intense cassis and blueberry flavors, picking suave floral and spice nuances with air. Shows excellent clarity and energy on the finish, which features smoothly integrated tannins and a seductive floral quality."

column1: This Tuscan bargain is a gem. Fresh raspberry <!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->and blackberry flavors with hints of vanilla and spice in the bouquet. Medium body and silky tannins.

Name: Apothic Inferno
TastingNotes: This small batch wine has been aged for 60 days in whiskey barrels. Red and dark fruit flavors combine with layers of maple and spice, giving way to a long, clean finish.

Name: Domaine Lafage Narassa Red
Review: "Notes of cassis, toasted spice, chocolate and licorice all emerge from the 2015 Cotes du Roussillon Villages Lieu Dit La Narassa, which is 80% Grenache and 20% Syrah brought up in demi-muids. This hedonistic, downright sexy, ripe and layered beauty will drink nicely right out of the gate."

Name: Zenato Alanera
Review: "This is rich and layered with dark berries, chocolate and hints of hazelnuts. Full-bodied, yet bright and focused. Dusty texture. Drink now or hold."

Name: The Seeker Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Full of red fruit and spice, this delicious selection showcases Pinot NoiråÕs signature silky texture and food-friendliness. Sweet cherry fruit melds with earth and spice, balanced acidity and ripe fine tannin, giving a long, smooth finish.

Name: Farnetella Lucilla Toscana Rosso
Review: "A ripe and decadent nose with licorice, sliced mushrooms and blackberries too. The palate is really savory with a tantalizing salty note that really lifts it up. Precise and linear. Beautiful austerity on the finish. Drink now."

Name: High Valley Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Fresh and vibrant with lemon-lime, melon, orange and nectarine flavors that give way to a hint of pineapple on a finish of tremendous depth and citrus-driven acidity."

Name: Hewitson Miss Harry Red Blend
Review: "Grenache, shiraz, mourvedre, carignan and cinsaultfrom very old and younger vineyards, the components partially co-fermented and soon blended to protect the vibrantly and supple mouthfeel the wine always has. The tannins are ultra-fine, the finish long and fresh."

Name: Dark Horse Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Bright grapefruit acidity, fresh green notes and crisp citrus flavor with a refreshing, clean finish. There is a delicate balance of fruit and acidity that might otherwise be lost during the aging process.

Name: Tapiz Alta Collection Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This is a fantastic wine for the vintage with a clarity and brightness on the nose and palate. Medium to full body, firm and silky tannins and a delicious finish. 2015 was a tough year for Argentina but this is a beautiful wine. Drink now."

Name: Best's Great Western Shiraz
Review: "A wealth of fragrant raspberries, red plums and peppery, cool-climate shiraz characters sit for all to behold on the nose, and there's a handy earthy nuance, too. The palate's bathed in cool-climate blackberry and plum flavors as well as plenty of licorice and sarsaparilla. What great depth and the peppery finish and shimmery, glossy tannins hold long and flawless. Drink now through to 2024."

Name: Bodegas Ego Fuerza Red
