Review: "Cola, sassafras and clove notes frame a deep core of plum and currant fruit in this dense red. The texture is plush and polished, supported by well-integrated tannins and balsamic acidity. Monastrell and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2020."

Name: Arboleda Chardonnay
Review: "This has great freshness with pear, lemon and floral aromas and just a hint of toast. Sleek and elegant, but concentrated, with a long, polished, rather mineral finish. Drink or hold."

Name: Beckmen Cuvee le Bec
Review: "Leading off the reds and CaliforniaåÕs take ona quality Cotes du RhÌ«ne, the peppery, black and blue fruits and floral-scented 2014 Cuvee le Bec is plump, medium to full-bodied, rounded and beautifully textured on the palate. Drink it over the coming 2-4 years."

Name: Paxis Red Blend
Review: "This dark, structured wine, with its balanced blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz, is firm with tannins and dense berry fruits. Full in the mouth, it is a concentrated wine that brings out a strongly chalky texture. The wine is still moving towards a rich future. Drink from 2017."

Name: Tilia Uxmal Malbec
Review: "Produced at Bodegas Esmeralda, one of the Catena familyåÕs oldest wineries. Winemaker Leopoldo Kuschnaroff exemplifies the true varietal character of Malbec from Mendoza. Aromas of black cherries and plums lead to a rich, full-bodied palate with flavors of juicy blackberries, with notes of vanilla and sweet spice. Excellent Value!"

Name: Smith & Hook Proprietary Red
TastingNotes: Opulent aromas of blackberry and cherry, accompanied by vanilla and toasted oak. The refined yet robust palate is full bodied, lush and structured with layers of black fruit and toasted oak.
Review: "A big, strapping red, with ripe dark fruit flavorsthat are filled with Asian spice accents.Features hot stone notes midpalate and a complex finish that shows dark chocolate andforest floor details. Merlot, Malbec, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon."

Name: Line 39 Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Vibrant aromas of grapefruit, lemon citrus, subtle grassy characters, crisp clean finish.

Name: Line 39 Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Delicate aromas of strawberries, rich raspberry and cherry flavors, supple tannins.

Name: Elio Perrone Tasmorcan Barbera
TastingNotes: Elio Perrone Tasmorcan Barbera d'Asti is ruby red in color. It offers a delightful nose of red berries, cherries, violets and French oak. Medium in body with perfect acidity and soft tannins, it offers intense flavors of raspberries, cherries, vanilla and spice. It is long, ripe and polished on the finish.
Review: "An effusive version showing off plenty of toast, vanilla, chocolate and blackberry flavors, with fine tannins, this should be better once the oak is absorbed. Drink now through 2020. 4,000 cases made."

Name: Aeris Pinot Noir
Review: "Yet another standout by winemaker Sarah Cabot. Enticing aromas of red berries, cherry cola and a touch of sweet oak appear on the nose. Slightly darker fruit is present on the palate with some notes of strawberry and subtle hints of violet. Sophisticated and well balanced."

Name: Patz & Hall Sonoma Coast Chardonnay
TastingNotes: The core of this Chardonnay is from SanchiettiVineyard Pleasant Hill and GapåÕs Crown, with the Sanchietti fruit adding richness and texture and the GapåÕs Crown grapes providing minerality and vibrant acidity. Blended with grapes from acclaimed vineyards like Parmalee Hill, Dutton Ranch and Durell Vineyard, this wine is beautifully complex with aromas and flavors of pineapple, guava, honeydew and lime zest, as well as secondary notes of toasted almond macaroon, cinnamon and sugar cookies. On the palate, it is plush and mouthfilling, flowing to a long, layered finish.
Review: "Rich and brooding with intensely perfumed oak, this is a layered white made from grapes grown throughout the appellation. It delivers medium-bodied weight and grip, with lush apple and gingersnap flavors."

Name: 152 Pinot Grigio
TastingNotes: Clear bright golden silver straw color. Citrusy aromas and flavors of lime spritzed peaches, powdered sugar, and cantaloupe with a supple, vibrant, fruity light-to-medium body and a smooth, delightful, medium-length nutskin, hint of spice, and mango finish. A vibrant, lively pinot grigio that will compliment a meal nicely.

Name: Colonia Las Liebres Bonarda
Review: "An unusually ripe Bonarda with plenty of blackberries and a generous tannin structure that lacks the rusticity thatåÕs normal for the grape. Rather long, positively dry finish. Drink or hold."

Name: Daou Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: A rich and compelling nose of black currant, ripe Bing cherries and smoky, toasty oak is redolent of warm cherry pie and blackberry cobbler. Behind the very forward dark fruits lie notes of black olive, licorice, creme de menthe, crushed stone and just a hint of ground espresso bean. On the palate is a veritable explosion of fresh fruit flavors, plump, voluptuous and pure. Blackberry, plum and cherry, and even nuances of pomegranate and cranberry. A steely, dusty minerality underlies this solid fruit core, latent power obscured by an oh-so silky texture. A firm handshake in a velvet glove. An amazing finish that replays the currant and black cherry layers interspersed with herbs and sandalwood that just wonåÕt let go. It is in this finish where the power and purity of this wine is proven.
Review: "(50% new French oak): Opaque ruby. Dark berries, fruitcake, toasty oak and a hint of vanilla on the deeply perfumed nose. Coats the palate with sweet black and blue fruit, mocha and floral pastille flavors. Zesty spice and mineral notes add lift and back-end cut. Fleshy and deep but lively as well, showing impressive clarity and youthful tannins on a very long, spice-tinged finish."

Name: Domaine Gueneau Sancerre Rouge
TastingNotes: With its fruitiness and its structure, this red Sancerre goes very well with white or red, roasted or grilled meats.

Name: Domus Aurea Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon Domus Aurea showed a penetrating nose with plenty of aromatic herbs, dried flowers, pollen and spices with a brightness of fruit that sets it apart from the rest of Cabernet from Maipo. The vineyard has some 4% Cabernet Franc intermixed in the old vineyard (planted in 1970) that is used for this wine. It's very balsamic and with a tasty palate with abundant, fine-grained tannins with the classical Cabernet texture. This is always balanced and elegant, quite traditional and expressing the place from which it comes."

Name: Line 39 Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: This Cabernet Sauvignon exhibits rich fruit flavors of currant, blackberry, and ripe plum with hints of black tea on the palate. The wine finishes with subtle, smooth tannins that donåÕt overpower this easy-to-drink Cab.

Name: Atalon Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc is lively, and bright with aromas of citrus blossom, grapefruit and lemongrass. It's intense flavor bursts with refreshing fruit on the palate. White peach, grapefruit, and tropical fruit notes are followed by balanced minerality that is complemented by a long, rich finish.

Name: Escarlata Red Blend
Review: "Made by Xavier Chone, who works with top wineries like Opus One, Joseph Phelps, and Dominus. A smooth, full-bodied blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Carmenere and Malbec. Notes of blackberry and spice give way to a silky mouth feel with a light touch of oak, round tannins and bright acidity."

Name: Sanama Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Medium-bodied with aromas of cherry and raspberry, accompanied by notes of chocolate and almond. On the palate, this well priced Reserva is juicy and lush, with soft and round tannins.

Name: Kermit Lynch Cotes du Rhone Cypress

column1: Bright. Crisp. Exotic.
Extended time on the v<!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->ine creates an unrestrained flavor profile of bright rich flavors.

Name: Astrolabe Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: Pale straw with green highlights. Lemon grass,lime peel and elderflower, with background notes of white currant and red pepper. Medium-bodied with white peach, gooseberry and citrus flavours, and a dry mineral finish.
Review: "Bright, fresh and concentrated sauvignon blanc with punchy regional and varietal flavours including capsicum, nettle, gooseberry, melon and subtle passionfruit. A deliciously accessible wine that delivers everything I expect from Marlborough Sauvignon åÉ and more."

Name: Anjos Vinho Verde Rose
TastingNotes: Lively strawberry and red currant flavor complemented with floral hints reveal the exuberance of the aromas. In the mouth it is well balanced with good acidity and fresh fruit notes. Young and crisp, it boasts with a smooth, delicate finish.

Name: Marietta Game Trail Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Coastal influence, warm days and rocky hillsides combine to create a Cabernet Sauvignon with extraordinary intensity and clarity. Wild boar, deer and mountain lion create game trails that encircle the vineyard and guide the winemakers into the woods while hunting wild Porcini and Chanterelle mushrooms.
Review: "An addition to the range, the Game Trail is 100% Cabernet from the Bilbro family's ranch in the Yorkville Highlands. Dark red stone fruit, rose petal, mint, floral notes and spice are beautifully delineated. Intensely aromatic and pungent, but with no green edges, the 2014 offers tons of personality and character. Beams of mountain tannin add energy throughout. I would give the 2014 at least a year or two in bottle, as the tannins are imposing at this stage."

Name: 19 Crimes The Banished Red
TastingNotes: A blend that is brooding with richness. Like the wine rations served on convict ships, every sip deserves to be savored.

Name: Julia James Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Ripe lemon in color, this Chardonnay has golden highlights in the glass. Offers a mix of fresh pear, apple, melon and citrus on the nose. There is a bright, juicy, almost racy personality to go with exotic flavors of tropical fruits, vanilla, nectarine, and a hint of oak. Continuing to open up nicely in the glass, it has a creamy mid-palate and a clean, crisp finish.

Name: Charlet Beaujolais Villages
TastingNotes: A vibrant fruit packed Beaujolais from the superior Villages appellation with a fresh violets and mineral scented bouquet, ripe cherry flavours and hint of pepper. It is well balanced with generous red fruits and a supple fresh acidity on the finish.

Name: Block 831 Chalk Hill Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Expressive aromas of crushed blackberry & currant notes linger with a touch of herbs. Fairly concentrated on the palate, the rich dark fruit is supported by well-defined tannins, finishing long with some leather and a touch of oak."

Name: Butter Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Butter brims with stone fruit and baked-lemon notes and has a lovely, long, vanilla finish. Simply put, it melts in your mouth!

Name: Chateau Malbec Bordeaux
Review: "Black licorice, leather and stewed blackberries are noticeable on the complex nose.  The intrigue continues on the palate, with blueberry compote, tobacco, black currant and leather forming nuanced layers.  Subtle oak."

Name: Rombauer Sauvignon Blanc
TastingNotes: This wine is brilliant pale yellow with a bright green hue. It exudes aromas of ripe lime and lemon, grapefruit, pear and white nectarine with a hint of fresh-cut grass. The palate is fresh and enticing, as grapefruit, white nectarine and passion fruit intertwine with Meyer lemon and lime, making the mouth water. Balanced yet lively acidity lingers on the palate inviting another taste. Boxwood on the finish gives the wine length and vibrant freshness.

Name: Zorzal Grand Terrior Malbec
Review: "Full ruby-red. Expressive aromas of blackberry, black cherry, licorice and bitter chocolate complicated by violet and a light feral note. Juicy, intense red and darker berry fruit flavors are lifted by notes of spices and crushed chalk. I did not taste this wine next to the 2016 version (which I sampled in Uco Valley), but this is clearly a fuller, plusher, somewhat sweeter style, showing a fine-grained texture, very broad tannins and superb fruit persistence. This may ultimately be less floral and penetrating than the young '16 and perhaps not quite as long but it hardly lacks for energy. And it will give more pleasure over the next few years."

Name: Encore Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Opens with aromas of cherry and cocoa, followed by flavors of plum and soft toasty oak. The Elegant mid-palate tannins earn ovation through the last sip.
Review: "Elegant and balanced yet deep and rich, showing supple-textured fruit flavors of raspberry, plum, wild berry and black cherry. This Pinot Noir has a structured finish with depth, dimension and a touch of spice."

Name: Chateau d'Yquem Sauternes 2006
Review: "This has lovely flavors of apricot, dried tangerine, pineapple and papaya rushing along, supported by hazelnut, frangipane and coconut notes. Despite the depth, it's very, very pure, with filigreed acidity carrying the long, long finish. Drink now through 2037."

Name: Vasse Felix Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Pale straw in color with a green tinge. Elegant, fine and complex perfume with vibrant fruit fragrances of pineapple, white peach and delicate fruit ginger and wild mushroom nuances beneath. Yeast and fine oak contribute exciting layers of smoked charcuterie, spicy clove and stone flint. The palate is bright, fresh and luscious with white peach and mushroom notes and a fine-tuned structure integrating the wine's mouth-watering acidity, fruit and oak. Its seamless, suspended palate finishes with a delicate citrus flower note.

Name: Tonel 46 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The textbook 2014 Tonel 46 Cabernet Sauvignon fermented in cement vats and matured in well-seasoned, neutral oak barrels for about one year before being bottled. All the tobacco leaves, blackberries and cedar wood aromas are there, with good ripeness but without excess. The palate has fine tannins and good freshness, focused, clean flavors and a good finish."

Name: Norfolk Rise Shiraz
TastingNotes: Vibrant magenta red. A vibrant nose of pepper with florals, liquorice and spice. A palate of red fruits with black pepper, vanilla and chocolaty almond husk. Soft tannins, dark fruit and chocolaty oak.
Review: The Norfolk Rise Shiraz, coming from the MountBenson sub-appellation in the Limestone Coast, is distinctive and aromatic, showing fresh black pepper, plum, blackberry and tobacco.  The palate is rich with blackberry and hints of cracked pepper with a solid backbone of grainy tannins and refreshing acidity. Built like a wine 2x the price!!"

Name: Chateau Saint Roch Vieilles Vignes Blanc
Review: "The 2016 CÌ«tes du Roussillon Vieilles Vignes Blancis a beauty. Made from Grenache Blanc and Roussanne, this medium-bodied, deliciously crisp and racy white offers lots of citrus and lime characteristics, a hint of minerality and bright acidity."

Name: Barville Cotes du Rhone Blanc
Review: "Sauve, mineral accented orchard fruits, honeysuckle and jasmine flower on the aromatic nose. Loads of texture and richness with pear, melon and green apple flavors finish refreshing and mouthwatering. Excellent acidity for the vintage."

Name: Fly By Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Clean, crisp and lively with intense flavors of grapefruit, tangerine, peach and lemon. Light and refreshing all the way through the finish."

Name: Shaw & Smith Shiraz
Review: "From central and southern (the latter warmer) parts of the Adelaide Hills, hand-picked, part destemmed, part whole bunch, open-fermented with gentle plunging. The color is bright, the bouquet full of red fruits, darker fruit notes and delicious pepper and spice nuances. These characters flow through to the medium-bodied palate of Shaw + Smith's most consistently outstanding wine, the '15 vintage making it seem so easy."

Name: Dark Horse Double Down Red Blend
TastingNotes: California-Double Down combines notes of lush blackberry fruit, toasted oak and warm brown spice, creating a bold and complex wine that is sure to crush expectations. Its varietal content is a blend of Petite Syrah, Zinfandel, Tannat and Teroldego.

Name: Bousquet Cameleon Chardonnay
Review: "ThereåÕs a fresh-melon nose here with a thread of fresh, juicy stone fruit and melon. Drink now."

Name: Dog Point Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Vibrant red fruit, a perfume of violets with underlying savory notes of dried herbs. Richly flavored red fruit, bright spice, infused savoriness, well integrated oak, soft fleshy tannins.
Review: "Impressive structure and concentration. Terrific complexity in the mix here, too. Blueberries and mixed cherries on the nose and palate with a terrific layering of plush, assertive tannins and a fresh, vibrant kick into the finish. Drink or hold."

column1: Bright and juicy Syrah from limestone laden te<!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->rraces. Fresh blue and red fruit supported by lively acid and a hint of market spices.

Name: Chateau Bois Malot Bordeaux Blanc
Review: "Ripe and soft with a smooth, creamy texture and a perfumed backdrop. It is ready to drink, full of good acidity and with a tangy, zesty texture. The aftertaste keeps that attractive perfumed character."

Name: Santa Isle Grand Reserve Pinot Noir

column1: Bright ruby red in color. In the nose ripe bla<!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->ck plums with hints of lavender. Soft forest fruit and plum flavors with a long spicy cinnamon finish.

Name: "Modern style, full-bodied Pinot Noir. Floral aromas are met with notes of black cherry and raspberries with silky tannins and balanced, lifting acidity. Excellent balance of new oak and tannins. Outstanding for the price!"
La Spinetta Nebbiolo
TastingNotes: Typical light red of Nebbiolo with aromas of driedrose petals and dark fruits such as plums and blueberry. Full bodied, chewy and rich with dusty tannins and a juicy yet elegant finish.

Name: Gnarly Head 1924 Double Black Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Just Released! An ample amount of concentrated dark fruits are obvious from the start. Black cherry, dark plum, blackberry and sweet currant flavors burst on the palate and are followed by a hint of spice on a silky long finish."

Name: Villa San Juliette Chorum Red Blend
TastingNotes: The 2014 Chorum Red is lush with vibrant aromatics and flavors that combine in a sumptuous medley. Plum, blackberry, and cedar aromas mingle with jam and espresso notes. Rich on the palate, this wine bursts with flavors of boysenberry, black cherry, and sarsaparilla. A blend of American and French oak barrel ageing helped soften the tannins, which are long, silky, and anchored by lively acidity.
Review: "Sweet herb aromas of oregano and tarragon mesh with exotic mulberry, plum and Luxardo cherry on the nose of this blend of 32% Syrah, 16% Grenache, 14% Petit Verdot, 12% Cabernet Franc, 12% Alicante Bouschet, 7% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Petite Sirah. That herbal intensity carries into the palate, where minty flavors decorate the background of plum fruit."

Name: Feudo Montoni Nero d'Avola Lagnusa
Review: "Dark red. Perfumed aromas of red/black cherry, quinine, minerals and cocoa. Fresh and juicy but also very dense with tactile flavors of wet stones, spicy herbs and red cherry that linger impressively on the refined, mineral-accented finish. An outstanding wine that will only get better with a couple of years in the cellar, though itåÕs not meant to be a long term keeper."

Name: Tensley Santa Barbara Syrah
Review: "A finished barrel sample, the 2018 Syrah Santa Barbara County has a deep purple-black color and gregarious nose of gravel dust, cherry coulis, warm blueberries and loads of red fruit sparks with slowly opening nuances of cocoa, prosciutto and loads of exotic spices. It's full-bodied, dense and powerful, flooding the mouth with lush, ripe fruits and with a frame of firm, grainy tannins and great freshness, finishing very long. This is a beast!"

Name: Tarima Hill Old Vines Red
Review: "This bold red is intense and expressive. Cassis and blueberry flavors mingle with cola, cocoa and licorice notes. Chewy tannins and balsamic acidity amplify the impact. Heady, ripe and in the modern style. Monastrell. Drink now through 2024."

Name: Resonance Willamette Valley Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Nice intense and bright color. The nose is very fruity, with both red and black fruit, and has delicate spicesåÑlicorice and cinnamonåÑand floral notes. The palate reveals a balanced wine, with an excellent freshness enhanced by lacy minerality and the delicate flavors of cherries, blackberries, and raspberries.
Review: "Precise and impressively structured, with refined raspberry, crushed rock and savory tea accents that take on richness and depth toward polished tannins. Drink now through 2024."

Name: Andretta Brunello di Montalcino
Review: "This is a young Brunello with so much structure and intensity. Full body, powerful and beautiful. I am impressed with the compression and power. A classic style. Needs two or three years to open but gorgeous now."

Name: Gianfranco Alessandria Barolo
Review: "Here is a tonic, fresh and energized Barolo from Monforte d'Alba. Gianfranco Alessandria's 2013 Barolo is a pleasure to drink, and it will undoubtedly continue to offer that vibrant drinking pleasure for many more years to come. The wine achieves elegance and balance with dark fruit, rose hip, tar and licorice. Silky but firm tannins tie it tightly together."

column1: Aromas of bright citrus and nectarine bursting<!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->with crisp flavors of honeydew melon and green Granny Smith apple.

Name: "This widely available and affordably priced Sauvignon Blanc is light in the glass, disclosing crisp lime, grass, wet cement and white-flower bud aromas. There is tons of sizzle to the palate, where Key and kaffir-lime flavors accent the grass and ripe pear elements. Best Buy"
19 Crimes Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Bold and strong in character, this deep rich and golden Chardonnay is filled with stone fruit aromas and a sweet textured palate. The criminally intense toasty oak notes have hints of butterscotch and honey balanced with layers of ripe fruit. This full bodied, powerful wine finishes with rich notes of butter and vanilla.

Name: Barville Chateauneuf du Pape
Review: "Rock-solid, with the ripe and racy profile of the vintage letting the raspberry and black cherry fruit sail through, laced with light anise, black tea and mineral notes. A silky and refined display of depth. Drink now through 2030."

Name: Neveu Sancerre Embouffants
Review: "Mouthwatering aromas of jasmine and citrus lead to stony mineral notes enveloped in pure, lemon and white grapefruit flavors.   Pure and delicious Sauvignon Blanc from its favorite place."

Name: Giapoza Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Enticing aromas of rose water, orange peel, cranberry, and mission fig, framed with a clean and steely minerality. On the palate, the wine is juicy and weighty with smooth tannins wrapped around flavors of ripe strawberry, milk chocolate, and cinnamon.

Name: Alchemist Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: To make this carefully crafted Pinot Noir, they source fruit from their favorite parts of their partnersåÕ vineyards, drawing and blending from the beautiful palette of the Willamette Valley to create a refined and intensely vibrant wine, rich with red berry fruits. This is a wine for elevating everyday moments to the realm of a
Review: "Fresh and vibrant, with floral raspberry and cinnamon aromas and crisp yet plush spiced cherry flavors that linger. Drink now through 2022."

Name: Campomaggio Chianti Classico Riserva
Review: "Aromas of dark plums and black cherries with hintsof milk chocolate. Full body, firm tannins and a rich, linear finish. Try in 2020 when the tannins are better integrated."

Name: Kendall Jackson Rose
TastingNotes: A gorgeous hue of pale pink, jumps out of the glass with crips grapefruit, strawberry and white floral notes. Aromas of fresh cut watermelon, hibiscus, and apricot.

Name: Postales Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Intense red color with violet hints. Red ripe fruit and plum jam aroma. Fruity taste, gentle, well bodied, with soft tannins. Balanced finish on the palate.

Name: Castano Alcaria
Review: "One of the new custom cuvÌ©es for their U.S. importer Eric Solomon is the 2016 Alcaria, which is about to be launched. It's a GSM-ish blend of 60% Monastrell with 25% Syrah and the remaining Garnacha Tintorera with a short time in French and American oak barriques. It's a little reduced right now after bottling (most probably because of the Syrah), so you might need to give it an energetic decanting or some more time in bottle. The meat component in many wines in this region is part of the signature and the rustic elegance of these wines. There is no reduction in the palate, where the tannins are fine-grained and there's good balance."

Name: G.D. Vajra Albe Barolo
Review: "Aromas of rose, crushed mint, red berry and dark spice mingle together with an earthy whiff of leather on this fragrant Barolo. The vibrant, almost ethereal palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, star anise and an almost salty note alongside taut, polished tannins and racy acidity."

Name: Colossal Reserva Red
Review: "Creamy, with plentiful ripe raspberry, red plum and milk chocolate flavors, this medium to full-bodied red is marked by spice and mineral details through the velvety finish."

Name: Roco Gravel Road Pinot Noir
Review: "Lithe and expressive, featuring an elegantly layered structure, accented by raspberry, rose petal and orange peel flavors that glide on the long finish. Drink now through 2025."

Name: Chateau Toutigeac White Bordeaux
Review: "Full ripeness and a rich texture promise much for this delicious wine. Its acidity plays a good supporting role for the ripe apricot and pear fruits with their touch of tangy edge. This well-made wine will age. Drink ideally from late 2018."

Name: Ayres Willamette Pinot Noir
Review: "Dark, bright-rimmed red. Ripe cherry andblackberry aromas, complicated by suggestions ofcandied licorice and cola. Smooth and broad in themouth, offering gently sweet dark berry and cherryliqueur flavors and a touch of spiciness on the backhalf. In a plush, fruit-forward style, showing solidthrust and rounded tannins on the long, subtly smoky finish."

Name: Bird In Hand Sparkling Rose
Review: "Vivid pink in color with a hint of orange.  Strawberry and tangerine scents jump from the glass with a touch of underlying spice.  This sparkler really opens upåÉjuicy and focused showing cherry and berry flavors with a firm, long finish."

Name: Tait Border Crossing Shiraz
Review: "I'm not sure what it says about a Barossa winery when its most striking wine (out of the three provided by the U.S. importer) is a McLaren Vale Shiraz. Tait's 2015 The Border Crossing Shiraz fits right into the house style of full-on ripeness and opulence, but it changes up the fruit profile to yield something brighter, fresher and loaded with cherry and red-berry fruit. Full-bodied, creamy and supple across the mid-palate, with a long, silky-tart finish, it's a fine but different complement to the super bargains delivered by this Barossa-based producer."

Name: Bleasdale Broadside Red
TastingNotes: The great Australian blend of Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon with a touch of Malbec. The wine displays plum and blackcurrant, chocolate and boysenberry spice from the harmonious blend of these varieties. A juicy palate with persistent flavor and smooth velvety tannins.
Review: "(aged in French and American oak barrels of various size, 10% of them new): Glass-staining ruby. Ripe cherry and blackberry aromas show very good energy and an enlivening jolt of peppery spices. Plush and seamless on the palate, conveying real power to its black and blue fruit, lavender pastille and white pepper flavors. Finishes broad and fleshy, with repeating spiciness, velvety tannins and strong persistence. This wine has the balance to reward patience but is also pretty appealing right now."

Name: Altocedro Ano Cero Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Blackcurrants, balsam, red plums, cedar, nutmeg and conifer. Full to medium body, grainy tannins, fresh acidity and a flavorful finish. Drink now."

Name: Altocedro La Consulta Select Red Blend
Review: "Floral and fruity with cherry and dried-strawberry aromas that follow throughto a full body, firm and silky tanninsand great brightness and focus. Ablend of Malbec, Cab Sauv,Tempranillo and Syrah. Very pretty."

Name: Piattelli Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Shows good heft to the ripe and rich-tasting dark fruit flavors, featuring peppery hints. The finish is plush and redolent of Asian spice and chocolate notes, with dried savory herb details in the mix. Drink now through 2022."

Name: Chateau de Ribebon Bordeaux
Review: "Lots of ripe-berry and currant character with licorice and graphite. Full-bodied, round and chewy with lots of fruit. It shows beautiful intensity on the finish for this appellation."

Name: Raeburn Russian River Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Brilliant crimson in color, Raeburn Russian River Valley Pinot Noir leads with a pleasing aroma of baking spice and vanilla. The palate is marked with stunning fruit flavors of lush wild blueberry, raspberry, and blackberry with undertones of roasted hazelnut. The finish is graceful and sophisticated.

Name: Vina Zorzal Malayeto
Review: "The single-vineyard Garnacha 2016 Malayeto comes from 2.39 hectares of vines averaging 35 years of age in the village of Fitero at 520 meters in altitude on limestone soils. It's a bright ruby colored red, wine with tons of spices, herbs, flowers, notes of bay leaf, thyme and a bright personality. It has a light to medium-bodied palate with unnoticeable oak (it matured in well-seasoned, neutral oak foudres and barrels), with complex stone minerality, a dry and long finish. This is really delicious and a very good value, possibly the freshest of the six Garnachas I tasted from them. Some 12,000 bottles were filled in March 2018. This is a real bargain, one to buy by the case."

Name: Dos Almas Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This has a very bright, upbeat array of fresh cassis and yellow-fleshed plums with a smoothly balanced palate that carries plenty of fresh, fine tannins."

Name: Dos Almas Grand Reserve Carmenere
TastingNotes: Deep cherry red with garnet notes. Intense andalluring, with highlights of black and red fruit aromas such as blueberry, blackberry, groseilles, strawberries and cherries. Spicy and earthy notes blend harmoniously with lashings of chocolate and vanilla as well as a pleasant balsamic note. The rich structure stands out with balanced body and big velvety tannins that give greater volume to the wine. A clean and elegant finish.
Review: "Simple cassis fruits and greener herbal notes here. A soft, plush and smooth palate packed with flavors of fresh blueberries and plums. Screw cap. Drink now."

Name: Dos Almas Grand Reserve Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Deep ruby red with violet hues. Fruity boquet with notes of cherry and red berries such as strawberries and raspberries, intertwined with soft spicy notes and a touch of vanilla from the French oak ageing. Delicate body with good acidity and smooth tannins, adding freshness and a silky texture. Good length, again showing notes of red fruits, vanilla and spices.
Review: "A lighter yet elegant style, offering pretty summer fruits with a dose of earthy notes. Engaging and wonderfully moreish."

Name: Dos Almas Grand Reserve Red Blend
TastingNotes: Deep ruby red. Intense bouquet of black and red fruits, blackberry preserve and bright spicy notes. Abundant fruit flavours of blackberries and red berries, with a perfectly balanced structure and smooth tannins. Balanced in body with a persistent finish leaving notes of spices, chocolate and vanilla.
Review: "A bold array of fresh red and dark berries, leading to a palate that has a smoothly arranged, layered and fresh mouthfeel with lighter tannins. Approachable now."

Name: Intrinsic Red Blend
TastingNotes: This wine opens with refined notes of raspberry, white tea leaves, a hint of fresh mint and lavender. The flavors are layered with milk chocolate, fig reduction, dark plum and licorice root, and the texture is angular, yet sophisticated, with chocolate ganache details in the finish.
Review: "This is a phenomenal wine with blackberry and blueberry character as well as black olives. Flamboyant and sexy. Blows your mind. Full body and pure fruit. No wood, no make up. Skin-contact wine made in stainless. Nine months on the skins. Groundbreaking. Naked great wine! Blend of 52% cabernet franc, 44% malbec, 3% cabernet sauvignon and 1% merlot. Drink now"

Name: Mocali Brunello di Montalcino
TastingNotes: Aromas of raspberry and cherry, backed up by notes of mint, earthy spice, and chocolate. Medium-bodied on the palate with the perfect mix of sweet fruit notes and ripe tannins.
Review: "The 2013 Brunello di Montalcino is a dark andsavory expression of Sangiovese from one of the most beautiful corners of Tuscany. This is a dark and velvety wine that is packed tight with black fruit flavors, spice and tobacco. It shows texture in the mouth and firm grip that reveals some astringency that still needs to be absorbed and softened with cellar aging."

Name: Uccelliera Brunello di Montalcino
TastingNotes: Elegant and well-balanced, powerful, clean andsmooth.
Review: "This is exotic yet chilled with a red fruit character overlaid with fresh flowers on the nose. Smoky. Medium to full body, firm yet lightly polished. Lovely fruit and subtly refined. Layered. Extremely fine and pretty. Better in 2019."

Name: Beringer Brother's Bourbon Barrel Aged Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: This wine is bursting with aromas of ripe black cherry, dark chocolate, and vanilla. The palate is lush with ripe tannins and and integrated acidity, showcasing toasted hazelnuts, toffee, and blackberry preserves on the finish.

Name: Beringer Brothers Bourbon Barrel Red Blend
TastingNotes: This wine is bursting with aromas of ripe blackberries, roasted hazelnuts, and caramel. With intense concentration bolstered by Petit Verdot, this full-bodied wine has a creamy mouthfeel with ripe tannins and integrated acidity. The lingering finish boasts notes of toasted coconut, violet, and black cherry.

Name: Capraia Gran Selezione #55
Review: "The 2014 Chianti Classico Gran Selezione Effe 55 is another fabulous wine from Capraia. Deep, layered and also vertical in its expression of structure, the Effe 55 is a Gran Selezione that is truly grand. The purity of the flavors and textures is positively dazzling. This deep, beautifully resonant Chianti Classico needs time to fully emerge, but it is positively stellar."

Name: Capraia Chianti Classico Riserva
Review: "Deep and pliant on the palate, with gorgeous supporting structure, the 2013 is wonderfully complete. Black cherry, plum and lavender are some of the many nuances that develop. Above all else, though, the 2013 is impeccably balanced and pedigreed to the core. I loved it."

Name: Sabeo Rueda Verdejo
TastingNotes: A 100% Verdejo wine, this white wine has a beautiful nose of white blossoms and papaya. The chalky soil of Rueda, known for white wine production, delivers a crisp, mineral-like palate with lemon and bright apple notes. Finishes dry with jasmine qualities. The balance of fruit and acidity is sure to enjoy a hot summer night on the patio with light fare.

Name: Sabeo Albarino
TastingNotes: AlbariÌ±o grapes are grown in Rias Baixes, the northwestern region of Spain, north of Portugal, and bordering the Atlantic Ocean. The maritime climate contributes to a very dry acidic wine with herbs and tropical fruit on the nose and peach and lemon zest on the palate. Very dense in the mouth and aftertaste with citrus and exotic touches.

column1: Notes of red fruit and toasted oak combine wit<!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->h hints of cold brew for well-balanced blend that captivates you from the first pour.

Name: Emancipation Red
TastingNotes: This wine is smooth, bright and juicy, yet delicate and refined. Bright red cherry on the front of the palate leads to a briary herbaceous quality on the finish. This blend is palate coating, with a long, lingering finish and structure to pair well with rich foods.
Review: "A blend mainly of Grenache and Syrah with some Petite Sirah, MourvÌ¬dre and Mission coming mostly from Paso Robles and Mendocino, the 2015 Emancipation Red has a pale to medium ruby-purple color and sexy, provocative nose of kirsch, raspberry tart and dried roses with touches of Chinese five spice, cracked pepper, sandalwood and earth. Medium to full-bodied, it delivers mouth-filling red berry preserves and spice box flavors with silken tannins and lovely freshness, finishing long and perfumed. Drink: 2017-2024."

Name: Gramercy Lower East Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The aromas are locked up out of the gate, displaying notes of gravel, raspberry, graphite, vanilla and blackberry. The palate brings firm, lightly grainy tannins that seem unresolved at first but soften a bit with significant time open. There are good things going on, but they need to make their way to the surface. Give it a very long decant if opening in the near term. It has beyond impressive staying power for a wine at this price."

Name: Fondreche Ventoux Rouge
Review: "The glass-staining 2016 Ventoux Rouge, a blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 20% MourvÌ¬dre, boasts knockout aromas of black cherries and blueberries. It's a medium to full-bodied wine, creamy-supple in texture even at this embryonic stage, with hints of dried herbs and baking spices adding complexity. If this quality is reflected in the bottle it should be a screaming value."

Name: Pot de Vin Pay d'Oc Merlot
TastingNotes: Nearly opaque ruby black color. Aromas and flavors of blackberries and black plums, planked cedar, and potters clay with a tangy, dry full body and an elegant, breezy finish with earthy, woody tannins and moderate oak. Lovely integration of subtle oak with the fruity and earthy aspects of this wine.

Name: Bacchus Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Medium bodied with ripe plum, black currant, and blackberry flavors with a touch of mint. Cedar and dusty earth emerge on the long, layered finish.

Name: Capraia Chianti Classico
Review: "A fine and firm red with dark berries, black cherries and lemon undertones. Medium body, fine tannins and a fresh finish. Energetic and tight."

Name: Castellani Chianti Classico Riserva
Review: "Blueberry cake, blackberry bush, dark chocolate and some treacle tart. Medium to full body, velvety tannins and a juicy finish. So enjoyable and silky."

Name: Aromas Das Castas Vinho Verde
TastingNotes: Quinta da Lixa's Aromas das Castas white wine is a harmonious blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura grape from Portugal's Vinho Verde sub-region of Moncao and Melgaco. The Alvarinho grape variety is one of the least productive in the world. Look for hints of stone fruits such as peaches. This variety also has notes of orange blossom, giving elegance and complexity to the whole. The Trajadura grape variety enhances the body and long finish, with fruity hints of pear. The perfect combination of two of the noblest grape varieties in the Vinho Verde Region.
Review: "At one point in our tasting cycle, our panel tasted a dozen 2016 Vinho Verdes and recommended three of them; all three were made by Quinta da Lixa, and all overdelivered at their price. This one is richly fruited, with notes of fresh peach and deeper tones of papaya. ItåÕs dry and flinty, a little briskness added by some CO2, refreshing and just dressy enough for a summer wedding."

Name: La Bete Noire Cahors
TastingNotes: 100% Malbec (which is significant because the vast majority of Cahors is cut with Merlot or Tannat). A powerful French "country" red from 30 year old vines grown in chalk-rich clay soils on a limestone substrate in the Lot Valley in Cahors, the ancestral home of the Malbec grape. Nicely full and tarry with mint highlights, terrific juiciness and no oak in sight. A huge value in a full-bodied red.

Name: Proemio Red Blend
Review: "Intense, cedary and spicy oak aromas and flavors have the first and last say here. There are attractive, ripe dark berries in between. A blend of malbec, cabernet sauvignon and petit verdot. Drink or hold."

Name: Casa Americo Reserva Red
Review: "Balanced, structured and full of concentrated boysenberry, cherry and red currant flavors, with some dried meat accents. Hints of curry show midpalate, leading to a finish that delivers notes of chocolate and cream."

Name: Clou de Pin Bordeaux Superior
TastingNotes: The nose shows a whiff of graphite and some rich black cherry fruit. Very supple and nicely fruit-driven in the mouth. The wine is balanced and round, extremely drinkable.

Name: Luna Single Vineyard Malbec
Review: "A firm and silky red with plum and cherry character. Medium body. Flavorful finish. Balanced and delicious."

Name: Garage Wine Company Lot #43 Cabernet Franc
Review: "Lifted and bright aromas of darkberries anddried flowers. Some greenolives. Full body, layered and flavorful.Hints of vanilla. A big and structuredred that needs two or three years tocome together. Drink in 2021."

Name: El Enemigo Chardonnay
Review: "A tight and beautiful white with a dense palate: beautiful, ripe lemons and apples. Layered and refined with phenolic tension. Complex yeast and hints of oak and flor. Full body. Great length. 80 per cent flor-growth in barrel. Drink now."

Name: Venus La Universal Dido Montsant
Review: "The red 2017 Dido shows a lot of aromas from the Syrah with some smoked bacon and violet aromas and always with contained ripeness, as it's planted on granite soils that take a long time to ripen. It has good complexity and great juiciness, with even more freshness than the already-phenomenal 2016. There are very fine tannins and the electric sensation from the granite soils. This is just amazing, one of the finest vintages for this bottling."

Name: Black Kite Soberanes Pinot Noir
Review: "Moving to the reds, the 2014 Pinot Noir Soberanes Vineyard is a medium-bodied, lively and pure effort that offers classy notes of black raspberries, toasted spice and sappy herbs. Drink this pretty, elegant Pinot over the coming 6-7 years."

Name: Urgency Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Excellent effort from Clay Shannon on his first release of this Cabernet! Supple and silky with detailed flavors of black cherry, currant, ripe plum and dusty berry picking up spice and light oak on a long, lingering fruit-propelled finish."

Name: Norfolk Rise Pinot Noir
Review: "The Norfolk Rise Pinot Noir coming from SouthAustraliaåÕs Limestone Coast boasts a nose of fresh red berries along with a touch of pine which leads to a juicy palate showing ripe, tangy strawberry and pomegranate flavors with a silky finish."

Name: Norfolk Rise Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "The Norfolk Rise Sauvignon Blanc, coming fromthe Mount Benson sub-appellation of the Limestone Coast, has aromas of grapefruit and apple with touches of orange peel and herbs.  Light to medium bodied, there is a good concentration of apple and citrus flavors with lively acidity and a long finish. Great alternative to New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc!"

Name: Calcu Reserva Especial Carmenere
Review: "A tight and fresh wine with linear fruit and tannins that give this wine focus and balance. Not the most complex Carmenere but very good."

Name: Cave L'Aurance Vintage Cremant
Review: "Fresh, vibrant and ripe pears and apple with a touch of toast are broad and inviting on the nose. The palate delivers a rich texture with an underlying mineral note to the ripe fruit flavors. Excellent length with a nice lemon tinged finish. Well done."

Name: La Cabriole Saumur Chenin Blanc
TastingNotes: Aromas of honey and honeysuckle can be found on the nose, on the palate it is light, dry and crisp, with well balanced acidity and a long lingering finish of quince, melon and honeydew.

Name: Buck Shack Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: This mountain top Cabernet boasts deep dark fruits with a complex and structured finish. Soft notes of chocolate and oak abound, balancing the dense plum and berry in perfect harmony

Name: Chapelle d'Alienor Bordeaux
Review: "Inviting aromas of dark fruit with orange peel andexcellent intensity and concentration. Medium bodied, with focused, grippy ripe dark fruit flavors. Round tannins and a delicious finish."

Name: Sutherland Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: This Pinot Noir was aged in French oak barrelsfor 9 months and shows pure strawberry fruit aromas and lovely perfumed spice and earthy characters on the nose. The wine is wonderfully balanced with a long, refined finish.
Review: "From Thelema Winery, coming from Elgin,one of the coolest regions in South Africa,this wine shows pure strawberry fruitaromas with a lovely perfumed forest floorcharacter, and hints of smoky spice. Brightberry fruit and spice on the palate, with along, refined finish."

Name: Santa Cortina Pinot Grigio
Review: "This nicely balanced, light to medium bodied wine starts with a beautiful floral nose and offers wonderful fruit flavors of apple, peach and citrus fruits with a crisp mineral and fruit finish."

Name: Baica Barricado Monastrell
Review: "Intense aromas of inky, leathery black fruits announce a full, saturated palate that's bolstered by tartaric acidity. Plum, blackberry, raw oak and salty flavors are chocolaty on a finish. Drink through 2019."

Name: Eradus Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "It's all Awatere Valley fruit, mostly from the estate, with a couple of blocks of purchased fruit from slightly inland. Grassy and leafy notes accent the ripe nectarine fruit on the nose, while the medium-bodied palate is concentrated and round, with pink grapefruit notes that linger harmoniously on the finish."

Name: Bird In Hand Rose
TastingNotes: Crispy, racy with plenty of juicy strawberry and cherry fruit character, but it delivers unexpected depth and complexity that take it from a good to great wine.
Review: "Very pale salmon color with a nose of fresh raspberries and strawberries. This is very reminiscent of the prestigious rose coming out of Provence. The palate is delicately fruited, crisp and lively with a nice burst of watermelon and strawberry leading to a long and focused finish. Superb!!"

Name: Nieto Benjamin Select Malbec
Review: "This Select Malbec hails from the Lujan de Cuyo sub-region of Mendoza where the warm days and cool nights produces a balanced and elegant wine. Aromas of ripe red fruit, plum and cola are met with soft tannins and a long finish. An excellent paring with burgers, steak and chicken off the grill."

Name: Ron Rubin Russian River Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Bright cherry, cranberry, and raspberry aromaswith hints of dill, fennel, and spice. The bouquet is rounded out with sweet vanilla and berry flavors, with a balanced and elegant finish. This very approachable wine offers mouth-filling, yet soft, tannins. Ripe fruit flavors are complemented by bright acidity and a gentle oak mid-palate.
Review: "This is a clear, bright and light-bodied red,the grapes grown on the producer's estate. Earthy mushroom, forest floor and black tea provide a savory backdrop that remains fresh in the glass thanks to buoyant acidity."

Name: Mullan Road Red
TastingNotes: Initial aromas of fresh black cherry, cassis, vanilla bean and juniper berry make way for deeper scents of sweet blackberry pie and dried strawberry. The palate offers concentrated flavors of blackberry, blackcurrant and dark cherry with a touch of spice. ItåÕs framed by firm but silky tannins for balanced elegance.
Review: "The 2015 Columbia Valley Red Wine opens in the glass with aromas of cassis, plums, sweet spices and burning embers. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, deep and layered, with lovely concentration, an abundance of fine-grained tannins and a pure, penetrating finish. A blend of 49% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Merlot and 17% Cabernet Franc, 3,570 cases of this excellent red were produced."

column1: Fruit forward with notes of peach and nectarin<!--This content belongs to bevnetwork.com and THEWINEBUYER-->e complemented by tropical fruit aromas and a hint of citrus. A creamy mouthfeel and subtle tones of vanilla seamlessly frame this medium-bodied wine.

Name: Prospector Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Fruit forward with aromas of soft, jammy, red fruits. Subtle hints of vanilla and mocha deliver a plush mouthfeel and a balanced, smooth finish.

Name: Prospector Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Displays aromas of ripe red cherry, strawberryjam, and fresh raspberry that are complementary by subtle hints of oak and vanilla to create a well-balanced, smooth mouthfeel.

Name: Dos Almas Grand Reserve Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "A bright but smoky sauvignon blanc with plenty of nice citrus character, this is refreshing and well balanced with quite a long, crisp finish. Drink now."

Name: Tyrrell's Hunter Valley Shiraz
Review: "Crushed and destemmed, open-fermented, pressed to large-format used casks.  This is a rich yet tightly managed wine, placing all the emphasis on fruit, precisely that which should be done, especially in a year such as this.  If you buy it now-and you should-put not less than 50% in the cellar, and have a glass on me, recalling it only cost $25.  Gold medal Hunter Valley Wine Show."

Name: Quinta da Lixa Pouco Comum Alvarinho
Review: "This rich and golden colored Alvarinho is intense and very attractive with flowers and tropical fruits on the nose. Stone fruit, pears and golden apples on the palate with well-balanced crisp acidity. Drink now."

Name: Vins de Vienne Les Barcillants Cornas
Review: "Shows ample richness for the vintage, with fleshy layers of steeped boysenberry, raspberry and plum fruit that roll through, underscored by a smoldering charcoal note and lifted through the finish by a bright bay leaf accent. Not shy with the toasty frame, but everything is in balance. Best from 2018 through 2029. 330 cases made."

Name: G-11 Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Prune and spice-cake aromas suggest a richly roasted wine. A massive palate with saturated weight and density delivers blackberry, chocolaty oak and pepper flavors in front of a finish that's a bit fiery. Drink this power-packed Valencian Cabernet through 2022."

Name: La Bruja de Rozas Comando G
Wapisa Patagonia Malbec
Review: "Glossy ripe aromas of blackcurrants, cedary oak, dark cherries and menthos make a bold impression. The palate has a very plush, succulent and soulful feel with smoothly rendered tannins, carrying long into the unwavering finish. Drink or hold."

Name: Introvert Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: "Elegant & balanced, this Cabernet Sauvignon offersripe cherry, plum and currant flavors that unfold nicely on the palate. Mocha & spice are found on the long, integrated finish."

Name: Proemio Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The aromatics on this Cabernet are very pretty with citrus, orange peel, blueberries, violets and lavender, as well as clove undertones. The palate is also finely flavored and textured with a delicious savory streak that really makes you want to drink and enjoy this. Medium to full body and long on the finish. Vibrant. Drink now."

Name: Proemio Barrel Selection Mendoza Red
Review: "The blend is Malbec with Syrah and Merlot, and thenose is earthy, with heat and grainy oak along with blackberry notes. A lush, rich, supple palate features earthy, leathery blackberry flavors with coffee and bacon notes coming from the barrel. Smooth and long on the finish; drink through 2021."

Name: Matias Riccitelli Hey Malbec
Review: "The most impressive progression in the last few years could be that of MatÌ_as Riccitelli. It's always interesting and fun tasting with Riccitelli, who this year showed me some new bottlings and the consolidation of some labels that were new the previous time. His business has grown to 400,000 bottles per vintage, and the quality keeps going up. When you can grow quality and quantity at the same time, it means you must be doing something right. Riccitelli is one of the names to really follow in Argentina, one of the greatest progressions in the last few years and one of the more exciting portfolios I tasted in Argentina in this roundåÓ.

Name: Matias Riccitelli The Party Malbec
Review: "A new, fresh unoaked Malbec from the Valle de Uco.It's very balsamic and has tons of aromatic herbs in a way that makes me think of a vermouth. It's spicy and has a medium-bodied palate with serious balance between tannins, alcohol and acidity, enough to make it easy to drink but not banal. Really tasty. A great debut."

Name: Vina Zorzal Garnacha Navarra
TastingNotes: This spunky Garnacha smells like fruit punch with some green herbs mixed in. The palate is wiry and acidic in feel, with raspberry and plum flavors. It finishes fresh and zesty.

Name: Vina Zorzal Graciano Navarra
TastingNotes: Clove and licorice gum drop aromas are oaky and forced. This Graciano, typical for the grape type, is crisp, raw and snappy in feel. Flavors of woody red plum and raspberry finish resiny, salty and minty.

Name: Octopoda Russian River Chardonnay
TastingNotes: Offers notes of white flowers, grapefruit, baked apples, buttered popcorn with a beautiful toasted oak finish.
Review: "Delicious! This well-balanced Russian River Chardonnay offers fragrant aromas of apples, pear and floral expressions. Complex, boasting flavors of citrus, apples, peach, fig, honey and spice. Refreshing with depth and a persistent, creamy finish."

Name: Fly By Zinfandel
TastingNotes: This Zinfandel is a rich purple-garnet color with aromas of black fruit, baking spice and a hint of soft oak. Flavors include ripe blackberries and cherries, cloves, vanilla, and white pepper. Smooth with good structure, rich tannins and a long finish.

Name: Tiberio Montepulciano
TastingNotes: Good bright red. Vibrant aromas of red cherry, raspberry,licorice and minerals, complicated by delicate hints ofspices (coriander, cumin, tarragon).åÊThen very silky on thepalate, but displaying outstanding lift and intensity to theflavors of red cherry, pomegranate, flowers and tar.åÊVerysuave but juicy and fresh Montepulciano dåÕAbruzzo winewith none of the heaviness that often drags down wines ofthis variety. The finish is suave and bracing and shows a delightful light touch.

Name: J. Christopher Pinot Noir Volcanique
Review: "Expressive raspberry, orange peel and violet aromas open to refined cherry and black tea flavors that take on structure and richness toward polished tannins. Drink now through 2025."

Name: Arnaldo Rivera Ravera Barolo
Review: "A more savory, slightly tarry, coal-smoke nose. Overall, a handsomely ripe Barolo that has a wealth of darker fruit aromas and flavors with a firm but stylishly balanced palate. Long, rich cherries abound and thereåÕs an enduring sense of balance here. Impressive power and focus. Try from 2022."

Name: Suvali Chardonnay
Review: "Apples, citrus andhints of oak aromasare foundon thenose. On the palate,this Chardonnayoffers green apples,pear, bananas,apricot with hints ofvanilla and butter.Medium-bodied witha creamy texture andlingering, freshfinish."

Name: Suvali Pinot Noir
TastingNotes: Scents of Rainier cherries, coriander and saffron. Flavors of pomegranate and zesty turmeric with creamy nuances.
Review: "Well balancedcombining crispacidity with richfruit flavors of wildberry, strawberryand cherry. Themid palate givesway to some spice,vanilla and softtannins on asmooth lingeringfinish."

Name: Clos des Lunes Bordeaux Blanc
Review: "This has a good juicy edge, with a mix of pear, green almond and lime flavors, lined with a verbena note. A flash of quinine through the finish gives this some cut."

Name: Empezar Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "An attractive, youthful and vibrant Cabernet Sauvignon from Maipu. Big aromas of red fruits, pomegranate and plums give this medium-bodied red intensity without the alcohol overpowering the fruit. Six months in French oak rounds out the tannins."

Name: Empezar Malbec
TastingNotes: Ripe black-plum aromas veer towards prune without fully going there. A full chewy palate holds blackberry and plum flavors, while this finishes oaky and lightly herbal. Overall, this captures much of what's good about Mendoza Malbec.

Name: Empezar Red Blend
TastingNotes: InThis exceptional blend is the result of the maturity and red color of Malbec, the aromatic complexity of Cabernet Sauvignon and the personality of Petit Verdot. Its aging in French oak barrels improves and balances this blend making it a great wine

Name: Vasse Felix Filius Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Opens with a fresh green accent reminiscent of tomato leaf and sage, giving a savory, peppery note to the plush, velvety cassis and plum core. Finds balance between grace and power, with spice and herb elements lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2028. 800 cases imported."

Name: Block 924 Howell Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Another great CabernetSauvignon from theprestigious appellation ofHowell Mountain!Explosive dark fruit ofblackberry, currant,boysenberry and blackcherry combine withsubtle tannins resulting ina graceful, polishedtexture. Finishes withlength and concentrationwith a hint of mocha andanise."

Name: Block 212 Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: The wine has a deep purple color which extendsto the rim of the glass. Flavors of dark chocolate, Black Cherry, and Blueberries would make this Cabernet Sauvignon the perfect pairing with a fillet or rack of lamb,
Review: "Beautifully crafted withripe, rich layers ofplum, dark berry, blackcurrant and blackberryflavors. This OakvilleCabernet Sauvignon isstructured with hints ofgraphite and blacklicorice on a long,detailed finish."

Name: Block 220 Red Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Block 220 Cabernet Sauvignon showcases aromatics ofdeep blackberry, and cedar bolstered by beautiful red currant and a hint of spice. Barrel aged for 20 months, this wine is full-bodied, rich, and balanced with outstanding depth of flavor concentration.
Review: "Notes of black raspberry, cassis, black cherries, anise and graphite all emerge from this perfumed, complex and elegant Cabernet Sauvignon that has medium to full- bodied richness and a firm yet classy finish. Drink it anytime over the coming decade."

Name: Block 218 Horse Haven Hills Cabernet Sauvignon
TastingNotes: Block 218 Cabernet Sauvignon is a full bodied,structured wine boasting rich notes of currents, raspberry, and cedar. Aged 18 months in French oak barrels, this wine highlights the distinct characteristic of Canoe Ridge Vineyard in the acclaimed Horse Heaven AVA Washington State.
Review: "Bright, dark ruby-red in color with plum, dark berries and spices, lifted by a floral touch on the nose. Distinct black cherry, dark berry, violet flavors present on the palate with notes fresh herbs on the serious but suave palate-coating finish. At once big and bold although sophisticated, and built to last."

Name: Zorzal Eggo Tinto de Tiza
Review: "The incredible 2016 Eggo Tinto de Tiza was croppedfrom one of the coolest years in recent times, which provided a slow ripening of the grapes and resulted in wines with higher natural acidity. It's super aromatic, with notes of thyme, oregano, spices and something earthy, like the countryside after the rain. It's young and has an explosive, vibrant palate with electric acidity and chalky tannins. 2016 could very well be the finest vintage to date, one of those vintages that will be legendary. This is just unbelievable for the price."

Name: Casa Natal Reserve Malbec
Review: "Aromas of jammy blueberry and graphite are reducedbut solid. This Malbec has a wide palate that's wall to wall with fruit and tannins. Familiar flavors of plum and berry fruits finish with oak spice, cocoa and leftover red-plum notes. Drink through 2020."

Name: Clos Henri Pinot Noir
Review: "ThereåÕs a wealth of attractive passion fruit here with additional complexity and an underlying thread of zesty, fine and driving acidity. ThereåÕs a lot of interest on the palate and terrific purity at the finish. Drink now. Screw cap."

Name: Octopoda North Coast Cabernet Franc
TastingNotes: Fruity yet restrained with aromas and flavors of cherries, blueberries and violets, backed by leather and peat. The wine is full and complex with tannin and a great mouthfeel.

Name: Block 211 Oakville Red Blend
Review: "This Oakville blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is delicious, with a rich and firm backbone of intense fruit and grainy tannins. Excellent depth and focused with blueberry, black cherry and coffee flavors. Ripe and chewy with a concentrated, sturdy finish."

Name: Single Lot #58 Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "This Cabernet Sauvignon is atremendous value! Ripe, bold andcomplex with dark plum, mocha, blackcurrant, black cherry and herbalflavors. Excellent structure and well-balanced, finishing with cedar notesand gripping tannins."

Name: Single Lot #54 Oakville Merlot
Review: "Dark, rich and concentrated withelaborate fruit flavors ofblackberry, black cherry, blueberryand currant. A hint of mocha isfollowed by some spice giving wayto a smooth persistent finish."

Name: Quinta Das Setencostas Red
Review: "From a small sub-region of Lisboa, this stylish, structured wine is firm and tannic. It has plenty of ripe berry fruit to balance the tannins as well as acidity that cuts through the richness of the wine. It is ready to drink."

Name: Nalys Chateauneuf du Pape Grand Vin
TastingNotes: It delivers a wonderful mix of dark cherries and roasted plum woven together with lavender, expresso, smoked meats and a touch of black olive. On the palate it displays outstanding concentration for the vintage, with a lovely round, velvety texture and soft tannins resulting in gorgeous mouth feel which ends with a long supple finish. Excellent today, but should also evolve over the next decade.

Name: Colene Clemens Dopp Creek Pinot Noir
Review: "Graceful and vibrant, with expressive rose petal, raspberry and crushed stone notes that take on richness and depth toward refined tannins. Drink now through 2026. 3,942 cases made."

Name: Brotte Cotes du Rhone Village Cairanne
Review: "Floral and herbal on the nose, the 2016 Cairanne Creation Grosset is a medium to full-bodied, just-ripe wine with elegant fruity notes of raspberries and cherries. It's silky yet firm, with enough concentration to be capable of aging through 2025. It's a blend of Carignan, Grenache, MourvÌ¬dre and Syrah, aged in a combination of wooden foudres and cement tanks."

Name: Eguren Ugarte Rioja
Review: "Ripe, brambly and juicy with very fresh, ripe berries. Composed palate with a tight core of fine, muscular tannins carrying plenty of flavor. Great composure."

Name: Marco & Vittorio Adriano Bassarin Barbaresco
Review: "Elegant, leading off with perfumed aromas of rose,cherry, strawberry and white pepper. The profile is sleek, with a solid base of acidity and tannins. Shows terrific length, evoking fruit and mineral on the aftertaste. Best from 2019 through 2033."

Name: Fin del Mundo Red Blend
Review: "Freshly-picked blackcurrants, bright morello cherries and herbs as well as very intense licorice. Compact and tight with lots of fresh acidity and a vibrant finish. Drink now."

Name: Renieri Brunello di Montalcino
Review: "Spectacular aromas of dark fruits such as cherries, with undertones of peaches and orange peel and some floral character, too. Full body, layered and rich. Lightly chewy tannins. Incredibly long and flavorful. Makes you want to drink it now but it will age beautifully."

Name: Block 504 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Supple and silky, this luscious Cabernet is loadedwith blackberry, dark plum, currant, cassis and mocha flavors that are woven together nicely. Full-bodied, rich and stylish with ample tannins and a long, full finish."

Name: La Posta Glorieta Pinot Noir
Review: "Blueberry skin, wild strawberries, spices and herbs as well as some orange rind. Medium-to-full body, razor-sharp acidity, fine tannins, some real intensity and complexity with layers of fruit and a very minerally finish. Lots of depth and focus. Drink now."

Name: Pierre Levee Cotes de Castillon Bordeaux
Chamaille Cotes de Blaye Bordeaux
Review: "Showing subtle signs of lovely secondary maturity notes with red cherry and earth tones on the nose, followed by hints of truffle, coffee and baked cherry. Creamy and round in texture, this is drinking well above its price point."

Name: Chateau Saint Roch Roubials
Review: "Matured entirely in demi-muids, the Grenache-dominated (90%) 2016 Roubials boasts knockout aromas of crushed stones, dried spices and black cherries. The Grenache shows its base in black schist, retaining structure and silkiness. Despite being full-bodied and enormously ripe, this finishes long, with a surprising sense of elegance."

Name: Sierra de Tolono White Rioja
Review: "ThereåÕs an apple and pear mix here that has fresh allure on the nose and delivers a zippy and attractively fresh palate that has good weight, flesh and a gently creamy, apple sorbet-like finish."

Name: Sarah's Vineyard Pinot Noir
Review: "The growing season was fairly åÔnormalåÕ with decentwinter rains and bud-break and bloom right on target in the early spring. In our Pinot Noir blocks, the crop size was typical; we carried out shoot-thinning early and dropped a bit of the crop later to keep things focused. Overall, it was a very good year; fruit quality at harvest was very high, with small berries and good color."

Name: Smith & Sheth Cru Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Sourced from two vineyards near Renwick, the 2017 Cru Wairau Sauvignon Blanc comes from vines averaging 25 years old. It's mainly tank aged but kept on lees and released in April following the vintage. This medium to full-bodied wine is round, even voluptuous on the palate, offering up flavors of nectarine, bergamot and fig that ease into hints of orange sherbet on the long finish."

Name: Cantine Valpane Barbera
Review: "Loaded with bright, spicy Barbera fruit this Monferrato version is much more deep and structured, almost like the Barolo that is made from here. Deliciously perfumed with smooth tannins, this is a wonderful value and introduction to the varietal."

Name: Eguren Ugarte Cincuenta Rioja
Review: "This is super modern and very well curated in every sense. Aromas of red currants, plums and mulberries lead to a smooth and supple palate with silky tannins that glide effortlessly through the finish. Drink or hold."

Name: Block 538 Russian River Pinot Noir
Review: "Ripe and complex with a broad mix of well-integrated flavors. Raspberry, blackberry, black licorice, dark plum and spice are framed by dusty berry notes and firm tannins. The finish lingers ending with nice depth and concentration."

Name: Block 556 Russian River Reserve Pinot Noir
Review: "Wonderful depth, richness and focus. It is packed with layers of ripe currant, berry, plum and black cherry flavors that give way to a delicious exotic spice which gains complexity on the lingering finish."

Name: Single Lot #28 Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "Vibrant, refreshingand structured, thisNapa SauvignonBlanc has ripe flavorsof green apple, lime,citrus, honeydew anda touch of pinkgrapefruit. Clean andlively with crispacidity and a finishthat goes on and on."

Name: Octopoda Russian River Pinot Noir
Review: "Complex, with riveting flavors of wild blackberry,raspberry, strawberry and rhubarb. This Pinot has an intense mid- palate that is followed by an exotic spice on a supple long finish. Outstanding!"

Name: Red Domus Cotes du Roussillon Villages
Cambon La Pelouse Haut Medoc Bordeaux
Blancat Parcel Selection Malbec
Review: "Real concentration and elegance on the nose with pure notes of brambleberries, dark-jet licorice, earth, dark chocolate and vanilla. The palate shows exuberant fruit, but it's held together nicely by a tight wall of tannins and driven acidity. A bold style, but this pulls it off with real personality."

Name: Norfolk Rise Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "From the cool climate of Mount Benson located within AustraliaåÕs Limestone Coast, the 2016 Norfolk Rise Cabernet has a deep garnet-purple color with a nuanced nose of cassis, tobacco, cedar and vanilla.  Medium-bodied and juicy, it has nice balance of fruit and acidity with a well- rounded finish."

Name: Rudius Savory Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "From a Howell Mountain estate vineyard located at 1,700 feet above sea level, the 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon Savory Estate is a textbook example of this mountain terroir and offers terrific blue fruits, tobacco, cedar pencil, and crushed rocks. Possessing remarkable purity of fruit, full-bodied richness, integrated acidity, and ample tannin, this beauty has the purity and balance to drink nicely today yet needs a full 4-5 years of bottle age. ItåÕs going to age for three decades. Hats off to winemaker Jeff Ames!"

Name: Masion Castel Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Perro Callejero Malbec
Review: "Serious and harmonious, with a nice mix of flowers, berries and herbs. The palate combines power and elegance and is medium-bodied with fine-grained tannins and a dry, tasty finish."

Name: Domaine Lafond Chateauneuf du Pape
Review: "A classic blend of 80% Grenache and 10% each MourvÌ¬dre and Syrah, the 2016 Chateauneuf du Pape was bottled just six weeks before I tasted it at the domaine. It's loaded with raspberry fruit and hints of baking spices (30% of the blend ages in wood). Full-bodied, supple and lush, it's also concentrated, rich and velvety in texture, with notes of clove and cinnamon lingering on the finish."

Name: Arrowood Knights Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon is deep garnet-purple and gives very pretty notes of crushed red currants, black cherries and black currants with touches of camphor, pencil shavings, lilacs and cigar box. Medium to full-bodied, the palate has a taut structure of grainy tannins and great freshness supporting the muscular red and black fruits, finishing with a lingering minty lift."

Name: Kim Crawford Signature Reserve Sauvignon Blanc
Dos Almas Brut
Review: åÒAn aromatic, flamboyantly floral nose leads to an expressive and open palate, with a tropical and sweet citrus finish.åÓ

Name: Louis Riesling Rheinhessen
Review: "Classic Riesling aromas of tropical fruit followedby a ripe palate of green apple, citrus, pineapple and melon. The slight sweetness on the front end is balanced by a crisp and lively finish."

Name: Gen de Alma Ji Ji Ji Chenin Blanc
Review: "Bottled in late April 2018, the 2018 JI JI JI Chenin Blanc was fermented with the skins in search of more balance, because the wine has a lot of acidity (7.1 grams) and low alcohol (11%), and they wanted a little more structure and weight. This is the first year that the wine fermented in old 10,000-liter oak vats. Bottled unfiltered, it's cloudy and with more on the palate than in previous vintages, salty and tasty with primary flavors and aromas. It has an electric sensation on the palate, a mixture of acidity and minerality, with a dry, chalky feeling. 2017 was a more tannic year, and in 2018 it goes back to more drinkability, reflecting a very good growing season and an evolution in the way this wine is made. I think this could develop in bottle the way a good AlbariÌ±o from RÌ_as Baixas does. Gerardo Michelini told me he recently opened a 2015 and that it was still young and fresh. A more civilized version of this somewhat raw wine within its wild character. 10,000 bottles produced."

Name: Urgency Sauvignon Blanc
Review: åÒFragrant with vibrant aromas of fresh fruit. Focused with bright citrus, pineapple, peach and melon flavors that give way to a wonderful balance of fruit and acidity. The finish lingers with a soft touch of lemon-lime and grapefruit.åÓ

Name: Ceppaiano Violetta Rosso
Review: "Love the tile and berry character in this wine with orange peel too. Dusty texture. Medium body, velvety and flavorful. A Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. Drink or hold."

Name: Chateau Ste Michelle Red Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon
Urgency Pinot Noir
Review: "Dark, rich and layered with an impressive mix of black cherry, raspberry, dark plum and licorice flavors gaining depth on a long finish ending with exotic spice and soft tannins."

Name: Quinta da Lixa Pouco Comum Rose
Review: "Very crisp, dry and without any carbonation. Very attractive with flowers and tropical fruits. These Vinho Verde roseåÕs are all about the acidity and freshness but this one has some great minerality as well. Drink now. "

Name: Block 665 Diamond Mountain Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: åÒIncredibly intense with deep and rich purity of fruit. Layers of crÌ¬me de cassis, ripe plum, blackberry, black cherry and wild berry are focused and concentrated with tiers of black licorice, vanilla and mocha. The complex finish gains depth giving way to firm, yet polished tannins.åÓ

Name: Apaltagua Granate
Review: "A perfect sparkling wine for brunch, with a beautiful pink color and elegant bubbles. The aromas are fruity with notes of pomegranate as well as scents of strawberries and raspberries. Juicy and vibrant, the style is fresh and fun!"

Name: Rudius Farella Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "The 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon Farella Vineyard is one of the most distinctive wines in this range, and also one of the finest I have ever tasted from proprietor Jeff Ames. Savory herb, chocolate, leather, smoke, graphite, licorice and menthol are all amped up in this beautifully layered, sumptuous Cabernet Sauvignon. Napa Valley is full of great vineyards, but Farella stands out for its ability to yield layered, nuanced Cabernets that deliver fruit intensity, structure and nuance. This is a fabulous showing."

Name: Josh Sonoma Reserve Chardonnay
Review: "Rich aromas with notes of melon, citrus and buttery oak complement flavors of ripe melon and tropical fruit. The palate is elegantly balanced with a bright citrus finish."

Name: Josh Lodi Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Big step up in class from the regular Josh label, with extended oak aging and super-ripe flavors of fresh black cherries, blueberries and plum with an extended 30+ second finish, soft tannins and a full-bodied juicy palate."

Name: Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Golden Tier Oregon Pinot Noir
Espino Reserva Especial Chardonnay
Review: "A rather sophisticated, medium-bodied Chilean chardonnay with delicate nectarine and pear aromas, plus well integrated oak and a supple finish. Drink now."

Name: Espino Reserva Especial Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "A quite dense and dark-fruited style with cassis and blueberries and very smoothly arranged, fine tannins that carry well on the finish. Drink now."

Name: Espino Reserva Especial Carmenere
Review: "A stately example of Chilean wine with an elegant bouquet of wild fern, raspberry preserve, smoked bell pepper, and cool menthol. On tasting there is focused restraint favoring subtle berry flavors and wisps of earth over powerhouse fruit."

Name: Three Clicks Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc
Folenvie Rose de France
Review: "Enticing cherry, strawberry and floral aromas leadto a delicious mouthful that is fresh with excellent tension and snappy ripe, dry red berry notes. The juicy, pure finish goes on and on. Superb!"

Name: Vaglio Aggie Malbec
Review: "This is direct and focused with beautiful depth and pureness. Full-bodied and very vertical with impressive purity of tannins and blueberries, crushed stones and salt. Drink or hold."

Name: Morande Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Orange rind, citrus, freshly-picked blackcurrants and a lovely floral edge of violets and herbs. Tight and firm with attractive tension and spice undertones. Polished and focused. Drink now or hold."

Name: Burgo Viejo Rioja Crianza
Review: "A tight red with a dense palate of dark berries and chocolate. Full and reserved, yet polished and energetic. Give it two years to soften. Drink in 2020."

Name: La Casa In Collina Barbaresco
Review: "Fresh blue fruit really pops out of the glass here, as well as glazed cherries, bark, cedar, tobacco and citrus. Full-bodied, very elegant and refined, but boasting a lot of concentration with chewy tannins and a medium-long finish. Drink in 2020."

Name: Grgich Hills Cellars Blue Beret Chardonnay
Review: "A lovely aromatic nose with hints of apple and lemon. The palate possesses a gently coating mouthfeel with flavors of citrus flowers, honey and tropical fruit, with a long finish. A must try for Chardonnay fans."

Name: Espiritu de Chile Reserve Chardonnay
Review: "This is so minerally and quite reductive now with citrus, pepper, rosemary and thyme. On the palate though, this definitely has structure to it with layers of green apple fruit, fresh acidity and a tightly-wound finish. Give this a year in bottle but a taut, delicious style already."

Name: Espiritu de Chile Reserve Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "ThereåÕs a complex, savory side to this wine that has almond-like notes, across a fresh lemon and lime edge. Bold, tropical-fruit palate with a succulent array of fleshy, tangy fruit. Drink now. Screw cap."

Name: Espiritu de Chile Assemblage Red Blend
Block 221 Oakville Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Concentrated fresh black cherry, dusty blackberry,ripe plum and tight currant flavors are at the center. Mocha, cedar and anise follow the delightful fruit flavors giving way to a focused, rich, long finish. A gorgeous Cabernet from Oakville."

Name: Malacara Oak Cask Red Blend
Review: "A dense and layered red with soft and silky tannins and lovely fruit and intensity. Medium-to-full body. Delicious finish. A blend of 80% Malbec and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now."

Name: Los Haroldos Reserve Malbec
Review: "Following up on their impressive showing in last yearåÕs report, this pan-Uco Valley blend includes fruit from all three departments. Perfumed, poised and refreshing, itåÕs my kind of wine, with chalky nuances and a long finish."

Name: Los Haroldos Estate Red Blend
Review: "A big blockbuster of a wine with intense cassis, lots of spicy character with a beautiful freshness. Delicious and rich. 60% Malbec, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Petit Verdot"

Name: Lapalu Vieilles Vignes Beaujolais-Villages
Review: "Superb, bursting from the glass with inviting aromas of cherries, plums and warm spices. On the palate, itåÕs medium to full-bodied, satiny and sapid, with terrific depth and concentration, its lavish core of juicy fruit complemented by considerable savory nuance - proof, if any were needed, that Lapalu is one of the finest."

Name: Menage A Trios Bourbon Cabernet Sauvignon
Iris Mendoza Malbec
Review: "This malbec shows aromas of watermelons, lemons and cherries. Light to medium body, easy and light tannins and a beautiful drinkability for the fresh and balanced finish. Drink now."

Name: Breca Vino de Espana Rose
Review: "This deceptively pale-colored rosÌ© is quite rich, aromatic and dense. Berry, watermelon, spice and vanilla flavors mingle in a plush texture, with just enough acidity to stay focused. Drink now."

Name: Sierra de la Demanda Rioja Blanco
La Lecciaia Sangiovese Toscana
Review: "A pretty Sangiovese with red cherries and cedar. Medium body, fine tannins and a fruity finish. Drink now."

Name: Wapisa Patagonia Sauvignon Blanc
