Review: "Shows apple and lemon character with hints of dried peaches. Full-bodied and flavorful. Very serious. Drink now."

Name: Domaine Ferrando Colombis Chateauneuf du Pape
Review: "This flamboyant, sexy, yet pure and polished barrel sample gives up a huge nose of ripe black fruits, licorice, Asian spices, chocolate, and a building sense of crushed rock and minerality. The tannin quality is first rate, it has a great mid-palate and beautiful balance. Don't miss it!"

Name: Castellare Poggio Al Merli
Review: "The 2013 Poggio Ai Merli is a beautiful wine from all sides. This pure expression of Merlot is generous and round with luscious layers that come forward one soft wave at a time. Perfectly ripened cherry, blackberry, spice, toasted almond and grilled Mediterranean herb form a seamless composition. This is one of the best editions of Poggio Ai Merli that I have tasted. The intensity is stunning and the velvety nature of the mouthfeel is impeccable. It is textured, structured and beautiful."

Name: Kurtz Family Vineyards Barossa Shiraz
Review: "Lively, spice-tinged aromas of cherry and dark berries, joined by slowly emerging woodsmoke and floral nuances. Juicy and focused on the palate, offering intense blackberry and bitter cherry flavors that fan out slowly on the back half. Fine-grained tannins shape the very long, spicy finish, which shows very good clarity and lift."

Name: Diatom Bar-M Chardonnay
Review: "The 2018 Chardonnay Bar-M has an open nose of quince, warm hay, green apple and pear, bakeråÕs yeast, acacia and dried chamomile with white peach and nectarine plus hints of lime peel and crushed stone. Light to medium-bodied, it has a wonderful core of spicy fruit and wicked minerality in the mouth, amplified by juicy freshness and a long, energetic, layered finish. Yum! About 3,000 cases were produced."

Name: Felipe Staiti Vertigo Red Blend
Review: "This co-fermented blend of Malbec, Syrah and Cabernet Franc shows tension and focus with dark berries, dark chocolate and spice. Hints of walnuts, too. Extremely long and solid. This is an inspirational wine. Drink or hold."

Name: Chateau Gaillot Fournier Bordeaux
Review: "An array of bright red fruits and subtly leafy, woody notes dominate the nose. The palate has a bright core of red cherries and raspberries. Smooth tannins and good balance. Drink or hold."

Name: Font de Joubert Cotes du Rhone
le Peche de Neyrat Sauvignon Blanc
Kangarilla Road Shiraz
Review: "The stunning KangarillaRoad Shiraz boastsaromas of black and redcherries, mocha,blackberry and coffee.Big, plump and richlyfruited on the pallet withan abundance of blackfruit and earthyundertones, silky tanninsand a long, savoryfinish."

Name: Kangarilla Road Chardonnay
Review: "Fruit for the Kangarilla RoadChardonnay was sourcedfrom a single vineyard inAdelaide just miles from theWineryåÕs estate in McLarenVale. A fresh, modern stylewith peach and melon notes.Medium-bodied with acreamy palate and a niceundertone of tasty brioche,the wine has a livelybackbone and nice finish."

Name: Kangarilla Road Rose
Review: "The 2018 Rose is a pale, gentle pink incolor with aromas of strawberries and rosepetals. The delightfully textural palate hasfine flavors of citrus and strawberries withsleek acidity and a deliciously dry finish."

Name: Vieux Telegraphe Chateauneuf du Pape Blanc
Review: "Ripe and rich, but focused, with verbena, bitter almond and wet stone notes threading through the core of creamed yellow apple, pear and melon flavors. Very long, with a gorgeous salted butter echo."

Name: La Crema Yamhill Carlton Pinot Noir
Jean Milan Symphorine Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
Review: "Offers up a bright bouquet of apple, white flowersand crushed rocks, followed by a medium to full-bodied, crisp and racy palate that's tight-knit and mineral in profile, with lovely purity and structuring extract."

Name: Thread Count Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "From the famous Winemaker JosephWagner! This outstanding Napa CabernetSauvignon is opaque purple in color followedby a ripe nose of blackcurrants, floral scentsand licorice. On the palate, this wine offersplenty of cassis, strawberry, rhubarb, mocha,dark licorice and blackberry flavors.Concentrated, dense and full-bodied with along finish and a hint of spice."

Name: Thread Count Santa Maria Pinot Noir
Shannon Ridge Circle O Cabernet Sauvignon
Piattelli Trinita Grand Reserve Red
Review: "Blackberry, blueberry and hints of vanilla follow through to a full body, chewy tannins and a flavorful finish. A big wine but shows tension and tannin backbone. Drink now or hold."

Name: Kuhnel Moulin-A-Vent
Review: "The 2015 Moulin A Vent CuvÌ©e Vieilles Vignes, agedin cement vat, has a lovely cassis and kirsch-scented bouquet that is pure and sensual. The palate is medium-bodied with smooth, almost silky tannin, bursting with luscious red cherry and raspberry fruit laced with white pepper and Asian spices. The acidity keeps everything focused and controlled, the finish maintaining precision with impressive persistence. Very well crafted and sure to give so much drinking pleasure over several years."

Name: Sans Liege The Offering Red
Review: "Distinctive, refined and well-built, offering expressive black cherry, cigar box, green olive and cured meat accents that build richness on the long finish. Grenache, Syrah, MourvÌ¬dre and Viognier. Drink now through 2026."

Name: Gen del Alma Ji Ji Ji Red
Review: "The explosive and showy red 2018 JI JI JI made me think of a Morgon as soon as I put my nose in the glass. It's still the same 50/50 blend of Malbec and Pinot Noir from Gualtallary and feels more serious and somewhat less wild, more about the place than the fruit. It has some chalky tannins, and it feels very mineral and fresh. Delicious and a real bargain."

Name: Jas du Lauzon Luberon White
Review: "Grenache Blanc is brightened by small doses of Clairette and Ugni Blanc in this moderately full-bodied white blend. The palate is juicy and almost tropical in flair, suggesting crisp gooseberry and grapefruit along with notes of passion fruit and pineapple. It's an elegant but fruity wine with a lingering almond finish."

Name: Stone Paddock Hawk's Bay Sauvignon Blanc
Vite Colte Moscato d'Asti La Gatta
Review: "Luminous golden straw-yellow. Rich, expressive aromas and flavors of ripe pear, sage, mint and honey. Dense and juicy but with very good freshness to the floral and fruit flavors. Finishes long and suave."

Name: Marquis d'Alesme Margaux
Review: "Deep garnet-purple colored, it leaps from the glass with gregarious notions of plum preserves, crÌ¬me de cassis and Black Forest cake with hints of potpourri, star anise, menthol and tapenade. Full, rich, firm and grainy, with fantastic freshness lifting the densely packed palate, it has a long, beautifully fragrant finish."

Name: Thomas Labaille Sancerre Rose
Review: "A rosÌ© made with a purpose, this isintriguing, tense and delicious. Full offloral and mineral notes to accompanydry, crisp strawberry fruit. Snappy,long and crisp on the finish with morecomplexity, cherry and a waft of aseabreeze. Love it."

Name: Los Bocheros Cabernet Sauvingon
Review: "A vibrant and fresh, red-fruited cabernet that hasfresh, lithe tannins, carrying nicely cut fruit on the finish. Drink in the next four years."

Name: Los Bocheros Malbec
Review: "This has a rich and concentrated feel with a wealth of very juicy, attractive and fleshy fruit that delivers a bold, impressively fresh palate, packed with blueberries and plums. Drink or hold."

Name: Los Bocheros Red Blend
Review: "Big blackberries and blueberries with hints of cocoa powder and dried herbs on the nose. But on the palate the wine is not as massive as the nose suggests and has nice juiciness and crisp acidity, the rather soft tannins already well integrated. Drink now."

Name: Wapisa Patagonia Pinot Noir
Review: "A fresh and clean pinot noir with fresh strawberries and hints of flowers. Medium-bodied, crisp and vivid. Beautiful finish. Shows focus and finesse. First pinot from here and shows potential. Drink or hold."

Name: Amalgama Red Blend
Review: "This is a very meaty and delicious red that shows dark plums, pressed violets, fresh herbs and citrus. Very finely grained on the palate which is taut with vibrant acidity and a savory finish. A blend of cabernet and syrah. So drinkable now."

Name: Marco & Vittorio Adriano Bassarin Sanadaive Barbaresco
Cloud Cove Sauvignon Blanc
Review: "The 2018 Cloud Cove Sauvignon Blanc is scented of ripe peaches, passion fruit and pink grapefruit with a complementary grassy undertone.  Light to medium-bodied, it fills the palate with lively tropical and herbal flavors, finishing long and savory."

Name: Gran Sasso Sangiovese
TastingNotes: Bright ruby red with a bouquet of strawberry and cherry. Cherry and dark fruit flavors with spice tones throughout. Soft, light and well balanced.

Name: Marcoux Chateauneuf du Pape
Review: "Features a solid core of macerated blackberry, black cherry and black currant fruit flavors, laced with energetic, brambly grip and backed by mouthwatering licorice snap and iron notes. Should unwind nicely. Best from 2016 through 2023. 350 cases imported."

Name: Aplanta Red Blend
Review: "From the warm Alentejo in southern Portugal, this well-structured red shows a ripe core of glazed cherry and blueberry flavors, with undertones of black pepper and tobacco. Great Value. Drink now through 2022. 3,300 cases produced."

Name: Block 205 Red Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Multilayered with finesse and structure. This dense Cabernet Sauvignon offers expressive fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry, blackberry and pomegranate. Earthy, with a hint of spice followed by fine tannins on a long expansive finish."

Name: Block 1031 Walla Walla Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "A great price for aCabernet Sauvignon ofthis quality! A mouthfulof gorgeous cherry,plum and currant fruitfollowed by savorynotes, spice andpolished tannins arefound in this deliciousBlock Cabernet fromWalla Walla. Drink nowor within the next fiveyears."

Name: Block 043 Napa Valley Fume Blanc
Review: "A lovely fragrant Fume Blanc with floral aromas which give way to delicious flavors of ripe melon, fig, lemon blossom and mineral nuances. Refreshing with a terrific balance of acidity and fruit ending with a tropical edge on a finish that sails on and on."

Name: Quinta Dos Murcas Minas
TastingNotes: The nose of this wine has character with aromas such as dark chocolate, blackberries and wildflowers. Bright blackberry and cherry flavors pop on the palate, followed by a saltiness. It has a rich, slightly tannic mouthfeel. The finish is relatively long and mouthwatering.
Review: "Elegant and big withintense aromas of ripered fruits and hints ofwildflowers. Fresh andlively on the palatewith juicy chewy redfruits. Powerful andfirm tannins with well-balanced acidity.Mouth-watering finish."

Name: Quinta Dos Murcas Margem
Review: "Foot-trodden grapes and wood aging make this an impressively opulent wine that is built by a strong grip of tannins and rich berry fruits. The dense texture and powerful fruitiness indicate a wine that can age. Drink from 2022."

Name: Guido Porro Gianetto Barolo
Review: "Porro's 2013 Barolo Gianetto is quite pretty. Orange peel, cinnamon, spice and dried flowers give the Gianetto a decidedly exotic feel. Medium in body and gracious, with a lovely sense of translucency, the 2013 is nicely done and undeniably attractive. It is also the most pliant and accessible of Porro's 2013s."

Name: Josh Lodi Zinfandel
TastingNotes: Complex scents ofdark-fruit,Pepper, clove, andvanilla leap from theglass. The palatefeatures flavors ofblackberries,cardamom, blacklicorice with notes ofchocolate. The finishlingers with hints of oakand spice.

Name: Clos de Napa Cabernet Sauvignon
Review: "Well-balanced with complex,beautifully focused tiers of blackcherry, dark berry, crÌ¬me de cassis,black licorice and mocha flavors.Everything comes together nicely on along and full finish. Well-proportionedand not too tannic, this Cabernet isremarkably accessible and polished."
